Reviews.Title: “Watch out if you make a mistake!!!”
Reviews.Author: 202Traveller
Reviews.Content: Yes I made a mistake and booked a day wrong, booked 3 rooms for November 2012, yes November this year and instead of booking the 31st and the 1st I booked the 1st and the 2nd. I realized my mistake about 2 hours after I made the booking and contacted the hotel. They said they were very sorry but if I wanted to change this booking I would have to cancel pay the 1100 euro and rebook for the dates that I want. Yes you heard me right I have to pay for the whole booking so that means paying for the same night twice??????? first to cancel the whole booking and then the other night so my booking went from 1100 euro to 2200 euro. Well obviously I will change my plans and be in the hotel on the dates I originally booked. However I will not spend one extra cent while I am there and I will never book another night with an NH Hotel ever again. Beware......they are right!!!!! it did have a no cancellation policy BUT this was hours after the original booking it was months before the actual booking and I did not want to cancel the booking just change it by one day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Krasnapolsky as a 5 star hotel and when we checked into our hotel room late in the afternoon on a dark day and were initially dissapointed with the decor of the room, whcih although a good size looked as if it hadn't been refurbished since the early 80's. When we woke the next morning to full sunshine you could see the remnants of dried vomit stains all over the carpet. This was absolutely disgusting and to let it out to a family was even more shameful. However, the staff were excellent and moved us to a more acceptable room. For any hotel to let out rooms of this standard at any price is shocking. They should undertake an immediate rerurbishment of all sub-standard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice enough room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: neuatomic
Reviews.Content: Stayed with girlfriend mid-April. The hotel is located on Dam Square, directly across from the war monument. Due to its location on the Square and abutting (in the back) the red light district, expect a lot of tourists and the bars and restaurants in the immediate area charge tourist prices. It makes a great base of operations for foot tours of the majority of the city. We had no problem with noise at night (room on 3rd floor facing courtyard), and generally everyone was well-behaved. The room was quite large by European standards - King size bed, closet, minibar, etc. Bathroom was large with separate tub and shower and toilet stall. The lobby was nice and the cafe, bar and restaurant appeared upscale though we didn't use them. They do charge for internet usage on a two-tier basis: business (higher bandwidth) and economy. The economy 'version' worked just fine for web-surfing and Skype phone calls so skip the more expensive business option. It's a ten minute walk to Central Station and the various tour options, ten minutes to the less-touristy and quite nice Jordaan neighborhood, Anne Frank house, etc. I'm not convinced its a five-star property, but it served as a great base of operations for visiting most of the city and was easy to navigate from. Generally found the staff to be friendly and accomodating (they took off a mistake charge for the minibar with no fuss at all). Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but souless and a bit tatty”
Reviews.Author: AndrewJKatz
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference. The hotel was hideously crowded with a river cruise party and a bunch off peanut specialists (seriously). Wifi was very expensive and flaky. Queues for reception were long, but the staff were friendly and helpful (and upgraded me to an executive room). The exec room was fine, and surprisingly large, but wasn't a very comfortable place to me. The room overlooked the Dam Square, which is busy 24 hours a day. I'm not bothered by urban noise, but if you are, you may like to think again. I stayed here because my conference was being held here, but otherwise I'd rather be at a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: tar182
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the very center of Amsterdam. Most attractions are within walking distance such as Anne Frank House, Jordaan and Red Light District. We stayed in a junior suite room which is very spacious and recently renovated. The decoration is simple but the furniture is nice and useful as well as the bathroom that has a large jacuzzi. Anyway, I think this hotel is likely 4 stars instead of 5 stars claimed by the hotel. Apart from friendly staff and location, room cleaning should be improved whereas the room rate is a bit overpriced. Keep looking for a flash sale in NH website for 50% discount.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but had higher expectations”
Reviews.Author: CamLovesSun
Reviews.Content: First off the location for this hotel is perfect. Couldn't get any better. Right on Dam Square, minutes from bars, coffee shops, red light district and shopping. I have wanted to stay at this hotel for a while but we always ended up staying elsewhere. I was adamant that we stayed here this time. I was a little disappointed with the rooms. We stayed in a superior room which had just been renovated. It was clean and new, but I found it very cold looking, small and just pretty basic. I cant imagine what the standard rooms looked liked. For example there was hard wood floors with no rug, and room was all white. I like minimalist but the way it was done just looked like not much expense went into it and seemed very bare. If it was a 4 star hotel and I walked into that room I would have been perfectly satisfied, probably even pleased. It is a 5 star hotel but definitely more of a 4 star. However the location does make up for a lot. The breakfast was fabulous and had a great selection and was served in a lovely conservatory. The apple pie at the restaurant is also to die for! Best I have ever had! Reception staff were very friendly. Parking ridiculously expensive 55 Euro a night (we stayed for 5 nights), but that serves me right for taking a car into Amsterdam Centrum! I would stay here again if I found a good deal, but if I am looking for a 5 star experience I would choose a different hotel. I will always go back for the apple pie!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T PAY TWICE”
Reviews.Author: GARRY P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had prebooked the hotel rooms on easytobook. One resevation had two rooms with queen beds while the other had one room with two twin beds. All three rooms had been prepaid and I had my confirmation showing the rooms had been prepaid. Upon my arrival I was informed that I still owed for one room. If I did not have my paper work I would never had gotten in the rooms. As we checked out, I was then told that I still needed to pay for the room which they still beleived had not been paid. If you book, take all your paper work.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than average”
Reviews.Author: Barbara D
Reviews.Content: Like reviewers point out below, there's nothing special about this hotel other than the location, situated right at Dam Square, a few minutes away from the Red Light district, and just a few blocks away from the Anne Frank House. My friends and I were grateful for its proximity to most major tourist attractions, but I think we would have been able to reach these places regardless, since bus lines run through Amsterdam anyway. For one night, we spent 150GBP. Personally, I didn't think there was anything at this hotel that you couldn't get anywhere else. The room was clean and comfortable, but it wasn't anything overly special. I also didn't appreciate the loitering that occurred in the hotel lobby by people who were clearly not guests at the hotel - it got pretty noisy and crowded to the point that they littered the lobby and basically caused a ruckus, while the hotel staff did next to nothing about it. I will note, however, that the service we received from the front desk and concierge was fabulous. They were friendly, courteous and were quite comprehensive with answering our questions - suggesting tourist sites, going through the map for us, suggesting clubs for people our age, and tips on other places to visit. Wonderful, friendly service, which is always a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graeme H
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star hotel. Booked a double bed found out it was two singles pushed together (twin). We had booked with in with our 3yr daughter and the room was facing the street, very loud and did not get a good nights sleep all weekend. Hair dryer in the bathroom never worked. Gym inside hotel open for a limited time. Booked wake up call for departure and it never happened. Every time went to reception there always seemed to be someone complaining. Wi-fi should be free in all rooms instead you had to buy time on it.. CRAP! Although great location....

Reviews.Title: “Great location- AMAZING breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: DickSizemore
Reviews.Content: Fantastic high end hotel in Amsterdam, room service food is excellent, and the bar staff really know their stuff and can make some amazing drinks. The breakfast in the winter gardens is incredible, one of the best, if not the best breakfast buffets I have had outside the US.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel- Best location”
Reviews.Author: Shira_Zaid
Reviews.Content: I cant say anything bad about this hotel! You cant ask for a better location since the hotel is right in Dam Square! The hotel is beautiful and very classy and the room was lovely and very clean. The only thing i expected from this hotel and wasn't available is free wireless connection.. You get only 30 min for free for the entire time that you stay in the hotel and only from the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory - expensive for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: leighmcdonald
Reviews.Content: Probably was once a 5 star hotel - but tired now - chipped bedroom furniture, mildew and mould in bathroom. However, the room was extremely spacious and the bed was incredibly comfortable. We found the hotel extremely busy - conferences, meetings and a bit in personable. I think if you want to stay in the centre of Amsterdam for convenience then this may be for you. Amsterdam is a city that you can easily walk around and we saw a lot of stylish boutique hotels which were cheaper and smaller and in hindsight more classy and more our style. Having said all this it was adequate and comfortable and 'nice'.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with super service”
Reviews.Author: Donsque
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky , the staff where lovley and helpful and the room was very comfortable with all the little extras you would expect from a hotel of this rateing. The breakfast is wonderful, and the choice second to none. This was our second stay in this hotel and would not hesitate to book in again.

Reviews.Title: “First-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: erinor
Reviews.Content: Had 4 excellent nights here, great location in Dam Square. Room was spacious and comfortable, breakfast was unforgettably delicious and what a fantastic breakfast room. Service was good and polite, great value and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator 5 for excellent city views”
Reviews.Author: Brewski00
Reviews.Content: This hotel at Dam Square is about as central as you can get. It is a short walk to most everything. The service is really good and they took care of getting me a taxi early the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service but.... All comes to a price!!”
Reviews.Author: Stefouska
Reviews.Content: My experience to Krasnapolsky hotel was amazing! I got a great offer for the deluxe room with 25% discount! The location of the hotel was the center of Amsterdam and it had many shops, amenities and restaurants neaby! The service was really good but when I asked for another floor room than first floor with view on dam square, they said thet didnt have enough rooms of that type. The food service was tasteful and I had to check out on Sunday at 5- which was great because of my late flight. Unfortunately, I got food poissoned and I asked them if I could use the room until 18:30 and they said yes!! What's more, another good recommendation is the breakfast prices; as you should know its 30 euros pp, therefore I found a place called Renee On Damstraat with fantastic pasties and sandwiches and coffees, in logic prices! Overall, it was a very good hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessMarijaB
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a good hotel. We were here for business - so can't say if we'd have chosen it if we had been traveling for leisure. Pros: The location of this hotel is perfect. Walking distance to so many things in Amsterdam. The front desk staff is very helpful and welcoming. The lobby area is very busy, but a comfortable place to sit and enjoy the complimentary wifi. Our hotel room was huge. We enjoyed having an electric kettle, plenty of drinking glasses and a mini bar. The conference facilities were great! Good coffee/water/snacks/meals. Cons: Our bathroom needed updating. The floor and walls seemed dirty since the tiles/floor is older. There was a very bad smell (mold maybe?) in our hallway outside our room. The hallway had windows which were open to help ventilation, but for people with allergies this is not ideal. Our upstairs neighbors were so noisy. We could hear everything - especially from the bathroom. Our last night there was noisy until 5am. (But it was also St. Patrick's Day...) The breakfast is so, so overpriced! There are many options so if you're a big eater then you may be able get your money's worth. Earlier in the day is best since the food seems the freshest. There are some great restaurants close by though. So much better to go out for a nice meal - including wine - for much less than the price of breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Krasnapolsky Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gpricepkftexas
Reviews.Content: Stay here during a business confernece and we found the hotel to be very good. Our room was very nice and the meals we had during the conference were good as well. From a sightseeing standpoint it was central and allowed us to walk to most of our destinations and we found this quite enjoyable. We had room with a balcony overlooking a street. A newer wing of the hotel. One of the Concierege's made a great recommendation for a local establishment to eat breakfast while our room was made ready. I was very impressed with the entire stay. I had no issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “The Grandest of yesteryear. Location location location”
Reviews.Author: VangeInternational
Reviews.Content: The Krasnopolsky has a long and wonderful history, right in the centre of Amsterdam, on the Dam, directly opposite the Royal Palace and across from the Nieuw Kerk and the very Wonderful shopping Department store De Bijenkorf. The winter Garden of this hotel is exciting and one can imagine what it was like when people dressed up for dinner and ladies wore grand hats, the building still has that feel, and maybe to much so, some might regard it as old and tired, but it wouldn't be easy to modernize this hotel without starting from scratch and they would never survive closing it down for two years, so the renovations ate superficial. But remember your staying in an iconic nostalgic hotel, where one should be able to say I've stayed there, the service is great, the bell hops very attentive, and the reastaurant great. The winter garden divine and everything is at the door step for tours, the red light district, a short walk to central station and public trams a few hundred meters that will take you all over the city. Madame tausades and the flower markets are all within walking distance. A great location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very central, fabulous breakfast but drink elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Bettyboo1805
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner & another couple in early March. We booked through a consolidator and got a good deal although we could have stayed elsewhere for less. We decided that the additional expense was justified based on the central location, inclusion of breakfast and the grading of the hotel. We arrived about 10am on the first day and when going to the hotel to drop luggage were overjoyed to be able to check in. The rooms were quite minimal but very comfortable with great beds, fab showers, safe, mini bar and huge tv. The air conditioning if the room temp was set high was a little loud but that was a minor complaint. Everything was spotlessly clean. There was a complementary adapter which was a pleasant surprise and a comprehensive range of toiletries. Mini bar works on pressure sensors so if you removed items to place other stuff in the fridge the hotel thinks you have used stuff - beware! Breakfast was served in the beautiful Winter Garden and consisted of. Huge variety of all different types of food from pancakes to fish to bacon to pastries. It was all delicious - luckily it was included in our room rate! If not it was an eye watering â‚¬29 per person! The hotel is very central in Dam square which makes it a great base for exploring Amsterdam and dropping back in to leave shopping or have a quick rest. Centrality comes with a price and it is not a cheap area to drink or eat around unless you look very closely. The hotel does a fab â‚¬7 coffee with assorted biscuits but â‚¬9 for 2 250ml Beers was a little steep. Another great plus for the hotel is the 30 minutes free Internet vouchers for use in the hotel lobby which were very useful. Overall - great visit & fab hotel. Staff couldn't do enough and the location & breakfast were defintitely worth paying a little more. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again or recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotal for both pleasure and business”
Reviews.Author: fettes5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in a year and on both occasions i found it to be as near perfect as it is possible to get,for the price of course! The position was fantastic,bang in the centre of all the action and a stones throw from the rail station too! The rooms were every well presented and the breakfast was excellent. The restaurant was excellent and the food divine! As was the service,not only in the restaurant but throughout the hotel. Overall,i would definitely rate this a good 4+ star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located but a little bit old and expensive”
Reviews.Author: John-Liege
Reviews.Content: NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky is very well located in city center (Dam). This is top to discover Amsterdam. The hotel is not very recent and rooms are quite different in function of the renovated area or the old one. The price is rather expensive (the location I supposed). Breakfast is top and served in a wonderful place. Service at reception is good. No free wifi in the rooms, only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, functional rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelrabbit2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting family in the Netherlands, and the location could not be more perfect. Smack in the center of Amsterdam, we were able to walk with our luggage from the train station, and we walked all around the city, using the hotel as a base. The room is comfortable, not stylish, but pretty basic. There is a bit of noise from the streets, but you kind of expect that in a 24-hour city like Amsterdam. We've stayed at nicer hotels in Amsterdam (the Banks Mansion is very nice), but for the price and location, this was great. If you do need to drive into Amsterdam, they have an underground garage, but be warned--the spots are very tight!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: DJLMidlandsMidlands
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2-night stay in Amsterdam with my wife. The hotel is fantastically located on Dam Square, which is at most a ten minute walk from the railway station. From the outsude, the hotel is nothing special to look at, although I suspect that is more to do with the central location than anything else. Inside, the hotel is smart and clean, albeit perhaps slightly faded in parts. On arrival, we asked if we could have a room upgrade. Whilst this was offered, it was at a cost and we politely declined. We were allocated room 1082, which was located on the first floor. The room was large, recently redecorated and comfortable. The bed was king size - absolutely massive. My only complaint would be that the bathroom was constructed of an opaque partition, rather than having its own walls, so wasn't as private as one may wish. Whilst not a ptoblem for my wife and I, I wouldn't recommend it for a first date! The hotel bar was comfortable, atmospheric and stayed open until after 0100h, so was most impressive. The selection of music was to my taste and the barman was very perosnable. So far, so good. What, you may ask, has caused me to award the hotel anything other than top marks? One little niggle, really, which went some way to spoiling my enjoment of the room. The room above ours was noisy. Very noisy. Crash, bang, thud - I couldn't believe the amount of noise coming from up there. My wife did complain to reception and they said they would send security up to have a word. The noise resumed the following day. I appreciate that the hotel cannot legislate for its guests and that the hotel management has to behave fairly diplomatically, so I'm not making too much of an issue of this. It was my only complaint against an otherwise marvellous experience. Apart from that, the would have received top marks. And I would still highly recommend it. I hope you find this review useful.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: StuartLR
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay. What a location slap bang in the middle of the city fantastic. The staff were very keen to help with any requests. The hotel itself is maybe in need of a little touch up but the rooms were a generous size, the beds were huge which for some one who lives with a bed hog was just the best. The breakfast choice was excellent. We checked in at 09:00 without any trouble despite the early arrival and on the last day we were not due to leave until 21:00 and the hotel staff were more than happy to take our bags after check out time until we returned later in the day to collect. What a fantastic city full of interesting things to do and see. Having had four full days I still feel we have only scratched the surface and we will be returning to this hotel to dig deeper into the wonder of Amsterdam. The canal cruise with dinner is a little pricey but well worth it for a little romance.

Reviews.Title: “TOP HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION IN THE HEART OF AMSTERDAM!”
Reviews.Author: RiadDarNajat
Reviews.Content: Great place! top staff there! Luxury accommodations with fantastic breakfasts! the huge living room with the piano is FAB and very colonial style. Very tasty furniture and great gastronomy on site. you are in the red place and very fun and romantic places around; highly recommended! Cheers! Oliver Behar from Marrakech.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location location location”
Reviews.Author: buster69
Reviews.Content: we are just back from a 3 night stay at the nh grand and would have no complaints watsoever, it is a gorgeous hotel the rooms are spacious and comfortable we had no problems at all and would highly recommend this hotel and we for sure will stay again enjoy amsterdam is so relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Worked Out for Us”
Reviews.Author: kevboom
Reviews.Content: We were concerned by some negative reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor, but it worked out quite well for us. Check-in was fast, and they let us into our room at noon, after a long overnight flight, which was appreciated. The receptionist upgraded us to a "deluxe" room without added charge. Our US Airways vacation package apparently came with breakfast, so we were pleasantly surprised by the large buffet style breakfast every morning included in the hotel rate (eggs, waffles, pancakes, bacon, potatoes, fruit, breads, juices, teas, etc.). The hotel breakfast and restaurants were quite pricey, so you want to be sure to get breakfast included in your rate or possibly eat elsewhere. The breakfast area in the historic Winter Garden was quite nice, like eating in a ballroom or large atrium. We were placed in the Amsterdam Wing adjacent to the hotel in the old Salvation Army building. We really liked this wing, as all the rooms on 4-5 floors were modern and seemed recently renovated. Our fourth-floor room was large and had a great view of a side street leading into Dam Square. The room was well appointed with tv, mini bar, safe, wireless/wired internet access, robes, slippers, plenty of bathroom supplies refreshed daily, ice chest with convenient ice machine on hall, coffee/tea machine with complimentary packets, etc. Television programming was limited, showing mainly news programming in a half dozen languages, and only 3-4 English language channels including BBC 1-2 (i.e., snore). Our room had nice hardwood floors, as well as a big blow-out window that afforded good views, and the furnishings were modern. The bathroom was quite large with a big tub/shower, plenty of room on the vanity, and despite what others have said about water temperature, it didn't seem to be a huge problem. It fluctuated a little, but wasn't that bad, in our wing anyway. I will say this hotel sprawls across several buildings, so it may be a bit of pot luck, depending on where you get placed. The Amsterdam Wing, however, was quite nice. My only real complaint would be the lack of sheets on the bed. The bed only came with a thick down comforter, which was too heavy, leaving you with a choice of freezing with no covers or baking under a parka. Another small complaint would be the Internet access, which is 10 euros per day with limits placed on download/upload, our 17-18 euros per day business class with unlimited data. Speed did not seem to be an issue in the 10 euro economy class, but the limits on uploads were unusual and annoying on vacation, when trying to save a day's worth of images to Flickr. The location of this hotel can't really be beat. There is every type of food imaginable literally underneath the Amsterdam wing--asian, italian, argentinian steak, mexican, croissants, chocolates, etc., with tons of restaurants and tourist shops all around Dam Square. Most tram lines run through Dam Square, so you can get north, south, east, west, very easily. The walk to Central Station would be a bit far with luggage in tow (just under a mile), but it was easy to hop on a tram and go straight to the hotel/station in less than 5 minutes. Great hotel--go for the Amsterdam Wing. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: you cannot beat the location, it is as central as it can possibly be, right in Dam square, close to everything (Amsterdam is a great city to visit walking around). old hotel, with nicely redone rooms and bathrooms. comfortable, quiet, it has all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “High standard of competent professionalism”
Reviews.Author: Redfan99
Reviews.Content: Friendly and efficient check-in. Comfortable room. Good ambiance. Excellent location, esp if using public transport - I used the 48 hour pass which provided very good value for money. Wonderful breakfast in the lovely winter garden - but book this in advance on the internet or else it is very expensive. I booked via Alpharooms.com Friendly and helpful staff. Minor quibbles: tea/coffee facilities included creamer powder, not milk. Hotel's internet is exorbitantly priced: 10 Euros for an hour. I wanted to use the computer, not buy it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: slocker1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. The staff were very attentive and did anything they could to make our stay perfect. The room was all modernly decorated and was really nice. Our bed was so comfortable and big. The hotel was beautiful throughout and the perfect location. We got our breakfast included in the price with travel republic and so glad we did as the breakfast was incredible. The champagne was a nice touch with eggs Benedict, a big bakery selection, pancakes, waffles, the salmon was beautiful!!! This hotel will be used every time we go back to Amsterdam. The hotel do take a deposit on a card of 100 euros and give you it back in cash on departure but that Wasnt a problem as it was just in case we charged anything to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Like a sauna”
Reviews.Author: Andreas H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at a conference in mid feb, the place was like a sauna. Our conference room was 25 degrees and the samw ent for my hotel room. Unfortunaltely that brought down the entire stay. I saw another review that it was freezeing, this time i guess they went the other way. The location is great both for vacation and business, its really in the heart of amsterdam. Would li reccomend it for 250 euor per night, no.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in my coat”
Reviews.Author: Thesilence
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the city center. I was in an apartment, which was decently furnished and well equipped, but beware! You're gonna freeze despite putting the heat to the max. Why? Simple: the windows remained there from an ancient century, letting all the cold from the street enter the room without any difficulty. This would be ok for a two star hotel but for hundreds of eur per night? No way. Otherwise ok hotel, choose it during summers.

Reviews.Title: “Crap”
Reviews.Author: ruterle
Reviews.Content: Fancy hotel, high price, however you'll get only crapy service and cold room. The service was really unbelieveble, everything was an issue. Last day they have by mistake already blocked my card and I had to stay 15mins in the elevator and wait for somebody to come. Nice restaurant, but no real organisation. The only benefit, you're directly in the city center, but for sure there are better places where to stay

Reviews.Title: “Beside the view of the room 3026, the hotel is a bad choice!”
Reviews.Author: MelinDani
Reviews.Content: As a travel maniac, I have been all around the World and mostly in 5* hotels. I have to say this hotel is far away from 5* expect its location and the view from our room. The building is old and not looked after well, the staff is okay, but not really friendly. When I arrived there was nobody in front of the hotel to help me with the luggages. The corridors looks like in the '60's. As well as the design-if you can call it design at all! The bathroom is a disgrace! The toilet and the shower doors are looks like if you were staying in a summer school camp. The lighting is terrible, hardly can see anything, not really good for any makeup, unless you want to look like a clown by painting everything 2-3 cm's away from its places. The bathroom beauty supplies are very week and they smell terrible. There is no conditioner and the soap is sooo tiny, that it melts away after 2 minutes. The room (3026) was overheated, felt like in a sauna, and can't really do anything about it, cos the heating system is old like hell. The water from the shower sometimes burning you and in the other minute it is freezing cold. The only TWO GREAT THINGS about the hotel is the location of it and the view from the room. Other then that nothing! If you get used to luxury travel, this is NOT YOUR PLACE! If you get used to 3 starts hotels, but looking for a great location and a STUNNING view, well, you must come here. The so called king size bed was two twins pushed together....I am really disappointed, especially as we came here to celebrate my Spouse's 40th Birthday.....We payed 10 EUR for the wifi internet which is not working, or if it does, it is sooo slow like a snail, you can't do anything with it at all. DO NOT BUY THAT!

Reviews.Title: “Why all the complaints?”
Reviews.Author: Mr Travels A
Reviews.Content: Having read the trip advisor reviews, like so many people do now prior to any excursion, I was a bit anxious. But why? I arrived half an hour early (I was fully aware of the check in times) and was greeted by a very friendly young Dutch chap. He offered me a free upgrade without me even asking or for an extra Â£Â£Â£ the option to upgrade to a suite. I took the free upgrade but not the suite. I originally book a single and was upgraded to a double. Now if this is what they call a double in Holland I'll come and live here. I am 6 foot 7inch, so struggle to fit in ANY bed, but I couldn't try and make my feet fall out of this bed. HUGE!! The room was great, clean and well appointed. I couldn't fault this hotel. The location is fantastic and breakfast was vast. Faultless. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Amsterdam. 5*

Reviews.Title: “Dam sure it's a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fern192
Reviews.Content: THis hotel, located right on Dam Square in Amsterdam, is a superb palce for a base of operations as you explore the city. Trams run right through the Square and take you anywhere you wish. We went all the way to The Hague and back one day after having seen all of Amsterdam we wanted to. Our only complaint is that breakfast was served in the rear of the lobby of the hotel. This didnt' feel quite right to us. Our room, however, was very good and quiet for sleeping. We would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lancburm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for the first time recently. The location could not be better - right on Dam Square - and I found the service to be excellent. However, the climate control in my room did not function properly and my room was cold most of the time I was there. The restaurant and food quality was very good. The gym was small and cramped but with up to date equipment including cardio and free weights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeVilla82
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, right in the heart of Amsterdam. 10 minutes easy walk from Centraal station, and close to all of the main sights and attractions. Very friendly staff, clean and modern rooms (we stayed in the renovated part of the hotel), excellent breakfast but try to get this incldued in your rate, as it is expensive otherwise. Check out on Sundays is 5pm as standard, which was very welcome

Reviews.Title: “I wonder from where they got the 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: BERNICE A
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, but the service is not at all as expected. The people at reception are slow and can do a better job. Can get a good deal in off peak months and hotel is clean.

Reviews.Title: “What more could we ask for?!”
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam this weekend and stayed in the hotel for 3 nights (advance booking for 313euro for a double room). The rooms were beautifully designed, clean, bright and cozy (we were in the newly renovated part of the hotel). Breakfast was delicious and included anything any nationality needs to start the day with :) Hotel location is as central and accessible as they get! At this price I doubt you can find a better dealâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Try it - you may love it”
Reviews.Author: jimmydash
Reviews.Content: I walked from the Centraal train station down to the hotel in Dam Square. It was just over 10 minutes. I was carrying one overnight bag so the cobbles werenâ€™t an issue. Passed all the touristy shops and decided there was nothing worth returning that way for. On entering the hotel it felt good, nice place, nice atmosphere, very encouraging. I waited about 1 minute to check in. No issues, very friendly gave me a voucher for free lobby wi fi. Multiple free wi fi vouchers were readily available. Went up to room 2024, bigish size, everything was good, no view as such but that just meant it would be quiet I guess. Huge bed, all the fittings worked, separate toilet and bigish bathroom. I love the orangey shampoo and soap. Went down to the bar, nicely fitted out, quite elegant, good staff good service not badly priced, free nibbles. All good. Surrounding area perfect for exploring, very near canals, restaurants, and the red light area if you so desire. Felt perfectly safe, nobody tried to sell me drugs and wasnâ€™t harassed by anyone at any time about going into bars etc.. Great nightâ€™s sleep, no noise from rooms next door. Superb breakfast in the spectacular winter garden â€“ a real highlight. Everything was fresh and plentiful. Loads of space and plenty of staff â€“ I ate far too much. On checkout a 3 minute wait then it was like clockwork. No issues. I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “An odd duck that has its charms”
Reviews.Author: no_map
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night for a recent business trip. In terms of convenience - its hard to beat. It's about a 10 minute walk to the Centraal Train Station (but through cobblestone so make sure your roller can handle that), right in Dam Square and near light rail, restaurants and bars. Make sure to save your Euros since if you decide to take a cab the 0.5 miles to the Centraal train station it will cost you 12.50 EU! The hotel has a classy facade and you can tell that this hotel has been around a very long time. The furniture and architecture of the lobby speak to a bye-gone Victorian era. However, you don't have to live in the past once you enter your room - my room was Swedish modern down to the voyeuristic glass separating the bedroom from the shower. The bathroom is clean and modern although it is odd to have the door that opens to the bathroom double as the door to close the toilet. The room itself is very small - the chair for the desk was literally up against the bed but it worked for a short trip. I had a wonderful view of the room across from me who I am sure didn't appreciate having a neighbor so close. However, this translated to a much quieter experience since the room was away from the noise of the square. Other than the small room, one thing that I didn't like was that internet access wasn't free (a must for a business trip). The breakfast was also quite expensive so I avoided that although I will say that the Winter Garden (in which breakfast was served) is very nice. Other than that, the service was pleasant if not exactly efficient. An interesting option should you need it is that you can stay later on Sundays without extra charge. On other days, you are charged 30 EU for a check out at 3pm. There is also an even later check-out time for even more money (but less than paying for a full night). Quite useful if you like sleeping in or have other business to attend to that will require a later check-out. As other reviewers have stated, stay away from doing any drugs in this hotel or you will be charged a steep fine.

Reviews.Title: “Situated in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Pacholee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Dam square - the most happening place to be in the evenings. Right behind the hotel is the red-light area, across the square is the museum and Madam Tussads. All around the hotel are pubs, eateries and curio shops. The tram bus stop is also right outside. We used to hang out at the Irish pub next to the hotel and enjoy Guinness all evening. Its a very large hotel and while the old part of the hotel still has rooms that seem to be from a 100 years ago, but the service is great, the beds are all new, the bathrooms are clean. During the expo season, the rooms can be very expensive so make sure you plan your stay well in advance. Breaskfast is served in a Winter Garden restaurant which has a transparent room overhead and the restaurant serves a fantastic spread of breakfast to choose from. While everyone understand English there, you may need to speak slowly if you have an Asian accent.

Reviews.Title: “Boys Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BMacedo
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and very comfortable with good service. Shame I wasn't advised about the City Tax.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: asi1973
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great right in middle of Amsterdam, large room, king size bed, great breakfast, even when I got to hotel in 8 in the mooring i got a room and I didnâ€™t have to wait.

Reviews.Title: “A special place for us”
Reviews.Author: TJCABDN
Reviews.Content: We stayed 31st Dec 2011 - 2nd Jan 2012. I emailed the hotel prior requesting a modern refurbished room as have seen some photos of older rooms and wasn't too impressed. Our check in was very quick and efficient. We were asked to pay a 200euro deposit which we were not informed about, we received it back in full when checking out. This was also quick and efficient. I was impressed with the hotel reception, very grand and decorated lovely for the holiday season. Our room was 5087, modern and refurbished, plasma tv and electronic blind. One wall had a huge mural of buildings. We had plenty towels, slippers and bathrobe each. The shower room had 2 shower heads, be careful when turning on as you get a shock if its the wrong head. There was shower gel, shampoo, toothbrush and toothpaste, shaving razor, soap, etc. There was no hair conditioner which i forgot to take. The location of the hotel is the best, 10 min walk from central station and bang in the middle of tourist places, shops, bars, restaurants, coffee shops and the red light district,. We went to the winter garden for breakfast on 1st January, it cost 36euro each but worth it. The best buffet breakfast i have seen, eggs benedict, smoked salmon, pastries, bacon, sausages, ham, cheeses, pastries, cereal, pink champagne! The room itself is beautiful and truly got to be seen to get the full impact. I am maybe a bit biased as whilst having breakfast my boyfriend got down on one knee, holding a ring and proposed :) The grand krasnapolsky hotel will always be a special place for us and we will be returning every time we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: CitySlicker420
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights in December 2011. We had a deluxe smoking room. The room itself was quite standard, bathroom could have used some updating. The staff was very polite and pleasant. At check- in they accepted 50â‚¬/night deposit for the minibar and other possible expenses as we did not travel with a credit card. The breakfast room was absolutely gorgeous and the buffee breakfast itself was very good, with a large selection and an egg station.The location is unbeatable! Right in the center,close to trams, restaurants and shopping. All in all a great experince, we'll be definetely staying here again when in Amsterdam..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmymcmc
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I cant believe I was staying in the same hotel . When we arrived we where upgraded for free without asking as it was my friends birthday . The room itself had a king size bed when I pointed out we had asked for twins we where moved within 5 mins . The reception staff are exellent as was the waiting and housekeeping staff . The room itself was great good power on the shower and very clean . The choice of food at breakfast was second to none and all top quality . I can honestly say that the smoked salmon and roast beef was the best I have tasted . The location is great for everything it just is so central .We had a brilliant trip and the hotel its staff and the location contributed to my best time ever in Amsterdam .

Reviews.Title: “Except the location you cant find anything good there....”
Reviews.Author: Schmidt822
Reviews.Content: Im writing first time, but i promised miself to write a review here... Except the location and the price(200 euro for delux room) you cant find anything good there. The rooms are terrible, coridors are smelling like a toilet and the worst is that you cant take a normal bath because water is going from cold to boiling warm all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel itself is ok”
Reviews.Author: aka.seth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend on a business trip. The location of the hotel is excellent, very central and great for getting out and about to have a look around. This is probably it's main selling point. The hotel itself is so so. The service is pretty good, whether at the reception, in the restaurant, bar or room service, their generally pretty attentive. Room service was always delivered on time and the concierge was great for booking restaurants etc. The hotel itself is old though and in need of some renovation. In fact they have already done some renovation. There is a wing where the rooms have been redone so they are looking pretty good. Even here though, the rooms are not very spacious and the walls are thin so there is quite a bit of noise. All in all I would assume you'd still be better off in the newer, renovated wing so try asking for that if you can. The food was decent enough, more so in terms of the restaurant than the room service, which didn't offer much variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, Recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: alex h
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe. This was our first location of our trip. The initial reaction to the hotel was very positive. It is extremely conveniently located, right in Dam Square. Within Minutes to anything you want to do. This hotel is about 20 minutes from the airport, a taxi will cost you about 45 euro for two people. I would recommend taking a train from the airport to centraal station and walking to the hotel. (about a 9 minute walk, very easy.) Back to the hotel. The staff was friendly however its caos during a busy rush in the lobby. NH World members don't benefit from the membership here other than gaining points. The room looked like it had been recently updated and was clean. The back tower of the hotel does have a faint smell in the halls but its not horrible, the room and lobby didn't though. the location is perfect. Dam square is obviously the starting point for walking to shops and through town. Its about two blocks from the red light district (if thats your thing), within an easy walk to public transportation and places to eat. I would recommend price comparison shopping within the block of dam square to see prices of other hotels, however this one was worth the money and is definately a strong contender. I highly recommend the Iamsterdam card because it allows access to a multitude of museum's a few at dam square. We will return to Amsterdam, however we never stay at the same place twice. I would try to find a hotel within the same area though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mia h
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Amsterdam and we chose this hotel due to its location in Dam square. We did not plan in advance how we would get from the airport to the hotel so we just took a taxi not aware of the time it would take or the cost. It was about a 20 min drive from the airport and was 40 euros. Probably could have been cheaper but we were just eager to get there. The hotel really is in the center of the city. The lobby was okay. Service was slow at check in as the receptionist checking us in was constantly interrupting us to answer the phone as other workers were standing by. The elevators were tucked far away from the reception in an area that looked nothing like the lobby. It was near conference rooms and had a completely different feel. The room itself was very clean and modern. We had a great view. The bed was not very comfortable and the 2 pillows were extremely flat. The shower/tub can be dangerous. I fell getting out of the tub because it is very deep and there are no rugs on the floor or anything to hold on to. It was easy access to the tram system and there are a lot of things within walking distance. I couldn't imagine a better location. I will probably stay at this hotel again when I return because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Amstedam”
Reviews.Author: Tommy G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky in August 2011 as one of the stops on our honeymoon. This was by far our favorite hotel in the 5 countries that we visited. The location is excellent, a 10 minute walk from the station and has all of the shops, food, red light district etc. all in walking distance. The bed was extremely comfortable (which I have found to be a problem in many hotels) and the staff was the most pleasant, nice people I have ever come across. My wife and I will be back in Amsterdam in February and we will once again be staying at this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some high and low points”
Reviews.Author: jwall915
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little bit pricey for what you get - not the best value. Overall, it's a good hotel, but it's not a 5 star. The staff is terrific. They speak perfect English, they are so nice, and they are great about giving directions and helping you find things. The lobby is spacious and gorgeous. The location can't be beat. It's easy to find and right in the center of things. There's a tram stop across the plaza, and you can walk to many attractions from the hotel, including the Anne Frank House, the Red Light District, Old Church, many coffee shops, and de Poizen boot. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. There is a restaurant there, but it's pretty pricey so we didn't partake. The bathroom had some big problems though. When we first checked in, our non-smoking room was fine, but the bathroom absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke. We called down and they sent someone up with air freshener and that did the trick. I found it rather annoying that the cleaning staff didn't notice and do something about that when they cleaned it. The other huge problem with the bathroom was that the shower water temperature would never stay where you put it. First of all, please know that this hotel LOVES its hot water. The hot water was scalding, so not much was needed. However, the shower continually vacillated between pleasantly warm, scalding hot, and freezing cold. With no pattern to anticipate those very unpleasant changes. Needless to say, we took extremely fast showers! Another problem we experienced is that the hallways always smelled like poop. I don't know why, but you were hit with it every time we exited our room. My last complaint is that the rooms had no free wi-fi, and the price for it was exorbitant. I've stayed in enough hotels that provide wi-fi in the rooms to know it's not that big a deal anymore, so a purportedly 5 star place really should provide that with no problem. Even with the problems mentioned, I would probably stay here again. The location is that good.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: g0lden0ldie
Reviews.Content: reception staff friendly and attentive but room service not good.had problem with our room but were moved and offered complimentary breakfast so ok.good location have been to amsterdam on many occasions and have stayed in better hotels at better room rates

Reviews.Title: “Good in every way”
Reviews.Author: Lino2939
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need.... clean spacious and modern rooms (very comfortable beds), efficient and helpful staff, walking distance from the central station, entertainment and restaurants all around. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: manchesteruk d
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for two days on a trip, when i arrived i was happy with the location and the look of the hotel, however the staff was not helpfull and quite rude to us, the room was nice but when we walked in we notice a shower cap covering the smoke alarm and dident think much of it, the next day we asked for the rrom to be cleaned and returned later to find we couldent enter our room ( card wouldent work ) goes to the desk to ask why and they called security ( big angry guy ) who then says leave the hotel because of the shower cap which we dident put there, after a very long arguement he returned and sayes the manager will let you off once but were watching you. ( the big problem with it was it was new year and everywhere was booked ) in general everyone we spoke to was rude

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alice A
Reviews.Content: Had a really fantastic stay here. The staff were helpful & friendly. Loved the Reflect restaurant & the upmarket cafe inside the hotel. Our room had just been refurbished, it was modern & very tastefully done. The location was also perfect. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but brilliant staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Angela W
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in June for 3 nights and found it to be a thoroughly pleasurable experience. Our room was fantastic with a gorgeous view over a canal and we had a complimentary box of chocolates left for us on our enormous bed. The bed itself was the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in and the bathroom was large and well equipped (the shower could spray out eucalyptus oil in the steam!) The staff were faultless - from the reception staff to those in the restaurant we dined in, nothing was any trouble. The only negative was that breakfast wasn't included in our room price - the buffet looked wonderful but there was no way we were prepared to pay 30 Euros each for the privilege. Instead we found a lovely pattiserie just across the road and bought our breakfast there instead! If you have a day when you're wondering what to do, I would strongly recommend going to the Artis Zoo. It's slightly out of the city centre but we spent hours there and still didn't get to see it all, we were too tired to do any more - we'd go back to Amsterdam just to finish seeing the zoo and aquarium!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louis
Reviews.Content: Polite, helpful staff, excellent room, unbelievable breakfast buffet. *****

Reviews.Title: “More creaky four-star than five-star”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend when the prices all over Amsterdam were outrageously expensive. In general Amsterdam is an expensive city for hotels anyway. In any case, what we got certainly didnÂ´t justify the price. Another example of where the star system (which is basically a tick list of amenities and services) does not reflect the reality. On the plus side, our rooms were relatively spacious, the location is excellent, breakfast was good and the dining room is very beautiful. On the downside, it is all rather dated and creaky. The bathroom is shockingly bad for a five-star or even a four-star. Our experience of service was mixed - a friendly and efficient front desk but a grumpy concierge desk. The key factor is the price. For us it definitely was not worth the money. Get a good deal and this will ease the pain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you don't go to bed early!”
Reviews.Author: J0eyC
Reviews.Content: I really did like the hotel and Staff. The location may be the best in Amsterdam. The only bad thing was the party that seemed to be under my room. I actually call the desk to ask "Can I have the disco moved from under my neighbors room to under mine?" He asked if I was bothered???? Ha ha Ha it was almost 12 midnight! Then he said it would be over in 4 minutes. I had to call back at 12:30 to see when the after party was over so I could go to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rich46819
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located to most tourist attractions and a short walk to the train station. The rooms are big, clean and updated. The buffet breakfast was more than you could ever imagine with a huge variety. The hotel staff was very accommodating and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel management”
Reviews.Author: Journeyist
Reviews.Content: Our six night experience at Krasnapolsky was less than stellar. Our flight from the states arrived at 9:30 and we were at the hotel before 11. The "policy" was "check-in at 3" but regardless of the hotel there are rooms that are cleaned and ready to offer before 3:00; NOT at Krasnaspolsky! The day was a rainy one and we simply wanted to catch our breath before starting our explorations. At 3:00 we went to the desk, by ourselves, there was not another guest waiting, and checked in. The policy of making us wait for check-in rather than getting our "rest" in the lobby made no sense. The next afternoon we returned to the room for a nap and found that was the time the hotel had determined to have workers hammering and drilling on our floor. That was capped off two hours later with the testing of each and every room alarm on our floor. The worst was Thursday night. Between the hours of 9 and midnight there was a party in the area immediately below us complete with a band (not good!) that consisted primarily of bass. A call to the desk netted nothing, more like, "Deal with it!"

Reviews.Title: “Lush!”
Reviews.Author: Sami009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room which can usually be a bit cramped and the squash a 2rd bed in but the room we had was soo spacious. Even with three rooms we had more than enough space. The interiors were gorgeous and the view from our room was just stunning. This hotel is in such an ideal location - a bit pricey but worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Conference in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mtlfamily4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in September...Great location and OK rooms...some have been updated and some not...Mine was not...hotel staff were helpfull and always pleasant, great breakfast and again GREAT location!

Reviews.Title: “A nice tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: DennisvdMolen
Reviews.Content: ON the best spot in Amsterdam situated, this hotel gives you everything. Leaving the hotel you are in the centre of Amsterdam. near all the shopping area's musea and all what Amsterdam has to offer. The hotel it self is ok, the rooms are a litlle bit out of date, simple but convenient. The prices are high, but therefor you are staying in the centre. The brasserie downstairs is a nice and excellent place to overlook the damsquare. Upon enetring the hotel, you feel at home, people behind the desk are nice, and helpfull. the parking space for the car is very tight, and expensive!!... For a quick visit to amsterdam this is your palce to be

Reviews.Title: “Location and style!”
Reviews.Author: CoastalGroove
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our weekend stay greatly! Check in was quick and effiecent and we were upgraded to one of the suites in another wing of the hotel. This was a little far but worth it, large room, wood floors, large windows and massive tub. The location is spectacular central walking distance from all major musuems, train stations, shopping and the entertainment district !! Literally only a short walk from EVERYTHING that is Amsterdam! Bar men were very nice and stayed open until we finished. I would return for sure and look forward to trying more NH Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better”
Reviews.Author: mgw911
Reviews.Content: First impressions were very good, with a lovely coffee served while I waited for the check in and check out queues to die down. In the end the queues kept on coming so I joined and checked into the hotel. Check in was swift, easy and very friendly. Just very busy front desk. My room was spotless and well set up, however I was in a separate building and it did seem to have a draught and a little cold. As it was not a proper double bed, the duvet could;t wrap around you to keep warm at night. Check out and staff were again very friendly, good service. Overall, a good stay, great location and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Are you serious?”
Reviews.Author: hibariSanFrancisco Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but this sadly very unfriendly, horribly overpriced hotel with terrible service prompted me to share this experience with others to prevent you from making the same mistake as I did. It's like they are immunized to tourists, when actually it's their job and service to assist guests. Concierge acted like I was bothering them and tried to shoo me away as quickly as possible. Everyone I encountered was unfriendly and didn't want to lift a finger beyond the absolute basic. Location isn't even that great, unless you want to be near the train station... it's more trashy and the bad kind of tourist area. Sigh... I will do more research next time and read my fellow travelers reviews- you know best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sianblanc
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right in the center, the hotel does look like a 5* but the rooms were not really. I think you have to pay more for a nicer room. The only really complaint I had was when we got there we had to queue for ages about 20 mins as they took ages checking people in.

Reviews.Title: “Location, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Tam801
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to check in, they couldn't find our booking. When told that our Travel Agent booked it, we were upgraded (confusing, if they couldn't find our booking, how could they know to upgrade us). Room was pleasant and clean. We needed to refrigerate medication, the mini bar is connected to the reception, so when items are removed it is charged to the room account. We contacted reception to advise that items were removed temporarily. The charges were removed on checkout. An evening meal at Mathildas was enjoyable, a little concerned by the prices on the menu at first, but very nice and a huge serving. The breakfast in their brakfast room was plentiful and also yummy. Some staff seemed stressed and not so pleasant, and others could not do enough for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Cdogruer
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Ä°t seems like 4 star HOTEL , the same menu always in breakfast but clean .....

Reviews.Title: “unusial experience”
Reviews.Author: maxim_dronov
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for a week. A big surprise that they have appartments not only in main building, but in separate real Amsterdam houses. Rooms are really big, well furnished, clean and calm. During reservation check for this opportunity and you will be really surprised. They do not clean it every day, but i really did not ask for it. Internet is TOO expensive, this is bad. But the rest is fine. People on reception and concierge are greet too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Krasnapolsky!!”
Reviews.Author: Paula M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Krasnapolsky for the the last 2 new years eve's!! Both our stays were unfortgettable and loved every moment!! This hotel is very big and lots going on but we have to say out experiance with staff in bar, reception, front door and room service were very helpful and friendly! We had an issue with our room upon check in (They give us key to single instead of double) but once we raised this issue it was solved straight away! Excellent location right on dam square within walking distance of all attractions and the fireworks which go on all day right from the morning :) Great astmosphere everywhere! Will defo be back!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star is Misleading”
Reviews.Author: BWoodrow
Reviews.Content: As can be the case with many European hotels, the star rating system is often based upon the number of amenities instead of how nice the hotel actually is. That being said. The good: Great location, the hotel is located in the heart of Amsterdam and is close to just about everywhere you want to be. However, be careful, the redlight district is literally right around the corner. The amenities - the hotel offers a wide array of creature comforts. The bad: The hotel is not in that great of shape (or at least it wasn't when I stayed). The rooms were musky and the overall decor was rather depressing. That's why I gave this a 3 star rating, you would expect so much more from a 5 star hotel than this.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment, not room - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: firegarden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky for 1 night in October 2011 and absolutely loved it! It could be because we got upgraded to a fully-equipped apartment (bath, shower, kitchenette, laundry) with a canal view :) Check-in was a bit a slow as it was quite busy but we didn't mind because of the upgrade, especially considering that apartments are given out only for a minimum of 1 week. The hotel is ideally located at Dam Square and right across from the hotel was a fair replete with rides and a giant wheel and candy floss makers. Tram stops were a very short walk from the hotel and provided excellent access to the city. Dam Square is a lively area throbbing with energy and activity and in the thick of things. Hotel staff were friendly and very approachable and the apartment was wonderful. It was a bother climbing up a narrow spiral staircase with luggage but once we opened the door, there were no regrets. I will definitely love to stay at the Krasnapolsky again. In fact, even the agent at the IAMSTERDAM tourist centre was excited to hear we were staying there and said it was one of the best hotels in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not really grand, but ok”
Reviews.Author: machalter
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for business. Room was fine, but a bit dated. Good size but sort of sparse and the bathroom looked a bit sterile. Location is amazing, but noisy and crowded. My preference would be to not be exactly at the Dam. Breakfast was really great though.

Reviews.Title: “Odd charm”
Reviews.Author: travnor
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast, lousy rooms with that 80ies feeling. Location is great but what you get- I dont know. Expensive internet-Free wifi should be expected from a 5star hotel-but its more like a 3star

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location but ....”
Reviews.Author: schia48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very good location. Its right at the centre of the city and walking distance to the tram lines, albeit a bit too far from the Main Central Rail Station (its nearly 20 minutes walk). But nearby there is good and variety of restaurants and only a short walk to the famed Amsterdam "red light" district. However, the hotel rooms are small and is not really located in one building, but on 2 nearby connected buildings. So going to the lobby, you need to go "out" to a side street, to an adjoining building. The rooms are not large, but comfortable. But if you are a business traveler, the room arrangement is not convenient. The modern design doesn't allow for a good working desk or powerpoints. Closets are tight, as are the hallwalls and lifts. Internet connectivity is bad in this entire hotel, and if you have multiple devices (such as iPhone, iPad and laptop) their internet system doesn't cater for it... so you are left to pay for each device, which is not only expensive and unreliably slow. I had to get my entire EUR70/= refund, as I could not even download my emails at a decent pace. Breakfast at the Winter Cafe just off the lobby is an excellent spread, with warm waffles and pancakes everyday. Try their eggs which are cooked and kept warm. The breakfast area is about the best part of the hotel. Staff and service is typical European and not very helpful. Simple directions or even "where is the local market" is replied with... "I don't go to market, so I don't know... ". The front desk service is slow and rooms are generally not available, if you arrive on an early flight, as most Asian flights do....

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not so great value”
Reviews.Author: tgggt
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, walking distance from train station and attractions. Very good food, esp breakfast. Comfortable rooms. Polite staff. All services available. Cons: Front desk overwhelmed when busy. Breakfast very expensive if hidden extra ('special discount' of â‚¬24 at checkin). Not great value for money, although to be honest Amsterdam is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly excellent - BUT few minor issues to consider!”
Reviews.Author: MrDecent D
Reviews.Content: Here are some of my observations during my stay in this 5* Hotel located in Dam Square, in which I stayed during the summer months. Pro's: ~ Helpful and diverse staff at the front desk, they were all fluent in English and some were fluent in other European languages. Eager to help and very efficient even at busy times, especially with things like ordering taxis, dinner reservations, room service arrangements etc. ~ Excellent Location; right opposite the Palace, easy to get on to public transport and within reach of all main attractions in the city. (Not too far from the airport either, although this would depend on traffic) ~ Room size is large and spacious, the cleaning of the room is done to a high standard, which is something you appreciate when living out of a suitcase for extended periods of time! ~ Very high standard of food and catering, professional staff willing to help and advise. 24 hour Breakfast and Room service is always on time (if not early!). Definitely worth tipping! ~ The TV and Mini Bar services are ofcourse pricey (as they would be in a 5* establishment), but are of a good standard - the Mini Bar/Fridge is constantly topped up by staff for your convenience. ~ Shower and bathroom facilities are fantastic, the beds are comfy and pillows can be requested to suit your preference. The safe in the room is discreet compared to those of many other hotels, so it is worth putting your valuables in them. ~ All looked very elegant and well lit, the Winter Garden is a great place to take guests and make an impression. I assume it is also a family friendly for those looking for a short but luxurious holiday. Con's: * Room key was problematic at times, and in the end had to get it changed - this can be highly irritating if your are in a hurry or have arrangements. * The lights can be slow and flicker several times before coming on to full power - not a huge issue but when it happens all the time it can bother you when going about day to day activities. * The gym was small and cramped, easily over crowded. * Bar was also overpriced and relatively small, seemed very dull indeed, especially for such a hotel. * WiFi in your room was very expensive and hard to pickup in other areas of the hotel. * I noticed at certain times the front desk had not even one single member of staff available, which can be frustrating if you are in a hurry. * Long wait for elevators and Air con in the room can noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingWakame
Reviews.Content: No other place can beat the location if you like to walk around, take tram etc. A bit 70's big hotel atmosphere. Too busy with business men and tourists, so not really classy but the room was spacious and the service was good. The breakfast was excellent, lots of fresh fruits and other regulars. I would recommend if your priority is convenience/ business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Phillmac1
Reviews.Content: Let's start with there are many hotels in Amsterdam, there are many fine examples just as there are many bad examples. I have been to the bad ones, got the scabies and as a result now only stay in the good ones. This one rates on my list as was of the great ones. Everything you need, good staff, very clean modern rooms, superb central location and within a brisk stroll of Centraal Station. Situated just behind the National Monument in Damm Square the hotel is a great place to search out and find all that Amsterdam has to offer. The red light area is within a 5 minute walk as are a wealth of good restaurants and tourist attractions. We did not eat at the hotel as the package we picked did not include this, but being in the centre of the city you are free to take your pick of all of Amsterdams eateries. Our room came with all the facilities you would expect from a high end city hotel, large room, big tv, superb shower, very comfy bed and courteous polite staff, must mention fairly reasonable rates for wifi. I have bug about wifi, personally i think we are all being ripped off for it and it should be free, especially as we are all on on here as professional/semi professional travellers and with the advent of smart phones that pretty much all of us have, somebody somewhere is making an awful lot of money out of us all! ........anyway go to Amsterdam, stay here and have a great time

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, right in the heart of amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: xxleexx
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed her a few months ago. we got a deal on travel republic for 3 nights for Â£220 - a bargain! We stayed in the back , new paert of th hotel, which was lovely. View from window was into a back alley but room was very quiet. We had a massive comfy king size bed, free fluffy housecoat and slippers, wifi, sky tv, tea and coffee making facilities, everyhing you could want from a hotel! the breakfasts are out of this world! eveything you could imagine, from kippers, to salmon, full english, continental, even a big box of chocolates and champagne! Thjey are expensive though, lucky we had breakfast through our booking. All in all a fantastic hotel, and we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: KJLim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the opposite of the DAM square, the middle of the city centre. It is about 15 minutes walking distance from the Amsterdam Centraal railway station. The standard room is big and the bathroom either. The shower room and toilet are separated; there is also a bathtub in the bathroom. Standard facilities and gears like toothbrush kit, shaver kit can be found in the bathroom, but I was a bit disappointed when I canâ€™t find cotton buds. This is a bit surprise to me as a rated 5 stars hotel. The noises from streets can be heard clearly in the room especially in mid night. I was awoken by loud rock music from the street during mid night. The hotel management could consider improving the soundproofing of hotel rooms. The hotel management provides bicycle bell, power adapter for their guests. You have to spend a bit of your time to locate them in your room. They are in same cabinet with refrigerator. In order to use the WiFi in the room, you have to pay about 9 euro which valid for 24 hours. It would be great if the hotel could provide free high speed WiFi access in all hotel rooms. Free high speed WiFi access is only available in hotel lobby that last for 30 minutes. As ranking 5 stars hotel, free WiFi access in hotel rooms perhaps is not sound too much. Besides, many hotels around the World are providing free WiFi access for their guests, why canâ€™t the NH Grand Hotel? For the breakfast, there are many varieties of the food and great coffees served during breakfast. But, I wonder why the bacon was dried and hard. Overcooked? That is the common way to prepare the bacon in Netherlands? I ate same type of bacon for two breakfasts during my stay. Perhaps, it is the common way how the bacon being prepared in Netherlands. Come to the hotel stuffs, they are friendly and helpful. Their housekeeping stuffs came to clean the room twice in a day which is good for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “A strong favorite, for so many reasons”
Reviews.Author: Philip_Coppens
Reviews.Content: Nothing can beat the Krasnapolsky for its location: the Dam, in the very heart. And it's Wintergarden, which serves breakfast, is amazing. The rooms in this hotel vary: the modern rooms are smaller, often with a wetroom; the older rooms are spacier and often have better views. The Royal Wing has amazing bedrooms and if you can, try to get upgraded or booked into these. The food in the hotel is uniformly good. I would say it is a safe "go to" place, but there are plenty of specific restaurants in the city centre that will give you more specific cuisines. Lunch in the lounge bar is excellent, as is breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel as central as you can get”
Reviews.Author: atmontejo
Reviews.Content: There was a group of us that stayed here on a work trip. A quality hotel, room was modern and well presented. I had a twin room in the newer wing. Quite pricey though, and I think you can get better value for money in Amsterdam. Location is great though.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, excellent location, met expectations, but not exceed”
Reviews.Author: ChirpyTurkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Dam Square, just 10 minutes walk from Central station. Hotel met expectations for facilities, location, standards and service. We did feel check in and check out was a little slow. Room was a good size with a lovely huge bed, mini bar and all the toiletries you would expect. We had a room at the rear of the hotel that was very quiet and provided a great nights sleep. Breakfast was â‚¬25 per person, so we declined and visited the plentiful local cafes. Having stayed in other hotels in Amsterdam, this is now our favourite and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Sophg1986
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Grand for 2 night at the end of August. The pictures online looked great and although it was a little pricey (Â£300 for 2 nights) it seemed worth it as it is incredibly central. We checked in at 2pm and went to our room. The hotel lobby was lovely and so it looked promising. Unfortunately we thought that the room itself was a bit of a let down. The bathroom was dated and reminded me of a shower block at a camp site. The beds were incredibly uncomfortable as were the pillows and we didn't sleep very well the whole time we were there. As we had been walking around Amsterdam all day, a good sleep is what we needed! The room itself was quite small and needs a refresher. On the 2nd day we were woken up by a maid and one of the concierges talking loudly outside of our room and that afternoon the maintainance men were fixing something in the next room with hammers etc. On the 2nd night we had the maids hoovering the room above us which was also very noisy. The food here was so overpriced but as you are in Central Amsterdam, go out and find something cheaper! Do not use the mini bar, again very expensive. The location is great but be prepared, it is like taking a break in London! Very busy, lots of people and you are also on the edge of the red light district (Although this may appeal to some!). I am sure there are other hotels with not such a central location that would give you better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We hate it because.....”
Reviews.Author: jerushlm
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed reservation from aug 21 till aug 28. Upon arrival the receptionist turn us to her manager who told us they cannot honor the reservation because "the renovation is not completed (?!)" She turned us to NH Barbizon Palace (see my review on this hotel. We choose Krasnapolsky for its cenral location, a walking distance to every sites we wanted to visit, We were compelled to walk an extra 20 to 30 min to the Barbizon (She is 72 and I am 75) and pass the K. A well managed and respectable hotel honors its commitment and moreover does not sell rooms he is not fully certain the room will be delivered as confirmed (Our travel agent did not finalize the deal before getting a firm confirmation from K.

Reviews.Title: “Need a revamp real quickly”
Reviews.Author: tomcat222
