Reviews.Content: This hotel has probably the best location in the city and also has a great tradition. The more disappointing is its current state. It needs a refurbishment very quickly and is very much below what you would expect. The room I had was extremely dark, which was due to it being on the 1st floor facing a very narrow street, but also because of weak little lights being placed only in corners. Most of the lights had to be turned on each manually. Although the furnishing in my room was acceptable, the general feeling of the equipment all over the hotel is that it is highly worn. The hotel is a combination of many buildings that are not connected well and in a manner required of this kind of hotel. There are many parts inaccessible by a lift. My room was on a gallery accessible only by a steep and narrow stairway. The reception did not bother offering to help with my luggage, so it appears it is natural in a top Amsterdam hotel for the guests to carry suitcases up the stairs. No internet included was a disappointment immediately upon arrival, although customary for Amsterdam. Prior to my departure, I asked for a wake up call from the reception at 7.45. Nobody called but luckilly my own alarm clock worked. I left after seeing the 8.00 headline news on TV, however when I mentioned this at check-out, the reception staff did not hesitate to lie that they called at 7.50... Even if that was the truth, is it OK not to care if nobody answers such a call and might e.g. miss a plane?? This was my first stay at an NH and probably also the last one, it appears that there is something wrong in the management of these properties and somebody tries to save a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shane w
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location.Nice hotel,friendly helpfull staff.I would recomend and go again myself.We had a problem with the tv,this was resolved quickly and we were given a box of chocolates for are inconveniece.Big rooms too.We didnt try the breakfast so i cant comment it seemed a little pricey at 22euros but there are loads of places close by you can get a full english or other things for half that price.Avoid tussuards it was expensive ,crowded and nothing special!Amsterdam was great and we will return in december.I cant wait!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in August. Arrived by car - expected Valet Parking Service (as advertised by Hotel) - but on enquirying at reception about unloading our luggage and what to do with the car - we were told to take it to the Hotel's car park - this was very poorly sign-posted, once we got to the car park we then had to struggle up three flights of stairs with our cases as the lift was not functioning.... we then ended up in the back of the hotel (in their conference section - which is practically a building site). We eventually made check-in and were greeted by a very very busy reception area. When we checked-in we were told we had been given a complimentary upgrade to an Executive Room (nothing to do with our arrivial experience I might add as the we had not complained at this point). The room overlooked the Dam Square (4th Floor) - and was as others have wrote 'in need of refurbishment' - chipped furniture, general air of 'long passed its best' - complete with a smell of 'spanish drains' around the bathroom. We spoke to the Duty Manager about our experience and mentioned some of our complaints (but not all!) - he listened and appeared troubled by our feedback - we received a complimentary drink in the bar, drink with dinner and bottle of water/tin of biscuits and a hand written note of apology. Our interest isn't in complaining to obtain discounts or other favours - it was simple a very poor experience and on the last two days of a two week holiday added a sour note. When you pay 5 star prices you expect a 5 star service and standard. Very very disappointed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Anne1223
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the hotel, but when we arrived, we were told they were overbooked. Our new room was not in the hotel, but in the apartments that are connected to the hotel by an alley way and are accessible by the street (this resulted in us hearing a lot of noise at night). Our apartment was on the top floor which was accessed by walking up several flights of narrow, winding stairs. While I realize this is how many apartments are in Amsterdam, this is not what we booked. Help was available to assist us with carrying up our suitcases, but no one was available when we were ready to leave. The stairway, especially at the entrance had a musty, mildewy smell. The apartment had two sides: a living room area with kitchenette and a bedroom with a bathroom. The bathroom was fairly updated. The rooms was not very clean, as there was enough of a layer of dust on the furniture to "write" in. Apparently there were mosquitoes living in the room, as we woke up in the middle of the night covered with their bites. This was with the windows closed. If you stay here, make sure they don't switch your reservation to the apartments.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: nicholaauno
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times before and always return to the same hotel. OK ,so this is not a 5 star hotel, but who cares as you are not charged 5 star prices?! The staff were very friendly and courteous. We got let into our room early on check in as we arrived at 9.30am. We really love the breakfast served in the Winter Garden, although this included within our room rate and I would not pay the extra charge on top per person. There is so much one person can eat and I do not think you would get your money's worth - I would advise to book room with breakfast included even if it is just a little more. The hotel is ideally situated, very central to everything. The beds are massive, we could have slept four people in the room - if desired!! The only downside with the hotel was the bathroom, the toilet had a bit of a whiff coming from it and the shower leaked water all over the bathroom floor. Not really a problem as the towels mopped it up and can request more from housekeeping. Overall, I would suggest staying in this hotel if a deal can be found. I certainly would not pay Â£180+ per night, we found a deal for Â£125 per night which is about the right price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This review is for the apartments - Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: The_Darlings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kransapolsky apartments , which are behind/next to the hotel. First we got an apartment with a lot of narrow spiral stairs leading to it, with no elevator, and more of those stairs inside the ap, leading to the bedroom upstairs. Since we were with a small child with a stroller (and they knew it cause we asked for a babycot), we couldnt stay there. We got another apartment that was in one level, with a elevator. only 5 stairs at the entrance to the building.... The apartment was very nice: living room, dining area, bedroom, all the kitchen equipment, washing maching (dryer in the basement). price was very good. The location is very central, however it was a little niosy, expecially on the weekend. There was a little bit of smoking smell in the apartment that sticks to the cloths. on the overall - VERY GOOD EXPERIENCE

Reviews.Title: “50 Euros Per Day for Parking”
Reviews.Author: Boxboy
Reviews.Content: A lesson learned. On a telephonic inquiry about parking, I was told that the hotel had it's own facilites. They do! Down an obscure alley way in a car park that makes London's urine soaked Cambridge Circus NCP smell like a Jasmine Bush. Then, unexplained to us, through a building site at the side of the hotel (it's undergoing referbishment). We went back out via the street because we thought we'd exited on the wrong floor. I do feel very sorry for the poor girl on reception because (after a 6 hour drive from London feeling very tired and very hungry) she then informed us the hotel charged 50 euros for the pleasure. HIndsight being 20/20 I shouldn't be surprised that parking in Amsterdam is at a premium and that only fools like us take a car, but it's in the best interests of the hotel to inform their guests that there is this charge on top of the hotel room when these inquires are made. Tired, hungry, stessed out drivers (have you ever driven in Amsterdam?) don't need anymore suprises. 150 euros (as we stayed 3 nights) wasn't what I wanted to hear. That said, the location is superb. The hotel however, and maybe I'm getting a little grand in my old age, is very ordinary and rather disappointing. I think that they should drop the 'Grand' the same way BA dropped 'Worlds Favourite Airline'. The reception staff were terribly professional and were both apologetic and understanding when confronted with a couple of grumpy tourists. In other notes, the breakfast is great and plentyful and staff helpful (if a little uninformed). I'd never heard of (let alone used the NH chain) and was left, sadly, underwhelmed. A NOTE ON PARKING. DO CHECK THE ADDITIONAL COST IF DRIVING. In Metz and Reims they only charged 20 euros per day - bit of a difference if driving and on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a few days at New Years, the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler33Nyc
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in the Amsterdam city center before and had noticed the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky. The hotel is literally right smack in the middle of the central square where the fireworks are fired from. The hotel is beautiful. An old classical looking hotel. The rooms were big, we were in the new part of the hotel. I paid for the champaign New Years Day brunch in the atrium and it was awesome. The atrium was stunning, I felt like we couldn't have asked for a more amazing place to spend New Years. We had a blast, the hotel is a little bit pricey but well worth it. I have to also give a shout out to the concierge who helped us book some river boat tours and found us an inexpensive and super luxury ride to the airport. Next time I'm back in Amsterdam I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location, awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: iritoren
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the Dam Square. Our room (regular) was clean, well maintained, nicely decorated, linens in good condition, comfortable good size bed. Housekeeping was very good. Storage: lots of hangers, only 4 shelves. Location - the best: From Schiphol we took a train to the city, and walked from the central station to the hotel (5 min. easy walk). Getting around the city from the hotel is so easy: withing not more than 5min. walk we easily found tram lines, bus lines, canal cruises, bicycle or motor cycles for rent, shopping, walking tours, cafes and restaurants, you name it. The city is quiet in general, so we enjoyed a quiet stay (our room did not face the square, though). I mention this because the Dam Square is a central part of the city. Reception staff is efficient and nice, their English is good. Allow about half an hour to tour the hotel and its history. By all means don't miss breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but marvellous”
Reviews.Author: Va1984
Reviews.Content: we had a triple room for 2+1 adults and it was spacious and clean though it had no view. Everything in the hotel is first class and breakfast is excellent (worth the price), the only annoyance was the lack of free internet, which is charged at â‚¬10/day/device.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieWard
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Amsterdam for my birthday and I returned to stay at nH Grand Krasnapolski ( my favourite hotel ). As normal the service and friendliness of staff was great. I requested a smoking room which they sorted out for me. In addition, on the day of my birthday I was given a lovely gift and card which I felt was very kind. (stroope waffles are amazing!) I will definatley be returning to nH Grand Krasnapolski every time in travel to Amsterdam. Also, I would just like to say thank you to Floori (I think that was her name - the lady who checked me in) she is absolutely great and welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RickyCafe
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip for a company conference. Bedrooms. These were very confortable and quiet with very good bathroom facilities and complete with TV with the usual subscription channels if you care to use them. Restaurant. Very nicely laid out in a large open area (but inside). Very stylish and ideal for conference style meetings. Food of a very good standard. Conference facilities. At the time of the visit some of the conference rooms were being refurbished so there was some evidence of building work. Otherwise there were very large conference rooms for plenary sessions as well as smaller 'break out' rooms. Seating was very comfortable. A very good hotel for conferences as well as travellers who like some of the VIP treatment during their stay. Concierge / Reception Service. First class. Dutch (of course) English and indeed most European languages spoken. Staff were extremely helpful and very polite. Just could not be faulted. Location : In Dam Square close to Amsterdams more infamous tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “One hotel, two standards”
Reviews.Author: Chiefen72
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel, and have stayed here twice. First time on a romantic weekend with my wife on the modern wing, and the second time on a business trip on the old wing! The new wing is clean, tidy and very chick while the old wing is well old! The rooms are larger though! And they have great view of the palace, The bathrooms of the old part need renovation. Breakfast is great, so is the Japanese restaurant, highly recommended Tapanyaki! I will definitly return to Kras!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant home away from home! styed here 4 times never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: SerialGlobeTrotter17
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this place.. price is very expensive especially breakfast but if you love luxury youll love the krasnapolsky.. breakfast in the winter garden after a night of madness is incredibly serene.. the staff are generally warm and friendly. location is superb. right opposite the amsterdam monument. Stayed with my dad back in 2008. nd again with my dad and brother in 2009.. went back in 2010 and 2011 and everytime it feels like a home away from home.. no problems..

Reviews.Title: “Quit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Bar_El36
Reviews.Content: Beside the great location this five stars hotel didn't have anything to write home about. Room was basic, no special attractions in the hotels (bars and so..). Service was appropriate, almost friendly

Reviews.Title: “most central hotel”
Reviews.Author: im4usugar
Reviews.Content: a small boutique hotel at dam square,with a old world charm ,terrace garden and resturant had a very good ambience.however lobby is quite pathetic,rooms are quite shabby,elevators need replacement . Best part of this hotel is its location ,be sure you are in dam on a saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--can be loud though”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel. Of course, the rooms are small, but quaint. The staff is friendly and always offering you ammenities. My only complaint is that if there is a festival or music in Dam Square you can hear the music in your room and sometimes it is hard to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: annie209967
Reviews.Content: Regardless of previous comments re the Reception staff we found them to be very friendly and efficient. Enjoyed all aspects of the hotel apart from some of the guests who were themselves unfriendly and slightly pompus. Breakfast wonderful everything you could ask for with again friendly and efficient service. Had a great time in Amsterdam, a city of much variety.

Reviews.Title: “In bad need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: mjk43
Reviews.Content: I stayed here attending a business conference in the hotel - and I am glad I wasn't paying the bill. The first room had an air-conditioning unit which blew out only hot air. The duty manager explained that the old unit had broken down but maintenance had replaced it with a used one and that had now clearly failed too. In my second room, the air-conditioning was at best mildly effective but I wasn't moving again. The bathrooms must have been redecorated at some stage as the grout was fairly clean and the mastic around the bath in good condition but nothing had been done about updating the plumbing. An old fashioned shower working off the bath taps - little pressure and no consistency of temperature - that says it all. As another duty manager told me "this hotel will very soon undergo refurbishment and it needs it". Breakfast buffet at best ok. The other meals were specific to the conference so may not be reflective of the hotelâ€™s restaurant norm.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with it”
Reviews.Author: Janey1UnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Sorry about the late review. Stayed for 4 nights at New Year with 2 family groups. Firstly great location if coming by train from airport. 10 minutes walk from the station to the hotel. The hotel is on Dam Square and central to organising a canal trip or visiting the red light district. A good 15 - 20 mins walk to the main shopping area, flower market or Leidesplein. Tram stops are located nearby should you need to use them. We were allocated a room in the new wing - a walk from reception to cross an alley into another part of the hotel (access by key card). The room was spacious enough for the 3 of us with a good sized bathroom, flat screen tv with english channels and comfy bed. It overlooked the street to the side of the hotel with numerus restaurants and bars. It was very quiet but our friends were further along the corridor which became the older part of the hotel and they said the noise kept them awake. The bar was modern and nice for a drink before going out. Standard prices for a city hotel and the service was good. It had a nice looking restaurant but we did not eat there. It is a good city hotel,clean, reasonably central, and the staff were mostly helpful. We did not have any problems stayin here.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: walkabout101
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice enough hotel, good staff. Rooms on the European smallish side. Got a room next to an alley and they started doing garbage pickup at the crack of dawn , and I'm a light sleeper. Other than that, I was happy there. I liked the lounge in the lobby too, but didn't try their restaurant. There's lots of places close by anyway. For breakfast there's a couple decent spots across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Arina_11
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star hotel. The location is perfect, no questions about that! Right on Dam sq, but that's all you get for your money! Don't know about good rooms I read about, i must ended up in not as good rooms. However, I just stayed one night therer, and Hilton and especially Grand Amrack were the winers! Well, at first I couldn't even find the bathroom, I thought it was a clothet with doors like that! As I say, wouldn't stay there again. Not worth it at all!

Reviews.Title: “Profitable Mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: NathanC
Reviews.Content: If a hotel charges Â£200 a night and then charges extra for wifi, things generally get off to a bad start. Unfortunately for this faded grand dame of a hotel, things never got better. I later read that there are good rooms and bad at this hotel - I wouldn't know as I was directed to the rear of the property to what I assume was one of the not so good rooms. I guess if you are on Dam sq in the centre of Amsterdam, you don't have to try too hard however from the number of guests arriving it seems that this hotel is prefectly content to exist in a state of profiatble mediocrity and not really try to impress. What do I mean by this: (i) I was handed a dirty menu in grand cafe - it had butter smeared over it, (ii) there was a big fat fly sitting on the cheese plate, (iii) The bright orange and green bathroom soap and shampoo looked and smelled like cough remedy, (iv) Desk lamp in my room didn't work. The hotel was all clean but decor very eighties. I would advise finding somewherere that works harder for less of your hard earned cash.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hote, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: emmalouisemonaghan
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were given a free upgrade to a room in the new part of the hotel, as it was my birthday. Room was one of the nicest i have stayed in amsterdam. DO NOT HAVE BREAKFAST! It was sub standard for a five star hotel, and you can get a more adequate meal in the cafes around the hotel. We were compensated for this after complaining at check out , and tjis did not seem to be a problem for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ....”
Reviews.Author: bcwqueenst
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the best locations in the city - but it ends there. The reception at the front desk is terrible. There are signs up breakfast and upgrade for 15 Euro - but they do not honor this - the immediate response is that is for one of their cheap hotels. The rooms are clean but run down - The Conceirge is a joke - they do not help you when you arrive, have no newspapers, could not give directdions. Who would want to use this chain of hotels except when you must.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and breakfast - not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: Ipache
Reviews.Content: Best location by a mile and the breakfast is divine, normally set out two hours to enjoy the atmosphere and the food. close to good shopping and other good restaurants, the Argentine one around the corner comes to mind. Poor service at the desk, would say kinda rude sometimes and the room sneed attention , at least in the block I stayed. would not stay anywhere else when in amsterdam though

Reviews.Title: “fine for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: rialski
Reviews.Content: me and my wife wer visting freinds for weekend in msterdam so we decided to stay over in Krasnapolsky. It was very centrel location right in square. Rooms quite small for what we paid but all in all it was fine. Service was ok, food wise we ate out. The rom was very small but we only sleep in it.

Reviews.Title: “business meeting- flawless service”
Reviews.Author: fluffybinks
Reviews.Content: I did not actually sleep in this hotel (it was full when i tried to book) - we ran a business meeting there all day yesterday, the service and attention to detail was so amazing i had to review it. Great central location. Old world charm Impecable service Unusual and innovative coffee breaks good lunch. extremely friendly staff good place for a meeting

Reviews.Title: “NOT so "Grand", definitely not a five star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jilted01
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite for a stay with our adult son. We arrived on an early flight and were able to store our bags until we could check-in at 3pm. We returned to the hotel at 4pm and our room was not ready until 5pm. The room we received was a "triple" with three beds in one room (at a rate of 350 Euros per night). As it was Easter weekend, no other rooms were available at the "Kras" or in the vicinity. We were given a coupon for a "free" drink for our inconvenience. Our room faced an alley off of Dam Square and revelers could be heard at all hours. The furnishings in the room were worn. Four tears in the duvet had been repaired by sewing, the 3" tear in the back of the desk chair had not been repaired, there were pinholes in the blackout drape which made it ineffective and one leg of the desk was loose and shimmed in place. The room amenities consisted of the standard bath supplies and only one robe. That was okay, as there wasn't anyplace to hang it in the bath. The electric kettle was on the desk plugged into the only accessible plug. One day we returned to find that although the room had been cleaned, our morning coffee cups were still on the desk with cold coffee in them. The public areas were also "tired" and not what you expect from a five star hotel. I travel to Europe and Asia extensively and have stayed at hotels ranging in quality from the Penninsula in Manilla (5*) to the Comfort Inn in Los Angeles (1*) and I would rate this a very weak 3 star, on a par with your typical Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Some major positives but overall not worth it due to also major issues”
Reviews.Author: FSFan
Reviews.Content: The Krasnapolsky has three extremely important things going for it: best location possible, a great historic building and an amazing breakfast. But unfortunaly poor management has resulted in poor renovations and a catastrophically bad front desk staff. First, the renovations: I had been at this hotel many years ago and it was saddening to see that the renovation that happened in between didn't do this historic building any favors. If anything now the hotel feels less upscale and less luxurious. And yes, I'm talking about the rooms facing the Dam, because the rest of the rooms - especially the ones in the "new" wing in the back, between the Pijlsteeg and the Damstraat, are a complete disaster. That brings me to the front desk staff; every interaction with them was unpleasant, from check-in to check out. At check-in, we saw that they had a promotion about upgrading from the booked room, so we asked. After being told the promo was only for special circumstances and we weren't a special circumstance (bait'n'switch, anyone?) we were offered an expensive upgrade to an "executive room" in the "new wing". We decided to give that a try, and hauled our heavy bags all the way to the "new wing". Well, the room was catastrophically bad and amongst other offenses even though it was non-smoking it smelled of smoke - very intensely. We went back and ended up paying a huge premium to get a Dam room, which were still disappointing but not nearly as bad. The fabulous breakfast kept us going for the rest of the stay, but check-out was just as much of a mess, if not worse; they basically messed up the bill, including the fact that they charged us for the upgrade during a day we didn't stay there... This was corrected after much grumbling from the staff, which was consistently unpleasant and rude. I do totally understand that they have to deal with bad customers every day (there were a few that we saw ourselves) but just because the previous customer was rude and unreasonable doesn't mean it should be contagious and you need to also be rude and unpleasant to the next customer - like if two wrongs made a right...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel in the center of city close to Dam square is superb. The staff of the hotel was very polite and friendly. Most of them spoke very good English and were well trained in how to best entertain the guests. The rooms were large, bright, airy and very well appointed.The beds were slightly wider than many twins with beautiful quality bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience so far”
Reviews.Author: theculinaryexplorer
Reviews.Content: Location-wise, you can't beat this hotel. It's walking distance from the train station so getting there from the airport was very easy. Even though it's in the centre of town, we had no noise at all in our room and travelling around the city was incredibly easy. The hotel's right by a couple of landmark's as well so it's impossible not to find your way back. The room was very, very spacious, and high ceilings (which is always a plus in my book). The bed was queensize and incredibly comfortable. Large TV and large desk. Table & two chairs perfect if you're eating for two (and we had quite a bit of food!) Bathroom was perfect size, with bath, shower, two sinks, two dressing gowns etc. Toilet in separate room next to it. Incredibly comfortable sleep, no noise, good cleaning service as well. The service was amazing, incredibly friendly and helpful staff, room service was quick and very polite (even at half 3 in the morning) and the food was lovely. I have seen some reviews that have had a really negative experience here but it's honestly a favourite hotel of mine and have absolutely nothing negative to say about the whole stay and would highly, highly recommend, especially if it's your first trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Position and Value”
Reviews.Author: brettb7
Reviews.Content: Great location, with excellent service.We found the hotel good value for money as well. Best bed I have ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Three stars at a five star price”
Reviews.Author: MaryandBob5
Reviews.Content: The location is very near all transportation. However, this location is similiar to staying near Times Square in NYC. This area is noisy and not so clean. The Hotel itself is a three star property. The staff is very formal. The concierge desk is not very helpful. The rooms are very small and worn. We do not recommend this hotel. Very expensive and low value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnWilsonVancouver
Reviews.Content: I have read mixed reviews regarding the Grand, but my wife and I had an excellent stay here. The hotel is right on Dam Square and is a ten minute walk from any part of the city. The rooms are small but clean. The Concierge was very helpful and told us many great things to do. One of the best things he told us to do was have a drink at the tiny bar called WF next to Krasnaplosky Grand. It has great local drinks called Genivere. To the left of the hotel you have a nice wine bar and to the right there is the madness of the red light district. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel has a lovely courtyard behind it, which is perfect place to enjoy a cigar!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: dthk_msia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 1 night in April with my family. The room we stayed in was clean and the beds were excellent. My only grouse is that we could hear the noise from the streets as we were only on the 2nd floor and in one of the busiest areas in Amsterdam but it didn't affect our sleep at all. Their staff were very accommodating and even helped me to check in earlier when I explained that I had a very tired 2-year old with us who needed his nap. While the Damstrat may not be my favorite spot in Amsterdam due to the crowds, I would not hesitate to stay here again if I should visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Egg Cracking Krasnapolsky!”
Reviews.Author: janelafferty1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from our Easter break 2011 at the Krasnapolsky to celebrate my husbands 40th birthday. We booked a 3 night package with mini bar and breakfast with Lastminute.com When we checked in we had our room upgraded to the Royal Wing (3rd floor) The hotel staff also left a box of chocolates and a compilments slip with birthday wishes for my husband in our room which I thought was a nice touch. The room was ideal, bright and airy with an outlook onto the street to the right of Dam square which leads to the red light district. The room had a massive bed and the bathroom was fit for purpose with a lovely deep bath. We really couldn't fault the hotel. The staff were all very polite and friendly. Before we leftfor our trip I read a lot of the reviews and I must say that I was a bit concerned about our stay to say the least however I must say that I really shouldn't have worried!! We are even thinking of a return trip sometime in the not too distant future!!! Enjoy travellers! Breakfast in the Wintergarden was also yumm! Everything you could possibly want to start off the day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SkierOslo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 night during eastern, and the location is the best in town. Hotel room is nice and clean, and ask for room facing the back. Breakfast cost euro 28.50 and is not worth it! Go to one of the local cafes and buy excellent breakfast for euro 8.50!!

Reviews.Title: “Should be called Krappy-polsky!”
Reviews.Author: Elivky
Reviews.Content: Never have I been so offended by a so-called 5 star hotel!!! For the amount we paid (and it was a lot) we got a bathroom that looked and smelt like a men's urinal at the YMCA gym. I have seen 2 star hotels with better bathrooms than that! We were lucky to get a reasonable sized room because we were 3 people sharing, but the close proximity to the tacky pubs meant we had listen to drunken stag parties till late. No swimming pool and if we wanted to use the gym we had to share a private one with residents of a connecting building.(they forgot to clarify that in their website). Our room wasn't cleaned properly, when we came back we found out our linens were just flipped over the other side, we had to call cleaning service up again to do it properly!! Wifi was not free and they charged us for using the room adapter (which was placed in the fridge btw, who puts adapters in the fridge!!) Basically this was not luxury standard, maybe because we went up the 4th elevator which was the old part of the building, instead of the fancier bit. But honestly! The amount of false advertising was beyond ridiculous. The only upside was the central location which helped us escape as fast as possible to other parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT MORE COULD YOU ASK FOR”
Reviews.Author: ColesDad1
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to amsterdam 8 times now and stayed at the krasnapolsky twice.There is not a better location in all of amsterdam.My daughter and i were given a suite in the amsterdam wing with a bay window overlooking the damstrat.It felt like we were true amsterdamers with our own apartment with alleyways to dam square and the old canals.The staff were fantastic and i look forward to my next visit.Don't be cheap and visit the wintergarden for breakfast,you wont be sorry.Please be kind and respectful of your servers,The dutch are the nicest people in all of europe.If you aint dutch you aint much.See you soon A-dam!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a Business Meeting at Amsterdam Airport and planned to stay in the city center. Upon arrival staff was really formal and didn't feel warm to arrive, which seems kind of standard in Amsterdam (am saying this as a Dutchy myself). Had to wait at check-in for 15 minutes because they couldn't find my voucher, and making a big deal out of this, even though my company had sent them the voucher. Location is really the best, in the middle of the city center of Amsterdam, on the Dam Square. The room (Executive????) wss nothing special, just 2 beds and a simple bathroom. The view on the other hand was nice, overlooking Dam Square. All in all just an average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JMC67776
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets such a unfair rap on here and strikes the fear into any traveler planning on booking here. Here is the truth, the hotel is in central Amsterdam right on the square, the staff are friendly and punctual and the hotel rooms are a little dated however comfortable and well appointed. On arrival we were upgraded to a executive room with views to dam square which was excellent. We had a good stay at the hotel over three nights and i would recomend this hotel to any person looking for a hotel right in the heart of town. Dont believe all the negative reviews you read here as some people are never happy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good hotel but not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Jellert
Reviews.Content: The Krasnapolsky has one of the best locations you can get in Amsterdam. Also the conference room is really nice but there are not enough power supplies. The entrance hall and the lobby to the hotel is cozy/timeless but the room (incl. the bathroom) I had was very small and was a little outdated. So I definitely had not the feeling staying in a 5 star hotel but rather a 4 star typical city-hotel. Considering that, the price of 160EUR (standard room) is a little bit too much, taking into account that you have to pay +/- 20EUR for wifi and +/-30EUR for breakfast (really good though) and +/- 50EUR for 24h parking. But overall, it`s good stay in the heart of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a secure place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sisiah
Reviews.Content: Traveled for business for 2 nights in March 2011 -check-in took 30minutes: a long queue and not enough people at the reception. The same for check-out. - rooms were old but cosy - lift 5 is very very slow: in case you are directed to lift 5, watch out and reserve time for transferring from one room to another. -17e per 24hrs for wifi is very high price, and you could not buy any shorter time slots. Witnessed 3 thefts: - I left my silk scarf in my room, and noticed it directly at the check out. Asked the manager at the reception if I can get it back: I remembered the exact place I had forgotten it in the room. The manager went to look for it -and it was not there. Neither was it in the housekeeping. When I left the room, it was locked. The silk scarf had disappeared into the thin air. - in the lobby of the hotel I witnessed two thefts of womens' handbags, when working by my computer for 2 hours to go to the airport. It is easy to be careless at the 5star hotel and just let your handbag lay freely next to you, but you need to remember it is public place, so anyone can step in. I saw one thief by myself -the other I did not notice even though it was very close to my table. This one thief was smartly dressed and did not pop out of the clients. The other theft was right next to my table, and I only hear one woman shouting and crying for robbed handbag. I felt very insecure, and was happy I was leaving the place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location...a quality 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: JohnC82
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Amsterdam for our 1st wedding anniversary, so opted to pay for a 5* hotel. On arrival, we were checked in pretty effortlessly, although we were originally allocated a single room, which was a bit of a pain. Once we got back to reception the lady at the check in desk apologised and offered us a free upgrade to an apartment which was a bonus. The apartments were great, and extremely clean. They were also at the back of the hotel, so very quiet, with easy access to the streets to the rear of the hotel, although the stairs are mental...quite dangerous actually as they're so steep. The location is the main selling point of the hotel. It's on Dam Square, so in the centre of everything, and 500m walk from central station. It's literally a straight road as well all the way, so very easy to find. I'd challenge whether this is a 5*. The original room we went to (the single room) was tiny, and furnished randomly, but the staff, the services, and the breakfast room were all great. At best, I'd say it was a good 4*, but you'd probably expect a more modern hotel with spa and more leisure facilities to qualify this to be classed as a 5*. On hindsight, we'd probably not pay the same rate we did to stay here again, but the lack of * is made up for with such a great location...that's definitely what you're paying for. p.s. put about Â£25 to one side for tourist taxes when you check out. Wasn't expecting that when we checked out, so something to think about when you price up the room...that was a new one on me!

Reviews.Title: “Grand, spendid hotel.5* beautiful breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: cardiff007
Reviews.Content: Excellent all around. Location superb, central. Bedrooms large. Could not have a room overlooking dam or square as most of these are suites. Our room overlooked buildings. Breakfast room breath taking. Defintely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the center of it all.”
Reviews.Author: CameramanMatteo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for a week, it was around â‚¬350/night. If I was paying, I would have picked a cheaper hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The bathrooms are very nice, and the room was very clean. The buffet breakfast cost â‚¬27/person though!

Reviews.Title: “Lift 5”
Reviews.Author: MathewsUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 friends on a weekend trip to Amsterdam. We booked this hotel on booking.com as it seemed incredible value for money. A 5-star hotel that was only slightly more expensive than the other 3-star hotels! Of course we did not realise that a 5-star hotel can have rooms that are at the most on a 3-star level. When we received our room keys after checking in we were informed that Lift 5 would be the one that would take us to our floor. Little did we know that this was the loser lift! The way to Lift 5 is past the main restaurant (the "monumental winter garden"), which is very pretty (wrought iron & glass roof) and really lifts your expectations. Marvelling about the comforts of staying at a 5-star hotel, we continued on our way to Lift 5. After the great restaurant the hotel seems to loose one of its stars with every step you take. Lift 5 is next to the door to the garage. After a very long walk (the hotel claims that the station is 5 minutes away - that would make the station closer to reception than our room!), we finally reached our room and realised why this had been such a good deal. The room was in desperate need of refurbishment and felt very dark und gloomy. The bathroom was clean but very basic, with doors that appeared to have been taken off an Ikea cupboard, i.e. they would not close properly and could not be locked. As there was no ventillation built into the bathroom any odors have to be absorbed by the bedroom (easily achieved as the bathroom doors don't close properly anyway). The hotel charges â‚¬17 per day for wireless internet, not something that I would expect to pay for anymore. We told the front desk staff that the 5 stars were a gross exaggeration for what we got and the answer was "yes we know"! Here's a great tip for your next trip to Amsterdam: stay at a 3-star hotel and hang around the reception desk at the Krasnapolsky when people check in and enjoy the sight of guests happily taking their keys with the instruction to take Lift 5!

Reviews.Title: “Stingy”
Reviews.Author: misschrisUk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I got a great deal so I am not too miffed about the few problems we experienced, but if I was paying top dollar (Â£120 a night) I would be fuming! We stayed in 6016 in a standard double room on the top floor. It is a smoking room as requested but did not stink at all. The bed was HUGE, about 50% bigger than a standard double. Very comfortable, lovely clean sheets and great quality pillows and duvet. On checking in we asked for the mini bar to be emptied as we wanted to use the space for groceries. We were assured it would be - it never was. We could have reminded them and asked again for it to be emptied but we didn't want the hassle. A big niggle was the bathroom doors - they are 'saloon' style swinging doors so you can forget about privacy! The bath was lovely - really big and deep. The toiletries were pretty paltry - one teeny tiny toothpaste tube which was barely enough to last one day. No conditioner or bubble bath - I used the shower gel instead but it didn't bubble very much. We had a lovely fluffy robe on day one but it was not replaced on either of the three other days we were there! The kettle took 10 minutes to boil and the complimentary tea/coffee/milk/sugar was very stingy - you can make 1 coffee and 1 tea with what they give you but it has to be very strong as there is so little milk/whitener! We treated ourselves to the famous buffet breakfast one morning. Very good, great choice and quality, but definitely not worth 45 Euros between us. The location is fantastic and as we were at the back we had no problems with noise. None of these problems are huge and did not spoil our holiday, just made it less comfortable. It's a shame someone will pay Â£120 a night for a so called 5 star hotel as they will inevitably be disappointed. Hopefully this review will make them think twice and choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough!!”
Reviews.Author: louise0704
Reviews.Content: Hotel entrance was amazing. Our room was much bigger than expected and much bigger than other 5 star hotels we have stayed in. The bathroom was also really spacious. It was my boyfriend's birthday and I had arranged a cake and champagne in our room on arrival. The staff were really helpful in arranging this for me all via email a few days before we arrived. I always had a response to my emails within an hour! The location is perfect, close to the station, red light district, shopping, restaurants and bars. We had room service twice (lunch and dinner) which was of an excellent standard. I would also highly recommend one of the many Argentinos Steak Houses nearby. All in all, we had an amazing trip to Amsterdam and mostly things were perfect (except the weather).

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you can afford the most expensive rooms”
Reviews.Author: CosSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We (my parents and I) stayed here in mid-January. The hotel is in a good location, near the main train station, restaurants, souvenir shops and the palace. There is a tram that takes you to the Museum area from behind the palace. We reserved a room rate that included breakfast, late check out on Sunday, free use of mini-bar. We booked a standard rate however after going back and reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor I tried to upgrade to a deluxe room three hours before our arrival via internet. Their internet site would not let me upgrade to a deluxe room but I figured since the room was still available three hours before our arrival it would be ok. I asked for the upgrade upon check in and was told that the hotel was fully booked. hmm ok. It was January, not high tourist season and its a big hotel but oh well. We were given our room keys and walked to the left of the hotel...this is where you need to be careful. If you are given a room in the old part of the hotel, you better prepare yourself psychologically for a return to summer camp. A previous poster posted a photo of the bathroom, shower stall, toilet stall set up. My mistake was to look at that photo and say to myself that must have been some years ago but no 5 star hotel could have such a nasty bathroom set up in this day and age. Well let me tell you...in 2011 it is still that cheap camp site bathroom set up and guests are being put in these rooms. It looked like if you showered the entire water would spread between the stalls into the toilet and would get flooded. As we were three persons we knew there would be a third bed. Well, there was a really tatty old rollaway bed that looked more like a prison bed than a 5 star hotel bed. The room was so dark despite having turned on all the lights. I have stayed in one star hotels that had a better room and bathroom situation than this.... Immediately we telephone reception to say we needed to change rooms and were told that a junior suite room was available (except the hotel was fully booked 10 minutes earlier at Reception). In any case we were told the suite room would be an extra 200euros more than our current room rate but because the bathroom situation was so terrible we decided that we needed to pay that amount to get out of the room. It was that bad. I wonder if they put people in those scary rooms and then try to sell a more expensive suite room once guests are sufficiently horrified. So we moved to the new room, the junior suite was much better...more 5 star. Nice bathroom with jacuzzi tub, walk in shower, big dining table with dishes, flatscreen tv, two sofas, many closets and comfortable beds. I was promised the new rate included the same package deal, breakfast, late check out and free use of mini bar. Well, when checking out we had been billed for every item taken from the mini bar so be careful and check your bill upon check out. Breakfast was very nice (go for the waffles with cherry sauce!) . So if you can spring for the nicest hotel rate (I hope this ensures a room in the new section) or get guarantee that you are not going to be put in the old unrenovated part of the hotel, go for it. I put an average rating because that first room is not 5 star and I don't think even 20-30 years ago that room would have been labelled a 4-5 star room... If I had booked the suite and had only seen the suite I would give this hotel an excellent rating. BTW this review does not reflect the poor service of the staff who from the breakfat room staff to the concierge were very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Superb locale to access it all from day tours to bistros to museums”
Reviews.Author: novascotia17
Reviews.Content: In the mid-1980's, (The date of stay did not have an '80's selection) I stayed here, as an interim, while on my way to Malawi, Africa. And again on my return trip, this hotel provided the right anchor to access the many excursions available. At the time, the Hotel was undergoing major remodeling, but even with the twists and turns to get to my room, the hotel staff were terribly gracious and attentive. Across the square is the palace, and within walking distance, my most fond memory: The Five Flies Restaurant. Superb, superb, superb.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but lacking customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jay662
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a long weekend. Friday to the Monday. We had been looking forward to staying somewhere a little more upmarket in Amsterdam. First impressions were good, lovely architecture and styling within the lobby however there was a very long wait to get served at the Reception. Once we were served we got a free upgrade to a delux suite which was unexpected. The room was very comfortable and had every need that you wished for. Very comfortable bed and a new bathroom. We had the breakfast 3 of the days and it was just okay. The bacon, sausage, egg ..etc was all over cooked, I would say the best thing was the champagne. The breakfast room was very nice again but really let down by the poor quality in food. On the Sunday the manual in the bedroom said that breakfast would be until 11:30am on sundays but when we went down they then said it was closed to due brunch, but we could pay an extra 10euros if we wanted. Needless to say we didn't want to pay extra for something that we though was included. We went off looking for a place for breakfast and found a bar called Big Shots which done a lovely English Breakfast and certingly the best we had over there. I guess this leads us on to the one downfall of the hotel and that is the staff. From Reception to the concerige at night, to asking for advice it was all very poor. My partner and I are early 20's and I got the feeling that people in the hotel were looking down on us. The first night that we were there when we walked in to the hotel lobby and one of the staff questioned us and kept asking what our room number was. Once she got an answer she stormed down the reception area speaking to a collegue in dutch and marched in to a room at the back of the reception area. I got the feeling that we weren't the usual guests she was expecting! One our holiday we like to relax in the hotel room in the afternoon after being out and about. We had left a sign on the door advising staff not to disturb us, we recieved a call later afternoon from house keeping asking when we wanted our room cleaned, as it was already around 6pm when they called we told them to leave it. We headed out and had dinner when we arrived back in at 8pm the room had been done. This left a sour taste as we had told the staff to leave the room unitl the next day. There was one other event on the Sunday we arrived back in the hotel room around 5pm and house cleaning had been, about 5 minutes later we recieved a chap at the door from housekeeping asking if we needed anything else? I just didn't understand this as room keeping had been and changed everything for us, even supplying new toothbrushes as well. Now maybe they were just trying to give us good service but it really didn't feel like that at all. My gut feeling is we aren't the normal type of people they want to stay at the hotel and it's a shame as the Hotel room and location is very good but I couldn't recommend it to anyone due to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: travelbugTipp
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights and although compared to other 5 star hotels it falls short on the luxury side of things its still a great hotel.they also serve champagne at breakfast if thats what your into and the lobby and breakfast area of the hotel is beautiful.our room was really cosy,bed was so comfy and the rooms were clean and warm.bathroom is a bit tired looking but still it has everything.the location is perfect as its close to shops, red light area which has some great barsaround it ,and its within walking distance of train station.the staff are really friendly.when your in amsterdam the last place your going to be is in your room for the whole weekend and people who complain about a hotel like this need to get out more.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: maspalomas09
Reviews.Content: First off, it's in a great location (Dam Square) so you are not too far from anything. I had visited Amsterdam many times in years gone by and thought of the Kraznapolsky as out of my league (it is rated as a 5 star hotel ... and from the outside looks quite posh). However, found a great deal on the internet for a weeekend break so decided to try for my self. The hotel has a lot of history, but you probably won't find any of it. It's all very dated 80's style. The room we had was large (for Amsterdam), it had a massive King Size bed, tv, lovely bathroom and a small table and chair set. The view was ok but then we were on the sixth floor of one of the back buildings so overlooked the Amsterdam skyline. The hotel seems to be made up of several buildings and I felt sorry for anyone who was in the royal suite as their view would be overlooking another window or worse still a brick wall... so all in all, I felt quite lucky with the view I had. By the way, don't even think of opening the fridge. Just move a can of drink (not actually drink it) and somehow it's automatically added to your bill (even if you put it back in place) ... never had this at any hotel I have stayed before, but never stayed at a NH hotel before so perhaps this is common to them ... Check-in is quite late (3pm) but then check-out is quite late (12 noon) or 5pm on Sundays). Breakfast is the best bit I think. Served in the Winter Gardens ( a huge conservatory style building), it's a buffet eat as you will style affair. Hot and cold dishes, fruit and cereal and even a glass of cava for breakfast .... The only slight criticism I would have is that whilst they do have a plate warmer it is not on so plates are stone cold ... add to this buffet food is warm not hot ... by the time you get back to your table it's probably cold ... Still plenty of it and quite tasty. All in all, slightly underwhelming ... it's not really five star ... rather a conference centre than a posh hotel. Staff are great though.

Reviews.Title: “Highly pricy hotel, conjusted rooms and noisy lifts”
Reviews.Author: DelhiGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Not a very pleasant stay at this hotel. I travelled at a time when there was some event in Amsterdam and hence had to book at this hotel as the normal hotels which i stay at were not available. The hotel was highly overpriced, the rooms were too conjusted (kept banging my legs against the bed). The only good factor is that it is close to the red light area. The lifts were very noisy and staff not very friendly. Would not suggest that you stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkg001
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break in Dam and had a great time, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. I would rate it as about a 4 star with a great location - directly on dam square and a 10-15 min max walk from centraal station (depending on your pace!!). the hotel looked so much better on on the outside from the other ones in the nearby location and inside didnt disappoint either! We stayed B&B basis and the breakfast was great, lots to choose from, cereals, yoghurts, pancakes, fruits, fried breakfast and a continental breakfast - the choice is yours!! Room was good, not massive but big enough for the two of us...its a holiday - why are you spending the whole time in your room?? go out and explore!! I dont know why people always complain on here - we would def recommend the hotel and would probably stay hear again as it is right in the heart of Dam Sq, lots of shops and restaurants locally and also fairly close to the red light area! Some tips are go to the Mexican restaurant near the hotel...come out, take a right and its on that stretch towards the end...also go to Wok to Go on the same stretch for a great quick bite at reasonable price! Great location for the hotel and easy enough to walk to lots of main attrations such as Red Light, Canal ride points, Sex Museum, nightlife and also Anne Franks House. I agree that the internet should be free as it is marketing itself as 5* but thats the only niggle.

Reviews.Title: “No 5 star, no 4 star, no.....star....”
Reviews.Author: Fuykschot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 night, opted for the hotel for it's location........ This turned out to be the best aspect of the hotel......... I was send to elevator 5, which is all the way past the conference rooms in a corner. The elevator smelled really bad, the 6th floor corridor was smelling even worse, and I am sure I woke up each room when I past them, as the floor boards cracked at each step...... My room was ok, but again each step I took, the neighbours woke up..... The bed was fine, the two cup chairs were tinny, too tinny for me to comfortably sit in for longer then 5 min.... The bathroom and shower did the job, but it all looks a bit worn out...... Towels smelled bad. The tv is a great size tv, but reception was poor, breaks every couple of seconds.... Called reception and they said it was because of the weather......??! So all in all, poor standard hotel, would not recommend, neither would I return, sorry. I have worked in this industry for almost 20 years, and I know how the separate the good from the bad..... Would love to hear what the General Manager thinks himself of his property.

Reviews.Title: “Would not come back”
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn427
Reviews.Content: We found small black curly hair on our bed and called the front desk. They changed the linens immediately but I was still not impressed with the accommodations. The only good thing was the bath tub which was roomy and provided some warmth in from the winter temperature. The location is good but the surrounding area is dirty and filled with litter since it is very touristy. We also stayed at Hotel Aalders which was a much better hotel and it included breakfast. The location of Aalders was also much closer to major museums. I would not recommend the Krasnapolsky.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star.....”
Reviews.Author: janeandmax
Reviews.Content: Over priced hotel definately more like a 3 star than a five.Rooms are average nothing more. Stayed in Eden Hotel which was a lot cheaper a couple of months ago and it puts this hotel to shame.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and comfortable bed, but missing some customer service.”
Reviews.Author: JRHT
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this location in Amsterdam, and wow, what a breakfast! Room was small and not 4 stars by U.S. standards. We also checked in early which was super (10:30am). For the money, they could improve on the following: - internet should be free in the business center. they make you get 15 minute passes per day and it's a hassle. - international calling from the rooms does not work well - the halls smell bad - like a horrible cleaning solution, but the rooms smell good - concierge not the most helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Incredible Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: razfine
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in July 2002, but based on some of the reviews, it hasn't changed much. Our room was large with a bed, couch/sitting area, vanity area and large bathroom. It was comfortable. They had an incredible breakfast buffet that I will never forget. It was a bit expensive, but so good that we went back a second time. The Krasnapolsy is located on the Dam Square. It's a very convenient location to take care of business and walk anywhere you need to go. It's also a short walk from the train station. We enjoyed the Krasnapolsy very much and would stay there again if we find ourselves in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: ohiobarney
Reviews.Content: Although my assigned room was small smelly and no hot water on I got an upgrade to a suite on the top floor as there was no other rooms available. The suite was amazing overlooking the war memorial and palace from the 5th floor. The service and eagerness to address my concerns was very good and i really enjoyed staying here and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sehr empfehlenswert”
Reviews.Author: Gabriella15
Reviews.Content: Excellent Only stayed one night as we were doing a road trip of Europe but the hotel was so pleasant we would have extended our booking if we hadnâ€™t had prior committments. The room was modern and enormous, easily the biggest weâ€™ve ever stayed in and in a very good state of repair. Met all expectations of a 5* hotel, everything we could have possibly needed was provided including bath robes and toothbrushes. We were impressed and will stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jaylo41
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam. We have been to Amsterdam a few times before but have never stayed in the Krasnapolsky. I can honestly say it was fantastic. The staff were helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. Our room was great, clean, tidy and well kept. Breakfast in the Winter Room was a highlight every day, there was every kind of breakfast food you could think of to choose from, and even a few things I would never have thought of to have at breakfast! You could eat as much as you wanted, the staff took away your dirty plate and cutlery between each course and replaced it with fresh so you could go for something else. Truly exceptional and well worth having. All in all staying at this hotel totally made our trip that extra bit special. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Not so Grand Krasnapolsky”
Reviews.Author: SohanTanna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was supposedly a 5 star hotel, and very well priced. When we checked in, there was no door man (out of 6 nights the doorman was only there half the time). The building is pretty dated, and it's nothing special inside. The checkin staff were truly great. We got checked in quickly, and headed up to our room. The room was terrible, air con is ineffective and very loud. Bathroom was small, tiny and horrible. The beds were small and dirty just like the rest of the room. Iron was putting stains on our shirts and mini bar wasn't refilled daily. Internet was a true ripoff and barely had signal in the room. The rooms at this hotel are real hit and miss, friends of mine had very small rooms, and some got very nice rooms and one friend got upgraded to an Apartment for free - which was a very nice room. I'm not sure how this hotel got a 5 star rating, but it's not 5 star at all. Would avoid at all costs. There are many true 5 star hotels in amsterdam, and a couple at the same price with FAR better offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed and excellent breakfast in centre of City”
Reviews.Author: PennyW
Reviews.Content: Six of us visited Amsterdam for the weekend, one of our number knew the city very well and booked this hotel for us via justoneroom.com so we got an excellent rate for bed and breakfast. We could not fault it, slap bang in the centre, very comfortable beds and recently refurbished rooms, slightly old fashioned style but everything you should need. the breakfast buffet was amazing, in the beautiful Winter Garden room with everything you could imagine. We had some expensive (but big and well prepared) cocktails on the Saturday night before we went out, other than that did not use hotel catering facilities at all. It is a huge hotel, over 400 rooms and lots of conferences going on and a big party on the Saturday night. My only gripe was that free wifi was limited and in my view more complicated than it need be.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: baggard
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a boozy weekend with work friends on the recommendation of someone who had stayed before. We wanted something very central and this was perfect for that as it's right on Dam Square. My room was massive, clean and not bland with a fab view of the square. Bed very comfortable. Noise didn't bother us as we were out most of the night, but could do if you are after a quieter break. Hotel is very busy and very big (a couple of our group actually managed to get lost trying to find their room) and agree with other reviewers that it doesn't deserve a 5* rating, but if you can get a decent deal it's a good option if you're on a similar sort of trip. Service not remarkable, but we did stay on a saturday night when the hotel was heaving - may be better mid week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: alanatabz
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay at the hotel as a group of 6 over 3 rooms. All the rooms were at the front of the hotel one above the other from the 1st to the 3rd floor. We were on 2st floor, and by time music / screaming in the street had finished it was about 5.30am. at 7am, staging and seating areas were being built up in front of the palace which added further noise. I think, had the hotel had better quality sound proofed windows, stay would have been more enjoyable. Lack of sleep over several days wasn't much fun! Hotel is big / spacious, but very busy. Staff are friendly and rooms are clean. having worked in Holland in the past, the choice of hotel would have been better had we not opted for a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with a good cafe”
Reviews.Author: DrDrinu
Reviews.Content: Had two interconnecting rooms. Checking in was a bit of a nightmare, but this was due to it being the weekend and there were many stag/hens' party people checking in or out. The rooms faced the interior courtyard and were surprisingly quite for being in the middle of the hustle and bustle of dam square. B'fast was not included, but we tried the cafe near the lobby for tea and they had very good cakes with a very posh high tea. Did not try the hotel restaurant which looked good but was too formal to go with children.

Reviews.Title: “very unsympathetic.”
Reviews.Author: pendyWirral
Reviews.Content: we had booked through expedia to stay one night in rotterdam in the manhattan and one night in amsterdam in the krasnapolsky. unfortunately my husbands grandad died and the funeral was for the friday we were due to fly out. we called easyjet and managed to change out flights for a different date for a fee, when we called expedia we were told we would have to contact the hotels ourselves as the booking was non refundable. which we did .the manhattan were very sympathetic and understanding and changed our booking free of charge unlike the krasnapolsky who wouldnt help us even though we didnt want to cancel just change for a different weekend. i was dissapointed that a five star hotel would act in this way at such a sad time .i would have expected this from a back street dive. we are now looking forwards to our stay in amsterdam this weekend in the more luxurious renaissance hotel. if the hotel manhattan could do this for us why couldnt the krasnapolsky?

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler93
Reviews.Content: Central to everything and walking distance to many attractions, the Krasnapolsky is right on Dam Square opposite the Royal Palace. There are numerous restaurants, shops, etc with easy walking distance. The rooms are pleasant if not overwheming but contain everything a traveler might need, right down to the toothpaste. The Dam square location can also be a curse because of the noise at all hours so ask for a room that doesn't face the Square and you will be fine. Every amenity a large hotel can provide is available though you may need to ask for some of them as the layout can be confusing. Frequent specials can bring the cost down considerably so keep your eye out for them.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad hotel , bad stuff”
Reviews.Author: ecofarms
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Amsterdam for three days. We stayed in the hotel for two nights. The stuff is not friendly (not to say agressive) and was very anpleasent to ask for some help . We waited for 15 minutes to get some basic information . The room was very old and dirty .Everything in the room was old and used for years. The dust was everywhere in the room and some places are not cleaned for weeks or months.The carpets were dirty. There was only one bath gel for two people .So we had an extra one from the nearby market . I payed three months before the total amount( 300 euros per day ) and when I was checking in they asked for 100 euros guarantie for their minibar . When I refused they told me that if I dont pay I will get my money back and to go and find some other hotel to stay. Internet is not for free (13euros /day) . It looks like nobody is contoling the quality of the hotel service providers in Holland and that is not good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovley hotel, fantastic location and really friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JH_011
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a long weekend in Amsterdam with my husband. I chose the Grand Krasnapolsky after reading reviews and checking out locations of lots of different hotels. I'm really glad I went with it because the location was perfect. It's not a 5 star hotel as it states but I didn't choose it with that disilusion! I would say it is close to a 4 star but what you get for your money is friendly staff, a nice clean room and a great location. Check out isn't until 12 and they store your cases free of charge on your departure date and still make you welcome after you check out. Our room was on the 5th floor and was at the back so it was really quiet. I chose a smoking room but didn't actually smoke in it in the end and did wander if I'd chose no smoking whether I would have got a more recently refurbished one. It was still really nice though, very clean and didn't smell of smoke. It was also really quiet! I would definatly recomend this hotel and would stay here again if I go back. Avoid bars on the square they charge you double the price for drinks and also be aware that you have to pay city tax which cost us an extra 21 euro's. If you are visiting museums etc get an I Amsterdam card that will save you a few euro's. We also went to the Supper Club which I recomend the hotel booked it for us and printed off the booking which was a good thing because they tried to charge us an extra 40 euro's so if we didn't have it we would of had to pay!! Also last but not least get a train from the airport it only 2.50 euro's a travel agent quoted us 70 euro's in a taxi and it is very quick and straight forward on the train!

Reviews.Title: “You get the feeling they just don't need to try.”
Reviews.Author: emraki
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good, and providing you don't get a room at the front, where its noisy, you probably couldn't find a more central place to stay. Unfortunately, thats really where it ends. My boyfriend and I arrived for a quiet weekend away. I had confirmed our reservation with the hotel 2 days prior, and be assured we would get the double room we had asked for. Upon checking in, we were assured we had not only been given a room type as requested, but had also been upgraded to the 'Royal Wing'. Don't be drawn in... the royal wing is the new part of the hotel that has been done up like a travel lodge. After finding our room, which was adequate - as a travel lodge always is, we realised we had 2 separate single beds, that had been pushed together, with separate duvets and sheets. Not only that, but the room was on a very low first floor, making you feel as if everyone on the street outside could see straight in. When we rang the front desk to ask to be moved to the type of room they had assured us in an email 2 days earlier we would have, we were told they were full, and there was no chance of moving until the nest day. So the next day we moved, to a much nicer room on a higher floor with a good view. We were then very pleased, and thought maybe we had been wrong to judge the hotel initially. However, within 30 minutes of being in the room we were plunged into darkness. None of the lights would turn on. Someone attempted to fix them but was unable to, and we were not offered to move rooms. Upon checking out we told the receptionist of the problem with the lights and were not offered any conpensation whatsoever, in fact we were barely thanked for letting them know for future guests. All in all a very disappointing experience in what should be a 3 star hotel, charging Â£40 a night. Don't be tempted.

Reviews.Title: “A very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChloeEdwards
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good if it is your first trip to Amsterdam, as it is right on Dam Square in the central tourist area. However i would not recommend it if you are a regular visitor to Amsterdam, as it is definately not the prettiest or most romantic part of the city. On arriving at this hotel, we had to queue for what seemed like forever to check in. There was deinately not enough staff on recepetion for the number of guests arriving. The decor of the hotel seemed tired and dated. I would say this hotel definately doesn't deserve it 5 star rating, it's more like a 3 - 4 star hotel. The hotel rooms are large and spacious, but we were expecting a proper double bed, but instead got two single beds pushed together with two single duvet covers...not very romantic. Also the shower wasn't very good, there was hardly any water pressure, and the worst thing was the erratic temperature changes...one minute cold the next scalding hot! Our room overlooked Dam Square...but be warned Dam Square can be very noisy, there was some kind of camp or protest on the Saturday night that we were there, which went on untill 7am!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel survives entirely on it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: mcgreg0r
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the only reason it is a 5 star hotel. It is 'dated' and dull. In need of a 'face lift' - in public and private areas. A lot of the staff are inefficient, unprofessional but more so - rude. For some reason quite a few of the male staff have an arrogance about them. I think a course on customer service would be of benefit. On the contrary some of the staff were very obliging and pleasant. An ideally situated hotel but if not in such a prime area I think it would struggle for credibility .....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: heather3476
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with easyclick.com and got an absolute bargain! Me & my boyfriend stayed here for about the same price our friends paid to stay in a private room at a hostel. Very central and the most amazing breakfast buffet with sparkling wine! I read some bad reviews on here, but one of my friends had been before and recommended it. I'm really glad I listened to her and next time I'm in Amsterdam I'll be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Krasnapolsky Amsterdam Location Location,Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: browtal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a one week stay at the busy Grand Krasnapolsky Hotel in Amsterdam. Having read the mixed reviews we did not know quite what to expect. It exceeded our expectations. We were met by smiling staff and looked after royally. The staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating. Check in time was not the fastest but in view of the size of the hotel it was not slow either, we waited about 15 mins. We had a beautuiful room overlooking Dam Square. The location is wonderful.The only down side was the cost of eating there, we did little of that, it was much too expensive. It is surrounded by wonderful places to eat and drink at reasonable cost. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Standards way behind Asia”
Reviews.Author: johnorval
Reviews.Content: Check in excessively long, staff indifferent. Had to sleep in lobby area because there is no proviso for early arrivals. Direction to room had me going up and down stairs despite there being another lift with a flat route. The room is cramped, the bathroom more so, with little space for luggage and clothing. The air con is noisy and has little adjustment. The key card had to be used more than once on several occasions to open the door. The towels, like the room in general, are thin and worn. Laundry prices are ridiculous. The location is excellent, as is the breakfast. Staff manner did improve somewhat during our stay, and checkout was quick, tho check the extras. On too many occasions, the 'native' Dutch give the impression of brusqueness to the point of arrogance and indifference. Would recommend that management and staff spend time in a four/five star hotel in Asia to compare the difference. There is half an hours free wi-fi per day - in the lobby. This is three star accommodation with four star breakfast and position.

Reviews.Title: “A good four starhotel - where came the fifth from?”
Reviews.Author: annietue
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really central. You have all the main attractions in walking distance. It is a big hotel with two buildings. First they put us in a room which has not been renovated for a good 20 years and where the wallpaper started to come off. After we complaint they gave us a nicer new room. Some of the lights in the room were not working. But at least the bed was very comfortable. If you tried to call the concierge or front desk it took ages until somebody answered the phone. The staff did not seem to understand English very well and some of them seemed not really bothered if you had problems. The breakfast buffet was huge with a lot of choices but the quality of food was medium. I can recommend this if you want to stay central but do not expect a five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: _der_Reisende_10
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disapointed after checking in the hotel. I would expect more from a 5 star hotel. The rooms were OK but to my opinion not 5 stars, tiny bathrom with barely enough space to turn around. The food was also average. The location of the hotel is great though, right in the center of Amsterdam and the conference facilities are very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Double Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: virchow
Reviews.Content: General Amsterdam is littered with hotels owned by the NH chain. I have already stayed in the "Schiller", the "City Centre" and the "Barbizon Palace". They are all o.k. but none of them is great.
