My room in the Krasnapolsky (I had room 3009 in an annex building) was spacious and clean but, like the ones in other hotels of the NH franchise in A'dam, the carpet and furniture are all a bit worn and frayed, every second floor tile in the bathroom was chipped, too. Bath All the amenities are there (including extras like toothbrush, shaving kit, sponge, body lotion) but NH urgently needs to improve on its "Aqua de la tierra" cosmetics/shampoo line with its cheap and aggressive smell of tangerines. Water pressure in the shower is ok but not great. Staff The staff - mainly Dutch nationals - was nice, competent and responsive - but there weren't enough of them. Check-in, check-out and basic concierge services (like getting your luggage stored after check-out) took ages, in fact more than 15 minutes on one occasion. Yes, it was high season, but then again, you pay more in high season, so you should be entitled to expect the same speed of service as in the wintertime. Food Speaking of winter: The Krasnapolskiy's winter-garden breakfast room is quite beautiful; unfortunately, it is not open for dinner. There is a smaller, rather nice looking restaurant though but I haven't had the occasion to dine there. Geography The location of this hotel is very convenient, slap in the middle of old Amsterdam opposite the Royal Palace and only a 6 minutes walk away from the central train station I recommend you take a train from the airport easy, cheap (EUR 3.70) quick and taxis are very expensive (EUR 40 upwards). Acoustics NH hoteles is a Spanish chain, so a high percentage of guests are Spanish, which is a bonus, as I usually have found Spaniards to be polite and not unnecessarily noisy. Also pleasant: No automatic door slamming in the wing where my room was. After 9 am, however, houskeeping in adjoining and above rooms is quite audible. Media Large flat screen TV with lots of international channels. Free WiFi - but limited to half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed large hotel with awesome buffet breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: TomZunder
Reviews.Content: This is a very central Amsterdam hotel behind the war memorial on Dam Square, bordering the ritzy shopping district and also the red light district behind the hotel. It has been operated as part of several hotel chains in it's time and is currently an NH Hotel. The Spanish influence is noticeable, and the cheerful branding and colourful attitude of NH sits quite well alongside a hotel that has a mix of old Dutch style and new modern extensions and annxes. We have stayed at the K many times over the year and it offers good quality in a city sometimes thought of as a hostel haven. The rooms vary from very modern to dated, but housekeeping is diligent and performed well. The TV system was problematic, rebooting itself repeatedly, and maintenance never managed to fix it. I could attach an external media player using SCART, but it took help from maintenance. The restaurant, like many Amsterdam hotel restaurants, is high class and is open and used by non-residents as well as guests. The "tea-room" next to reception is an excellent place to drink coffee and eat apple pie whilst looking out onto Dam Square. There is no pool, as has become the norm for Amsterdam hotels. The conference facilities are good, and the hotel is quite vast and yet doesn't feel overwhelming. There is a wide range of Wireless Internet options in the room, with varying service levels and prices, and 30 minutes of free WiFi in the main hotel lobby. The breakfast buffet at the K is a high point. In a lovely glass roofed Winter Garden room a buffet of food that covers European to USA diets (not Asian tho') is displayed beautifully as a chef prepares omelettes, eggs, pancakes [Poffertjes] and waffles in the centre. Truly a great breakfast and served until late most days. The hotel also has an "Endless Sunday" with very late breakfast times and automatic late checkouts on Sundays, and this is a great treat. All in all, a very good hotel, very good value for money. Located well for high class shopping, culture and/or lowlife nightlife, it is a pleasant high end stay. I have to say I miss pools in Amsterdam hotels, but apart from that.. well worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: fox79
Reviews.Content: There are only two good things about the hotel: location and breakfast (good choice). Otherwise, the hotel is very dated. You can hear every noise from the corridor. The cleaning is not at 4star hotel standard. If you can stay in other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ehwebb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful few days in Amsterdam to celebrate my 50 birthday. We stayed in the Hotel Krasnapolsky which is right on Dams Square, the Hotel was fantastic we booked it over the internet for 3 days we paid about Â£325 which included breakfast which was delicious. When we booked in they upgraded us for nothing and the room was huge, with a huge telly with some English Channels, they also gave us a mini bar but we did not partake as it was extremely expensive, they have ice machines by the lifts so I filled the sink up with ice and put our drinks which we brought from the supermarket in there We were just up the road from the Red Light District. Amsterdam is lovely very lively in places, but quite expensive, we had a drink in the bar next to the hotel 1 pint of lager and a half of bitter 12 euro's so try and drink in places a bit further from the square. We found a supermarket at the back of the Palace which is over the road from the Hotel everything is really cheap so try shopping there, they have fantastic take away salads which are very reasonable, lovely for a picnic in the lovely parks they have there. We also found a lovely canal boat which serves food and drink and you are right on the canal, it is not far from the Anne Frank house. We went on a river cruise which was only 8 euros each and it was an hour long well worth the money. They have hundreds of takeaways which serve every food under the sun so you will not go hungry. I am vegetarian so I snacked on pizza and chips, they have places called Wok and Go which sell noodles etc they are everywhere, they also sell lovely cream cakes they are something else, so don't think you will go hungrey Its is very lively but if you walk out of the main centre around the canals you will find some beautiful canals very quiet bars etc and it is a completely different experience. Hope you have as good a time as we did

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, average for the rest”
Reviews.Author: jlsblts
Reviews.Content: Have checked-in for over 10 times in this hotel last year, mostly for business. The hotel is well known and has a perfect location. This made it easy to invite clients for lunch, visit them or have a drink in the city center after a busy day. The rest is really starting to disappoint me. Check-in is taking in general too long because of the inexperience of the staf, it can take up to 10 minutes a room... Rooms are slightly outdated, beds are average and in some of the rooms you can hear outside noise. I and my colleagues have had minor incidents (like not working keycards, wrong rate type) and the staff was not really customer orientation. Breakfast is amazing, but (too) expensive. Roomservice is good, try the pancake with a smoothie.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...”
Reviews.Author: angelsusan
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, i booked through Travel Republic but was not informed that when you check in you have to pay a deposit incase you use the mini-bar etc, they asked for 400 euros but we got them down to 200 euros (we got this bk when we left), otherwise it was in a great location, the rooms were really cosy and clean and were cleaned everyday. The buffet breakfast was really nice, a huge selection to suit everyone. I would definatly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel 5 stars, room 3 or 4”
Reviews.Author: gcbosma
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a 5 star, but the room we had was definitely not. Small double bed, badly constructed shower (water did not drain because of inclination of the tiles away from the drain) which always had standing water, water temperature constantly changing, with peril of getting scolding hot water, or freezing... Bed not terribly comfortable, pillows terribly thick. Wi-fi not for free in the room: 18 euros a day. Free in the lobby, but only at half an hour bouts: one had to ask the code for every half hour. Location superb, obviously, service as well, as also the restaurant and breakfast. Winter garden a must see, so spend those 28,50 at least once for breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: georgienotts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 'minimoon' after our wedding - the hotel was superb. The room was ready when we arrived - at 11am - and the staff were very friendly and helpful. the room was big and the bed was HUGE! it was all very clean and fresh towels supplied every day, there was free toiletries in the room incl toothbrush/toothpaste, razors, sponges, soap, shampoo etc and more available free of charge from reception. The best thing about the hotel apart from location was the breakfast - OMG!!!! we have never seen anything like it, it is served in the 'winte gardens' which is a beautiful art deco room and there is everything that you could wish for - CHAMPAGNE, freshly cooked waffles with hot cherries, hot chocolate sauce and fresh cream, pancakes, bacon, eggs, sausage, tomatoes with cheese, eggs benedict, lots of fresh fruit, fresh fish - salmon/mackrel, fresh cold meats, fresh cooked bagels, croissants, pastries, muffins, brownies, about 8 different types of bread, rolls, yogurts, freshly squeezed juices, tea and coffee - several types of each, chocolates and sweets!!! AMAZING!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent facility, but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: Taylor1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Aug 5-11, 2010 because I wanted to stay close to the medieval center of town, and the location is great. Right in Dam Square, putting it close to the Central Train Station, making it quite easy to get in or out of Amsterdam, but not so close to the Station that you are in the ghetto or Red Light District. I had seen this hotel rated as 5-stars, but I would call the facility 3 or 4 stars out of five. I had a single room on the 5th floor off of Elevator 5 (this is a huge hotel) and the room appeared to have been recently renovated. It was very small, with a twin bed, but had a private, tile bath, flat screen HD TV with satellite, phone, and hotel safe. Wireless internet is available in your room for an additional charge. My room was next to the elevator, which was quite noisy, so avoid that if possible I paid $168 per night before taxes, which did not include breakfast. Breakfast can be purchased for an additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: JDE260767
Reviews.Content: Dirty, tired old facilities, poorly maintained, long queues at reception, mistakes with reservation etc etc. To be fair to the hotel they responded well to a complaint about the room by offering a free night, but this would not entice me back. Friends commented that newly refurbished rooms were good but we didn't experience that luxury. If you are checked into room 1052 or 1053, leave immediately! PS: Parking was 50 euros per night!

Reviews.Title: “Back here again!”
Reviews.Author: renegadeLondon
Reviews.Content: Another stay at this favourite hotel of mine everytime I visit Amsterdam. Booked Deluxe Room as usual in the Royal Wing which is now known as The Amsterdam Wing. It seemed some renovation has been done to that side of hotel. Decided to upgrade however at check-in to an Executive Room which took some prolonged time as the check-in staff looked under training process. The room offered was on 4th floor facing the Queen's Palace. Finally I got the room I always wanted in the whole of Amsterdam for 7 years I been coming to the city. Amazing views from the room and sufficient space for 2 people and twin beds. The furniture however outdates even Classic style. Beds are very comfortable and the cleanliness is somewhat satisfactory. I absolutely did not like the Dutch toilet which is facing the wrong way. Although I never seen a larger bathroom in any other hotel. There was separate toilet, seperate shower and separate bath all with indvidual doors !!! Air conditioning is weak and more or less like a mouse coughing on you in an annoying way but it does make a noise. Tea & Coffee facilities are provided but under provided with sugar and milk. Overall I loved the room purely on the basis of its view and the space available and was worth paying 200 Euros per night. The only downside to the room was the toilet and outdated furniture and room environment. The check-out took long again because of the same staff checking me out. So my advice, prepay the room upon check-in and ask Express check-out. will be back here again I know though.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, heritage but business”
Reviews.Author: Luis7804
Reviews.Content: Wrting revies on some hotels are more fun than others. Writing a review on this hotel is not much fun. You have to give this hotel a really good rate since the breakfast is fantastik, the fitnessroom is really good, the location ist great, the stuff is friendly, the rooms are big and nice and the hotel has a great heritage. But since its an NH Business Hotel with the ordinary businessmen as guests, it looses a lot of soul. Its like eating in a great restaurant but the waiter is a snob. You will never go there again, just beacause it did not feel right...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room in Cente of Amsterdam's Equivalent of Leicester Square!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha241
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my partner and our flight arrived in the evening. We got a train transfer from Schipol Airport for 3.70 Euros each single (take coins with you as you buy the tickets from the automated machine in the arrivals hall). We walked ten minutes directly opposite from the station to the Grand Krasnapolksy (AMS consists of cobbled streets so wear good walking shoes and trolley suitcases!!) and it is a striking hotel in Dam Square. The staff were talking amongst themselves and after a few minutes of waiting attended to us. As we were the only ones there, we were checked in promptly and upgraded to a the Amsterdam Wing (a part of the hotel which you need separate key cards to access). We also had the lazy Sunday included in our package. I think from reading previous reviews on tripadvisor, that for this 3 day package, or long stays they give you the newer rooms? Not sure what the hotel policy is. A member of staff carried our suitcase to our room. Our room was 6135 and it was a new room, walk-in-wardrobe, wooden floors, separate desk, wide screen TV that for some reason kept going on and off?? at times. Air conditioning does not work, so we kept our balcony door ajar (was safe as is 6 floors up but did let in the noise from the restaurants below. The minibar is one of those that automatically charges to your room if you take anything out, so remember not to touch anything unless you want to pay for it. The bathroom was large, with a lovely power shower and bath and all the normal toiletries. The hairdryer did not work, but I only found out on the day of check-out. There is a safe and tea and coffee making facilities. We were given bathrobes and slippers also. There is also a large balcony and the window opens out fully with some help from a member of staff. Is handy for smokers. On checkout, and other parts of the day, we did notice extremely long queues and guests having to wait a very long time to check-in and the staff did say that the rooms weren't clean, I think maybe they need more cleaning staff. My room was cleaned daily and to a high standard but I think with this hotel, it maybe that they put couples who want some special or quiet time in separate rooms to big groups. We got a free voucher to use the internet in the business centre also on the last day to print out our boarding passes. The hotel is within walking distance to all the sights(Red Light District, Anne Frank House, Van Gogh Museum) in that order also the shops, restaurants, coffee shops, pancakes places etc...We also stumbled upon the Love Life Festival for cancer and there are raves in areas (this one was near the Red Light District) and rounded off our trip nicely! All was so civilised, no rowdiness at all! Dutch are really friendly people! If you are going to AMS this summer, do book online for as much as you can, or you will end up in very very long queues!! P.S. Air conditioning does not work, so we kept our balcony door open (was safe as is 6 floors up)

Reviews.Title: “~Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonTerry1955
Reviews.Content: It was our anniversay when we stayed there and we were greeted with a "Happy Anniversary" from a Manager, given vouchers for a free drink and upgraded to a superior room. The room was marvellous overlooking the street at the side of the hotel. Unfortunately on the second night we stayed there the air conditioning became faulty and so we were moved to a room overlooking Dam Square which was also a lovely room. The breakfast at the hotel was amazing, food and Champagne was plentiful and good and I would recommend the experience to anyone. The Winter Garden where breakfast was taken was one of the most stunning rooms I have ever eaten in. The location was marvellous with lovely restaurants and bars all around. The staff were wonderful, even at the last moment when I realised I had locked my key into my suitcase together with passports and tickets and they got someone to come down to reception and break open the padlock for me. Easy walk to and from the train station. The garden bar was lovely and relaxing and the geniver bar just along the walkway at the back of the hotel is definitely worth a visit! If we ever came to Amsterdam again we would definitely stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb! We must have been the lucky ones.”
Reviews.Author: dodgeandfranky
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 3 nights for my 40th Birthday celebration with my husband and some friends. After reading the reviews I was really stressing about our arrival as I was the one who had chosen it. I needn't have been worried. We arrived at 10 a.m after an early flight and just wanted somewhere to store our luggage. Two out of our three rooms were ready and we were able to check-in there and then. We were upgraded at no charge into executive rooms in the Amsterdam Wing, it was gorgeous! Big rooms, wooden floors, modern furnishings and bathrooms, bathrobes, slippers, lovely toiletries the list goes on. When we arrived back later in the day I had a Birthday card, large bottle of sparkling water and a tin of biscuits left in our room from the hotel staff which was a really nice gesture. Breakfast was another treat the restaurant it was served in was beautiful and had a huge selection of hot and cold food, we had this included in our rate which I would recommend as they charge 28 euros for it which is quite expensive. All the staff were really friendly and we spent a lot of time in the Summer Garden bar trying the cocktails!! It was quite expensive but worth it for a special occasion and a really lovely setting. The hotel location on Dam Square is probably the best you can get in Amsterdam, everywhere we visited was very close by and within walking distance. We had a fantastic time and got a really good deal, 3 nights for the price of 2 including breakfast for Â£265 per couple, you pay more for a good b & b, so no complaints from us!!

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 2.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinnaclet
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers have stated this hotel only has 5 stars areas - it's location and the Wintergarden for breakfast. I spent 6 nights here while on a business trip. All I can comment on is the 50% of the rooms that were built in the 1950's. For US readers, they are like old, worn out mid-chain hotels in the US. The biggest issue is that while you have an air conditioner, it cannot drop the temperature more than a degree or two. Therefore, I spent the entire time with the blinds closed, everything off in the room that was possible and the AC running full blast and still could not sleep at night due to the heat. The window only opens about 2 inches so it was not possible to go that route either. Lots of promises made by the staff to send someone to fix the AC, but no one came the entire time I was there. Incredibly small bathroom, and no wardrobe space at all. I travel very light but could still not put close in the closet - I had to live out of a suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “The Location is the only good thing”
Reviews.Author: BrickerHouston
Reviews.Content: The location is the only good thing about this hotel. My husband and I were meeting our friends who booked the hotel the exact same way, but we didn't get the same type of room. They checked in before us and I knew from other reviews you have to ask for a refurbished room so we did the same. Then the receptionist said that would be 30 more euros a night, so we declined. Later to find out our friends did the same thing and got the upgrade, guess it was just luck. Arriving to our room was a little dissapointing, little did we know it was the highlight. The room was dated which we knew it was going to be by not getting the refurbished, but it looked clean. So we walked into the bathroom and that was the real dissapointing thing, it looked like an old YMCA bathroom, it actually had stalls. I needed to go to the bathroom and I walked into the shower. (I've attached a picture) The only good thing is the location if you like staying in the tourist area which I love, the royal palace is directly in front of you, there huge department store is directly on your right and it's easy to find on a map.

Reviews.Title: “Super Luxury and central location”
Reviews.Author: KunalAjinkya
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Krasnapolsky for 3 nights in May10 around 160 Euros a night on a long weekend trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is located in the centre of the main tourist area and facing the Naational monument and Dam Square. Unbeatable location !! Its a convinient 10 minute walk on Damrak from Centraal station where the shuttle train to Schipol arrives. Several trams also stop at Dam which is convinient to get around. The rooms are luxurious and I specially enjoyed the lounge facing the Dam square. Madame Tussauds is across the road which is convinient specially due to the long queues. Other tourist areas such as Ronkin and the infamous red light district are a few minutes on foot. A must try is the food outlet on Dam called Mannekenpis which has long queues for the fries. Overall a fantastic hotel for enjoying the best of Dutch hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Like watching paint dry!!”
Reviews.Author: bexbex01
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a one night stay in this hotel and I just had to put a review on here regarding the check in procedure. We arrived at the check in desk at 15:00 and finally received our key card in order to gain access to our room at 16:15. I have never ever experienced such slow service in my life. There were three members of staff checking guests in but we were timing them and on average they were taking approximately 20 minutes over each client. None of the staff looked like they were confident in what they were doing and all seemed to have a rather confused look on their faces. I really couldnâ€™t understand the logic in not keeping the keycards at the check in desk either, surely this would be the most convenient place for them? It would also prevent the check in staff from having to disappear out back to collect them for every single client?? The hotel itself and our room was nice enough however based on the amount of time we wasted from our day waiting in line to get checked in, on future visits to Amsterdam I will certainly be using another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They need to respect their guests a little better”
Reviews.Author: Westcountrygentleman
Reviews.Content: A nice enough hotel in a great location. We had cheap bookings so the rooms being out the back of the building with a poor view and a bit of a funny smell didn't bother us that much. The rest of the hotel seemed tidy and the staff were pleasant enough. What shocked and appalled me was the remote activation of the large TV set in the bedroom to WAKE UP THE GUEST on the day of departure. At 6am in the morning the TV was remotely activated to convey a message. The message being that the agreed checkout time had been reduced by 5 hours!! due to the fact that they were a little busy..... The TV was again turned on THREE TIMES between 6am and 7am to ensure that a good nights sleep was brought to an abrupt and very annoying end. This is supposed to be a high-end hotel. I've never been treated with such disdain when staying in an establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Just about a good 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: jacob123
Reviews.Content: Booked it as 5*. should have known on arrival thAt things were bad. No on on chech in, when she finAlly arrived she was trainee and didn't know what to do. After 10 mins, others arrived. They had been on a tea break! My room was ok, except for hairs in the bath, a cracked washbasin and broken trouser press. When I complained. The answer was they had no other rooms at that rate available. I was looking for a new room necessarily - just a clean, working one. A reason I booked hotel was they pride themselves on including a late check out till the Sunday evening at 5 pm. I got a message on my tv at midnight on Saturday to say as they were busy it would be a normal check out time. When I phoned reception they said they were too busy. I refused to move and they offered to change it to 3pm. which I also refused. The attitude in this hotel is: we do what we want.. Take it or leave it. Should also mention the grubby carpets and curtains, but it begins to seem trivial to the rest of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Dam expensive”
Reviews.Author: TopdocGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star hotel but my room was 3/4 star. The toiletries are cheap and nasty (orange colour and perfume). Stained furnishings and poor quality bed. Breakfast was expensive but plenty of cafes nearby to choose from. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location in Dam squaqre 10 minutes walk from Central Station. Public areas are nice and more 5 star than the rooms are. This is a business hotel. Fine if someone is paying the bill but if going for pleasure I'm sure there are better value places to stay in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Basically a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreawasa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has some lack, both in services and in general. We got a miserable small room at the beginning, located almost in the basement and with a blind window. On our request we were moved to a much better room (but why we had to ask if they got better rooms?) The hotel is located in different buildings, so it's reasonable to imagine the rooms standard and size varies a lot. Don't expect your room to be done more than once a day. No way to ask. The concierge, although kind, was really unable to give any suggestion on restaurants and basic town services as boat renting. 5 stars are a big overestimation.

Reviews.Title: “super luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: ritesh147
Reviews.Content: where Windmills still wield their magic. There's a photo stop at one - note how the sails turn counter-clockwise. Clogs and Holland are inseparable and a factory visit demonstrates this traditional business. The canals beckon as you board a glass topped boat and glide past regal mansions, houseboats and bridges. A canal cruise in Amsterdam is a rewarding experience.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever..lives up to its rating”
Reviews.Author: Pals87
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this is rated 128 on TA ...location is perfect smack in Dam Square, you can either walk from the train station or take tram. I had booked a standard room for 2 nights. Room was spacious, elegant and nice bathroom with quality toiletries , they also offer extra items incase you have forgotten one. they offer Pillow menu - I absolutely loved it We hadn't booked breakfast so they offered discount vouchers, still we didn't take the offer as being vegeterians, didnt think Euro 22 was value for money for us, particularly. didnt eat at the restuarant, but ordered room service - they served the best Veg Lasagna. offered free business centre vouchers twice ..once we had to check the weather and other to print KLM boarding pass . The staff was polite and gave us early check in like 3-4 hrs without any hesitation ..which I think was comendable..despite being very busy during that time. Very high standard of service I have seen across Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BetelgeuseIndia
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location at the heart of Amsterdam - the Dam Square. This is the most happening place in Amsterdam. Staff are friendly and are quick with service, something that's difficult to find in Europe. Most pubs and nightlife are around this place. The Madame Tussauds Wax Museum is just round the corner. The Dam Square is always buzzing with activity, so there's something for everyone. The famous Casa Rosso is also round the corner. Great place, great accomodation and service. Good breakfast spread in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, even better room”
Reviews.Author: milofly
Reviews.Content: We really liked Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky. Even though it is an old hotel it was really nice. We spent two nights here with an extended weekend with a late check out Sunday and free minibar and Breakfast included. On arrival we were checked in and was surprised by an upgrade to an executive room on 1. floor facing The Dam. Large room with a really comfortable King Size bed. The weather was really warm so the aircondition was really nice. Location couldn't be better. Breakfast at the Winter Garden is really special. The food, the coffee, the juice, the hot, the cold were great and everything was perfect sitting in the charming Winter Garden. Would love to return again.

Reviews.Title: “the best location thats all !!”
Reviews.Author: DaLaL_ShaNe3a
Reviews.Content: we stayed in nh grand hotel krasnapolsky for 14 night in august 2009 its in amazing location just in front of the dam square we was really lucky to have anew modern room with an amazing view over the dam square but be aware most of the room was too old and updated the reception was always busy with tourist and the stuff wasn`t that helpfull and friendly for me its not a 5* hotel i would stay here again because i like the location and thats all this hotel need alot of work and afull renovation to be areall 5* hotel i`ve stayed in alot of 5* star hotel much butter than this hotel even a 4* hotel, but i would recommend this hotel for its location its really fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: laneyflah
Reviews.Content: I searched through the internet for about 2months tryin to find the best hotel to stay in in amsterdam i brought my boyfriend as a surprise for his 21st lastyear. i couldnt beliceve the amount of hotels that said ''best location'' but when i was there i seen most of them and was disgusted!! luckily i decided to stay in this hotel, i think that compared to most of the hotels in amsterdam this shuold be rated as a 10*, coz the rest of them are pure sh**!! it is literally smack bang in the middle of dam square, right beside madame tussuds, within walking distance of everything! the staff are so friendly and meet you outside and take you luggage off you, absolutly no noise in the room, clean room, didnt bother getin breakfast coz it was a bit pricey we got a lovely full irish in an irish pub just down the road! i recommend this 2 ANYONE goin to amsterdam! hope this was helpfull!

Reviews.Title: “There are two parts to this hotel - the back section is 2 Star”
Reviews.Author: LightsleeperLondon
Reviews.Content: As the previous reviewers noted, the location is great and during the Queen's day weekend it had a buzz of activity at it's doorstep which is unmatched. But make sure you know now that there is a front section which looks 5 Star (although other reviewers don't think so) and a 2 star section at the back overlooking the red light district industrial zone. We ended up being lumped in that section where the rooms were like a 2 star budget motel. The real issue is that this hotel's management does not respond to serious complaints. The hotel booked me an airport shuttle where the driver threatened me for 5 times the fare quoted by the hotel staff. I was released once screaming for the police. I later complained to the hotel a few times and they still have not replied and clearly do not care that they are partly responsible for customer's safety. With this in mind, I would recommend staying where the price matches the quality of the room away from the centre. The transportation system is great and Amsterdam is not that big - most areas are walking distance and you DO NOT need a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location but not 5*”
Reviews.Author: robandkimmeek
Reviews.Content: I wanted to treat my wife to a 5* experience in Amsterdam but we were extremely disappointed. The hotel is located right in the centre of Amsterdam, a five minute walk up the Damrak from Centraal Station. We arrived on Queen's Day, a feast day celebrating the birthday of Queen Beatrix, and had to walk from the station as the roads were closed to trams and taxis. This was not a problem as the sun was shining and there was a carnival atmosphere. Our problems started on checking in. We were allocated room 1108 which was small and definitely not my idea of 5*. We asked to change rooms and were told that it would be possible if we had not settled into 1108. As we had not unpacked I left my wife at the desk to sort out the formalities while I went upstairs to remove our cases from the room. When I came down my wife was walking towards me and informed me that they would not exchange rooms. I then went to the reception where I explained that my wife was very upset and that our 5* treat was being ruined right from the start. Then all of a sudden they found us an alternative room 1002 which was much better but still not 5* in my opinion. I have read reviews here that you pay for location and whilst that may be true to some extent, if a hotel advertises itself as 5* then you should expect 5* facilities. If I was to put up a tent on Dam Square would I be able to classify it as 5* just because itâ€™s on Dam Square? I think not. I have stayed in better 3* and 4* hotels - this hotel was 4* at best in my opinion. Also the hotel was very expensive. Fortunately I had booked a package including breakfast and mini-bar. Breakfast for those who had not pre-paid was a staggering â‚¬28.50 â€“ yes the breakfast is very good but â‚¬28.50 good? Also mini-bar prices were high with two vodka and cokes costing â‚¬20. We also had a look at the hotel bar prices and decided to drink out, and judging by the emptiness of the bar, so had everyone else. All in all we enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam but the hotel is definitely over-rated and very expensive. I did not mind paying what I did because of the location and the inclusive breakfast/mini-bar package but I could have stayed in a hotel with similar facilities in the same area for a lot less. I could recommend this hotel to a friend but only if the price was right. I think that I paid well over the odds for the standard of accomodation that we were allocated.

Reviews.Title: “My experience was different than the other reviewers...”
Reviews.Author: Trplvr80
Reviews.Content: I too stayed at the hotel due to the volcano, but my experience was different. While I heard that some rooms were small, old, and smelly, my room was not any of those things. Perhaps it was one of the upgraded rooms? I'm not sure. But my room didn't have carpet, and looked recently renovated. I stayed in the wing that was across the courtyard, so the only annoying thing was that it was cold when I would pass from my room to the main hotel and the 3 times I had to use my key before I could access my room. But the room was a good size (I had what seemed like 2 doubles pushed together). It was always clean and the bed was comfortable. My suggestion to the hotel though is that the TV channels could be improved because it was fairly limited for an international hotel. The best thing about the hotel has got to be the staff though. They were so helpful and it was pretty chaotic there with all the hotel guests. I have to admit we were pretty demanding and they were always very pleasant and calm. Every day they helped us call the airline and by day 2 called my room by 9am to let me know we could stay an extra night. It helped relieve some of the stress from the situation since otherwise I didn't know where I was going to stay. They went beyond what I expected and even knew all our names by the 3rd day we were there (I stayed 6 nights). The location can't be beat....there are trams right outside the hotel and the train station is just a 5 min. walk. It's a pretty area to walk around, with plenty to see and shopping. This hotel is probably closer to a 4 star hotel, but I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there despite the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel for 5* rating”
Reviews.Author: RSWTravels
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel as we were stranded due to the Iceland Volcano in Amsterdam - we booked this hotel from the Tourist booth at Schiphol and were told it was a fabulous 5 Star hotel. We were going to book for 4 nights but ended up booking for 1 night only and thought we would make a decision booking for the remaining nights based on when we got to the hotel. We were really happy we did not book for the rest of the nights as we were incredibly disappointed at the room for a 5 Star hotel. The room was incredibly overpriced for the quality - extremely out-dated and felt quite old and unclean. The staff were helpful - however, we have stayed in far better 5 Star hotels and have never experienced something like this. The room required serious upgrades, the carpets were quite old and stained, the bathroom looked worn out for a 5 star status and felt a little unsanitary. The hotel is located near Dam Square - however right across the hotel is a carnival which is incredibly bright/noisy. I would not recommend this hotel for the room we received - it was incredibly overpriced and did not even include breakfast for that cost.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location with New Emphasis on Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: The location on Dam Square is a 10-minute walk from Centraal Station, although lugging a rolling bag on cobblestones is harder than I expected! The trains to/from Schipol run every 10 minutes, and are easy+inexpensive. We checked in at 4:00, and I had e-mailed in advance to request a quiet room (having come from noisy Venice.) The original room assigned was next to an elevator, so I agreed to wait 45 minutes for a different one to be cleaned (not a big deal--left bags with the bellmen and headed out to take pictures.) The front desk was apologetic, gave us free drink vouchers, and the new room was quiet, as promised, overlooking the interior Winter Garden. Room was huge (by European standards) with a wonderful all-tile bath, great towels and thick terry robe. At 9:00 pm, the doorbell rang, and the frontdesk sent up bottled water, a box of designer cookies, a handwritten note, and a voucher for an upgraded room at our next visit to an NH hotel. I was surprised but pleased by the gesture--I hadn't been upset that I had to wait. The hotel is quite large, and very busy, with a wide assortment of rooms. Be sure to specify if you have special concerns--this is our fourth stay, and each room has been very different. Many airline crew stay here, and it is popular with business people. The front desk speak every language imaginable. The area is very, very busy since it borders the Red Light District, and seems a bit edgier than in the past. Once inside, the hotel is an elegant oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: DryProp
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I read some of the other reviews and they were not 100% positive. Remember, you are paying for location! Here are my thoughts: 1. We arrived at 7 AM. They let us store our bags and check in early (at noon). 2. It is in an awesome location. We walked to all of the close sites. It was also only a 15 minute walk from the main train station. The Dutch people whom we talked to along the way were incredibly helpful in giving us directions. 3. Lots of cool cafes close by to sit in a people watch. We heartily recommend the Europub, located right next door. Ask for Tristan as he was our bartender and was both amazingly helpful with directions and information! He even downloaded some sogns that we requested for free!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Digs”
Reviews.Author: lindsaygScotland
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. On arrival we were upgraded to an apartment. It was amazing!!! It had a kitchen with a microwave and fridge and even had its own washing machine. The bedroom and living room both had 40 inch plasma tv's. The breakfast was out of this world. There was everything you could think of and had the best pancakes ever!!! Would definetely stay here again and don't understand the bad reports it has been given on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room...”
Reviews.Author: Brian_in_NH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Krasnapolsky a few times. It is always friendly, clean, and comfortable. It's got an unbeatable location in Dam Square within walking distance of anything you could want to do in Amsterdam. The rooms are clean and comfortable and well appointed. The staff are friendly and provide service with a smaile.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the price/service!!”
Reviews.Author: deeperblue82
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Amstrs many times and thought that this hotel would be a real treat for my partners birthday. Checked in ok. Rooms are ok but not as grand as you would expect and the bathroom was dated and in all the rooms needed a refurb. Bed was enormous though so that was a good thing. Most annoying for me was the service (or lack of it) for the cost of the room (150 euros a night). The Conceirge couldnt do enough and could not be faulted but the reception...meh....poor attitude indeed...something i would expect from a budget hotel with five rooms. On the Friday night i arrived back at the room at 2am. Being english i wanted a cup of tea in my room (facilities were provided) unfortunatley there was no milk so i asked for some to be organised for my room.....After smiling at me and stating that she knew what milk was the receptionist told me that i would have to call room service from my room....why couldnt she do it for me???? On the Saturday night i asked for a stamp to post a card and was told the business studio was closed and i woul have to call in the moring after 10-30am!!!!! I only wanted a stamp.......Why couldnt he take the card from me and do it for me???? Great location but too expensive and poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: mellymel
Reviews.Content: The Grand Krasnapolsky is situated in the heart of Amsterdam right on Dam Square which is best location of all. Yes the Hotel is not modern and may need a little upgrading to make it a 5* hotel but at the same time it does have character and was clean and functional. We found the staff helpful and checked in and out without any problems. Our room was large and yes the lighting in the bathroom is a bit poor but the selection of toiletries is great. The large breakfast buffet is great and does really include champagne, it is also open till 12 noon on Sunday so you can have a lie in first. I got a good hotel deal that included breakfast, think I may have paid 30 euros for one days breakfast to have a go but it is too expensive to eat there everyday if you have to pay separately. The best thing about this hotel which I am very suprised is not hardly mentioned is that the hotel has its own gin distillery just behind the new wing in a little alley way. It is called the Wynand Fockink and it is a little pub - no seats, music, nothing - just loads and loads of flavoured gins to try which are fantastic (if you don't like the taste of gin don't let that put you off). On our first visit of many we spoke to the barman for advice as we didn't know where to start. He then asks you questions about what type of tastes you like and presents you with a drink. It is also a rule you have to take your first sip at the bar without lifting the glass. We managed to visit everyday and I so glad we found this hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit - even if only for breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: kshowarth
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few days R&R in Amsterdam, staying at the Grand Krasnapolsky. It's located on Dam Square so handy for most areas. Rooms are large and clean. The breakfast that was included is out of this world - had read thisin a few other reviews but wasn't prepared for how great it really was! and all served in the gorgeous Winter Garden - a pleasure in itself. Staff helpful and would definitely stay here again when the Dam. We booked this through Travel Republic and, yet again, we got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel with Best Location”
Reviews.Author: RobynPringTravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Amsterdam hotels, including the NH Grand Krasnapolsky 4 times in the past. What I like about it is the perfect location set upon Dam square. Walking out the doors in the morning and seeing the Royal Palace is one of my favorite things in the world. The food is very good, the rooms are clean and comfy and they have one of the best breakfast's in town. On the negative side, rooms tend to be overpriced and most of the rooms are somewhat small. The hotel is HUGE so it is always super busy and crowded in the lobby. The hotel is divided into several sections so just getting to an elevator can be several minutes walking depending what area your room is in. Its an easy place to get lost in and I imagine it would be a nightmare in a fire scenario. Still, I do quite like this hotel and would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay right in the center of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: tegrimm
Reviews.Content: By far the best Hotel I stayed in the last time in Europe. a cut above the rest in Amsterdam and pretty much anywhere. a bit pricy but well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Great location terrebly overated”
Reviews.Author: PondJumper100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is listed as a five star hotel. However it would be generous to give it three. The hotel has seen better days but it is in dire need of a major upgrade. Plumbing fixtures (hot vs. cold water) were erratic. Very poor lighting in the bathrooms. Poor air circulation and outdated fixtures. Expensive and mediocre breakfast. The worst concierge service ever. I requested to have them make a reservation at a restaurant that I had been to in a previous visit. They said that they had confirmed the reservation, yet when we got to the restaurant; we found that it had been closed for a week for renovations. We ended up going to a very good restaurant across the street. The location is indeed great. It is too bad it is not as nice as some of their sister NH hotels featured on their looping internal TV station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but terrible Hotel policy”
Reviews.Author: Biopharm
Reviews.Content: Good location of the hotel. Heating in the room was out of oder and staff was try to provide a heater (providing a heater in 5* hotel from my opinion inappropriate). Amount of the deposit is incredible for the 7 nights hotel is asking 750 euro and if you don't have a credit card they want to have this amount of money in cache. View from the window is poor, the window looked out onto a brick wall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: throppy
Reviews.Content: If you are going to the "Dam", there can't be too many places better than the Krasnapolsky. Perfect location (especially for New Years Eve) right on Dam Square, and if you are lucky enough to get a front facing room, you can do plenty of people watching from your window! The rooms are a bit hit or miss. I have stayed here several times, and the quality of the rooms i have been given has varied enormously. Best room I had was above the main reception, right on the front overlooking the square. It was a huge room, with a huge bed, and was very nice indeed. Breakfast is a pleasure. Held in the Winter Garden, it's a very nice buffet, and will set you up nicely for the day, although it was a little expensive. Easy for access to Centraal Station, the Red Light District, and the main shopping areas in Amsterdam Centrum. Staff as friendly as can be expected in any city hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: lisashaysteve
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. A complete mixture of old & modern styles. The breakfast in the winter gardens was perfect especially on the morning of my 30th birthday I was able to sip champagne & eat smoked salmon. I was worried at first that it might be too posh but most people were in jeans & very friendly. The rooms were small but had everything you needed especially telephones including 1 in the shower? Word of warning-don't touch the mini bar, v.expensive. Amsterdam in general is the most expensive place i've been to. The average beer will set you back 7 euros. A 3 course dinner for 2 is about 90 euros. If it wasn't for a special occasion we would have settled for mcdonalds! The Amsterdam dungeons were great fun & also the sex museum is a must.

Reviews.Title: “only ok”
Reviews.Author: Ryano182
Reviews.Content: got a room with a view onto the square which was nice but the old alluminium windows let every passing car sound like a train and they didnt help keep out the cold either. The rooms were ok a good 3* standard the lobby, bar and restaurant were nicer but overall if you wanted to stay in a 5* there is better out there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, lovely stay in amsterdam would def return”
Reviews.Author: daveyt2009
Reviews.Content: myself and GF stayed in the nh grand hotel krasnaplowski in dam sq amsterdam on the 16/02/10. we flew with aerlingus to schipol. we found the hotel very well located, clean and staff very friendly. firstly the hotel is on dam sq, in the very centre of amsterdam, facing madame tussades and the royal palace. all attractions are within 5-10 mins walking distance. we got the train from schipol airport to amsterdam centraal it cost â‚¬4 each for a 1 way. As you walk out of central station off the train the hotel is just a 10 MIN walk across the bridge and straight down the street to dam sq. As you enter dam sq the hotel is over on the left. the lobby is huge, nicely decorated but a bit busy, we were only 10 mins checking in and found the staff very friendly, plus they all spoke english. the hotel do take â‚¬150 from your credit card should you decide to use the mini bar etc but this is not charged to your card upon checkout, its a security measure should you do a runner. the hotel itself i would prob compare to a 4 star hotel here in ireland but good compared to some european hotels i have stayed in. the room 1025 was huge, well lit, with a monstrous bed sooooooo comfty. we really enjoyed our stay. there was a bath, seperate shower basic bathroom, basic but clean. regarding the attractions around the hotel, if you walk out of the lobby and turn left and left again the red light district is about 5 mins walk down the street and well worth a visit, i would advise visiting during the day as its mostly drunk or stoned males at night wondering around. a bit pervy for me but a giggle all the same. as you would walk along this street there is a lovely cafe where you can get lovely coffee and pastries yum!!!! i think its called rene crossaints. for eating in the evening we ate in the same place each night, o reilly's bar. the food was class, and very reasonable, 9-10 euro for main course. the staff were really nice. to find this pub walk out the hotel door straight acoss the sq keeping to the left of the palace and across about three streets and its on your left. it also had all the soccer matches on big screen tv's. nice one. the only down fall is they charged â‚¬7 for pint bottle magners but pints of local beer are about â‚¬4.80. i wouldnt advise eating in any restaurants around dam sq they are mad expensive â‚¬20 for a simple main course. mad!!!!!! the ice bar and heineken brewery are just a tram away and while a bit expensive worth a visit. take tram 9 it will cost about a euro each and you can buy tickets from the driver. if its shopping your into there is a shopping street beside madame tussudes its huge with loads of shops but clothes are fairly expensive if its anne franks house you want to visit just keep walking past o reillys pub and take 2n right its about 10 mins walk down that street but huge queues. better to get there early in the morning. to visit the sex musuem its on your right as you walk from central station toward dam sq. we relly enjoyed pur stay and would have no problem returning to this hotel, and would have no problem recommending this hotel to my family members. i dont know what some of the reviewers are on about. anyway enjoy

Reviews.Title: “hotel took half our spending money on checking in!”
Reviews.Author: skintscotland
Reviews.Content: On checking into hotel,imagine our complete shock when we were told we had to hand over 300euro deposit for 3 nights[half our spending money!]i was advised that this was in case we used any facilities within hotel during our 3 nights and we would be given a refund on check out if we did not use any facilities ie,drinks from mini bar etc.every morning while we were just out of bed there was a knock on our door and a member of staff would come in to open mini bar and count items[we found this to not only be very intrusive but very insulting to say the least]when i go on a much needed break the last thing I expect is for someone to be knocking at my room door in the early hours expecting to enter my room and check mini bar.the price of breakfast is well over the top for what was on offer.i also feel that although some of the staff were friendly enough they could be doing with some customer service training in good manners.the hotel was situated in an excellent position near a wealth of amenities but to rate it 5 star is over the top.oh and just to say that we were not the only guests to make a complaint about the 'deposit'on arrival!

Reviews.Title: “One of the tiniest rooms I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ordflyer
Reviews.Content: Located on a square near the center of town, and conveniently located only about 5-7 minutes by walk away from Central Station, this hotel could be so much more. Check in was slow, and since it was about noon, my room wasn't ready. However, for a mere â‚¬45 you could upgrade your room and get in early. Not selecting this, perhaps I should have when eventually my room opened up. A confusing set of elevators -- even asking the staff there for help was confusing as the signs on the outside of the elevators indicating rooms was not the same as the signs on the INSIDE of the elevator.....there are at least 4, if not more sets of elevators to get to rooms. Arriving at my room, it was one of the tiniest rooms that I have ever stayed in (including Japan). At a rate of â‚¬197 I would have expected more. It was a twin bed, and I would guess less than 2-3 feet of room on any of the sides of the bed. Fortunately, the windows opened overlooking a lovely room view of another building. Nice location -- it is easy to walk from here to a lot of places, but I have to believe that there is better value for money elsewhere. Overall, a disappointment -- no major disasters -- just not worth the money and it could easily be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, generally good hotel however a bit tatty round the edges”
Reviews.Author: JimmyKLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, and a fantastic building. Its not the best hotel I've ever stayed in, and could certainly do with some modernisation, however generally o.k. The location is fantastic and great views of the square from the dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katemaria
Reviews.Content: We my husband and my sis and her partner stayed at this hotel for three nights. On arrival we were greeted and seen to very quick. we asked reception to give us a nice room. which they did, i must say the lighting is very bad in the rooms and a bit small but other than that the room was lovely. the breakfast however was cold each morning. they could do with a better heating system . for keeping the food warm. but above this the hotel we found no preblems with. in fact they werer very helpful to what ever we needed. hotel krasnapolsky is very close to every thing you would want to see in amsterdam. rite in the dam square. can be a bit expensive. so if you intend going to amsterdam. book this hotel well in advance as the prices just seem to go sky high at the last minuite. over all we had no problems with the hotel. apart form the snow of course. which was no fault to theres. lol. i wil stay at this hotel again. as its rite in the centre of everything.by the way stay away from the irish pub rite next door to hotel. outragous expensive. almost 20euro for two pints of beer.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, nowhere near 5 star standards!”
Reviews.Author: TinkyJo
Reviews.Content: My partner took me to this hotel for my birthday, and I'm glad we only stayed 2 nights! Firstly, when we arrived we were given directions to our room - I don't think we could have been put any further away from the hotel lobby if they'd tried. We stayed in an extention to the original building, and had to walk through the conference area to get to the lift. When we got to our room, it hadn't even been cleaned after the previous occupants had left!!! The bed hadn't been made, the bins were full, there were towels on the bathroom floor.... So I phoned reception and the woman said she'd ring me back. 15 minutes later she called and said we could change rooms, and then she kept me on hold for 5 minutes while she located a room. She then asked if we could come to reception to get our key cards, and I explained that I didn't feel I should be made to walk all the way there and back again just to move 2 doors down the corridor. She eventually turned up with the keys to our new room. The rooms were very basic, and I've stayed in nicer "no frills" hotels in the UK - I certainly wouldn't call this a 5 star hotel! The room was tiny, and the lighting was terrible. The morning we were due to check out, Housekeeping knocked on the door at 8.30am, despite us having not checked out - what were they going to do? Tidy the room while we were at breakfast, then have to do it again later?? On a good note, I checked the bed for bedbugs immediately upon arriving after reading other comments on here, and I can gladly say our room was free of such creatures.

Reviews.Title: “A reliable hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew030
Reviews.Content: I had walked past this hotel many times as a child. I remember my parents telling me that it was a grand, old hotel, which was very expensive. It didn't quite live up to its name. The service was very good - I lost an item in my room, and it was sent on to me quite effortlessly. The lobby was large and inviting; the receptionist pleasant and helpful. It is a very large hotel, which has obviously spread over the years into surrounding buildings, and was not as unaffordable as I had expected. However, the room - the overall appearance of the hotel in fact - was rather dated - the doors to the bathroom being little more than two cupboard doors. I have a pretty low opinion of most hotels in Amsterdam - this was better than most, the location couldn't be better; but by no stretch of the imagination could it be described as a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajwwang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Krasnapolsky in April of 2009. Early on the second (and last) morning of our stay, I awoke to see a 3/4 inch dark bug on my pillow right beside my face. At that time, I had never encountered a bed bug, and I thought that they were all very small in size, so I wasn't immediately concerned. However, when I turned on the lights, and did a close-up examination of the bed, I noticed several very small light-colored insects roaming the bed, and thick blood splotches on the sheets, further down. I also developed a large bite-mark on my face, similar to a mosquito bite, near my nose. I knew immediately that we were infested with bed bugs. I complained to the manager upon check-out, and several weeks later received an email confirming the presence of bugs and offering us a discount on our next stay, I am returning to Amsterdam in April; however, I will not be staying at that hotel! Upon our return to the US, we left the majority of our travel items and clothing in a black plastic garbage bag out in the sun for several days ( a recommended move to kill the bed bugs). We live in Houston and the temperature outside when we returned home was warn enough to heat the inside of the bags to 120 degrees F, so fortunately we escaped an infestation in our house.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Broekie90
Reviews.Content: Last monday we stayed in this luxurious hotel in de middle of the center. The reception desk was very helpful and fast. We had a beautiful room with nice view. The bathroom was a little old though with strange doors for the seperate shower and toilet. We slept very well in de good beds. In the lobby you can drink nice espresso. Most of all we loved the extensive breakfast buffet in the impressive 'Wintergarden'. We can not think of anything you could miss at this buffet! We can recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, clean rooms and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: AAAinps
Reviews.Content: I have stayed her twice and will be back in April 2010, The location is excellent, the rooms are clean and the staff was helpful. We did not eat at the hotel, just a personal thing generally don't eat at hotel restuarants. Rooms were a good size for Europe and I will admit by American standards it would not be 5 star. That's fine with me because I am not a 5 star traveller. I go for location, cleanliness and price. I want the best place in the best location at a working persons rate. I have stayed here before and will stay here again. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised - clean, comfortable rooms, friendly staff, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: lissyanna21
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews on TripAdvisor, I was hesitant to keep my reservation here; however, I am thrilled that I did. While the hotel hallways need to be updated, and the wood floors in the rooms are warping slightly, the lobbies, restaurants and front desk/concierge help was acceptable. Definitely not 5-star by American standards, but the rooms were comfortable and very comfortable, and the shower in my room was amazing compared to other European hotels I've stayed in. The toiletries in the room are great - toothpaste/toothbrush, full-size sponges and shaving kits in addition to the basics. The laundry service is overpriced but very quick (paid 38 Euro for two trousers and one pair of jeans, but they picked it up at 8 am and had it back to me by the time I returned to the hotel before dinner). Internet is pricey (special lower rate of 8 Euro for iPhone/smartphone access is a better alternative), so just assume this is part of the rate when reserving. Front desk was very accomodating, and THE LOCATION IS EXCELLENT! Literally right on the Dam (the main square in Amsterdam), just down the street from the main train station, and there is a tram station just across the square. We were able to find excellent restaurants and bars within a block in every direction. The breakfast in the garden room at the hotel is worth it just for the aesthetics for one day, but due to the price, I'd skip it after the first visit - there are several wonderful bakeries, cafe's and restaurants within a short walk. Parking is expensive (50 Euro per day), so taking the train into city center is recommended. I WILL DEFINITELY RETURN!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: reedyLancs
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night only....glad I did Cold reception...both people and temperature!! Cold room but after complaining got upgraded [did not ask for this it was given Terrible pizza for room service and very expensive Special price for breakfast 22 eu...dreadful value and even worse food Never again if I can help it

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: Evicat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrendous. The fact that it somehow has five stars is laughable. Half the hotel is in a separate building that you access via the red light district after swiping your card no less than three times. The staff has two modes: rude and indifferent. Oh, and did I mention the bed bugs? Yes, my "five star" experience culminated with the discovery that the hotel is infested with bed bugs -- a week later, and I still have the bites. Do yourself a favor and avoid this hotel like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jameshome7
Reviews.Content: Didn't expect that much after reading some of the reviews. However, can only assume the experiences must relate to the price paid. Having paid Â£75 per night inclusive of breakfast I was more than satisfied. Check-in was smooth and easy. Got a very large over-sized, lavishly dressed bed, a huge TV that had BBC1/2/3 and a host of channels and a nice selection of soaps etc. The room overlooked an inner courtyard so noise was not a problem. Breakfast had the 'Wow' factor and was superb. Fantastic setting and even champagne on offer. The staff were all fantastic and could not do enough. Granted, if I were paying 29 Euros extra for breakfast, I may have not enjoyed the experience as much! Great location as you step out into Dam Square and all the major sights are within easy reach. As I had to print my boarding card for the return flight home, was really amazed to find that the business centre allowed me free Internet Access for 15 minutes! All in all, would highly recommend this Hotel for location, style and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS - avoid this hotel at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravel29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights in a room on the third floor of the "Amsterdam Wing", or a separate building with a separate entrance that opens out right into the red light district. My traveling companions were severely bitten by BED BUGS, and since arriving home we have had to incur tremendous expense cleaning or throwing away every item we brought with us on the trip. We have complained to the hotel and heard nothing back in response. That we have not heard back is not surprising because when we were there the level of service was so horrendous as to be shocking. When a "concierge" was even at the concierge desk (not often) they were completely unhelpful and rude. Multiple "concierges" were unable to recommend a single restaurant other than the eateries in the hotel, and one reported back that he "doesn't go to restaurants" so he had no available information on any in the area. I've seen other reviewers complain about the noise level - this was not an issue for us. The location was terrific, but (BED BUGS aside) the hotel is not worth the high prices they charge, and on top of the high charges they tried to nickel and dime us on every occasion, including trying to charge us twice an extra person charge we prepaid and the astronomically high 6 euro per hour charge for wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shannonmoore813
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and large rooms! Great customer service....very impressed with the Kras!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, faultless hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aingeal53
Reviews.Content: We stayed in NH Grand Krasnapolsky from Jan05 2010 for 3 nights and enjoyed every minute of the hotel and Amsterdam. We checked in at 11.00 am approx and were looked after immediately and were given a very nice big room on the second floor. The room was very comfortable with generous touleteries and nice big screen TV. Breakfasts were a feast and it was great to spend time over breakfast and enjoy the beautiful setting with a glass of champagne. The location was wonderful and you could walk to most sights, Madam Taussauds on the square, flower market a couple of blocks away, Casino and Heineken Experience within easy reach. Ther is a most amazing pub around the corner of the hotel - which you wont find in any of the guides - called Wynand Focking, it was formally a blending house and is used mainly by locals going home from work, it only opens from 3 until 9 every day, there are great traditions there and it is an amazing old building and very well worth a visit, when you come out of the hotel turn left and you will find it down that laneway. We needed to use the internet and were given complementary vouchers to do so. Our checkout was just as effecient as our check in and we couldn't find any fault with the hotel, all staff were very friendly and helpful and we look forward to returning to this great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Reception Staff!”
Reviews.Author: pinkprincess53
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel 14th December, had to wait in a que for 20 minutes to check in. I had booked a standard double room for me and my partner, the receptionist asked me for the credit card i used to pay for the hotel, she then said she would have to take a 150 euro deposit off my card in case i decided to have any extras (television, minibar etc). I told her she would not be taking the money off my card however she insisted it was a requirement at the hotel. I never had any details to say that would be required upon cheque in and i ended up giving a cash deposit which was a bad start to the break the recptionist was rude and i noticed a couple infront of us had an argument with her too. We stayed for three nights bed and breakfast, the winter garden is a nice room but the food wasnt great! The rooms could do with being updated, Cabin doors for the toilet and the hair dryer was useless it took me about an hour to dry my hair! Room was clean but housekeeping was waking me up really early every morning. The location was perfect right in the centre. All in all i enjoyed the break but would not go to this hotel again there are better 3/4* hotels than this and i would not reccomend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: Judith12345
Reviews.Content: We were quite apprehensive about booking this hotel after reading all the negative reviews on this site. Thank goodness we did as we were both pleasantly surprised and could not fault the hotel on any level. We arrived at 8am on Christmas Eve and had no issues checking in immediately. We found all of the staff extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The ability to walk straight out onto the Dam Square, directly across from the Royal Palace and within 15 mins walk of pretty much anything worthwhile is as good as it gets. Our standard room was a very generous size with excellent quality bed linen befitting a 5 star hotel. But oh, the joys of the breakfast buffet - the highlight of every day! I think we both came back a few kilos heavier as a result. We were so spoilt for choice every morning that breakfast became a 3-course event. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone. There is no doubt that the hotel is not entirely 5 star standard but you could do a whole lot worse and pay a whole lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: Coreesan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week as part of my honeymoon. I had originally reserved a room at another place (much more expensive), but put an absurdly low rate into priceline and it booked me here. After reading some of the reviews here I was pretty bummed, but looking back now I am so glad we stayed in this hotel. We arrived around 10am and had no problem checking in. Took an upgrade (I think it was called the Royal Wing) and was given a huge room with a balcony overlooking the street. It was perfect! Yeah, the rooms are a tad bit worn (a few scuffs here and there), but the place was very clean, the bed/bedding were fitting a 5 star, the staff was friendly, and the location was incredible. You can walk right out off the hotel and into either Dam Square on one side, or the Red Light District on the other. While it might not quite live up to a 5 star rating, Im pretty picky about hotel rooms and I was very happy with this place. I highly recommend it and I will definitely try to stay here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but check in is awful!”
Reviews.Author: spikysonic
Reviews.Content: The Krasnapolsky's location is superb - in my opinion, you will not find a better one in Amsterdam. The rooms, although small are perfectly adequate and comfortable. The only disappointment is the check in / out. Checking in, we thought would be quick as we didn't have to queue, but somehow we was waiting 25 mins with the receptionist to be checked in - she kept disappearing without reason. Checking out was pretty much the same, took just as long. All in all a good hotel, but you will need a lot of patience when checking in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Experience in Krasnopolsky”
Reviews.Author: MichaelKr
Reviews.Content: Hi, I visited Amsterdam and stayed in the hotel last year, it stands in the best location in Amsterdam - near the Dam square in the center of the city. It's pretty fency but I managed to find a good deal (booked in easyclicktravel.com), so it's worth the price. Definately recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lovely Room, Check-In from Hell!”
Reviews.Author: Pudworth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel a number of times. We love the location, and the rooms are great; however the Reception (and Back Office admin) of this hotel really needs an overhall. We booked well in advance, and secured an upgraded room, however on arrival, were told by an extremely frosty Receptionist that we only had a basic room,and would need to pay E45 per night extra. It took a 20 minute trip to the Hotel Business Centre to print off the evidence from my email, and further haggling at the desk to get the room. Whilst its my own fault for not having printed off the booking confirmation, it is only at this Hotel where we ever seem to have any problems. On a more positive note, the Conciege Staff at the Hotel are the best anywhere- Helpful, Courteous and nothing is too much trouble. So, overall, stay here for the location and rooms, but arrive in time to have an argument at Reception!!

Reviews.Title: “Location cannot be beat”
Reviews.Author: monaprincess
Reviews.Content: Friendly, attentive staff and a great location. Not what you would consider a five-star in the U.S. Internet service was not included. Location is perfect! I walked from the train station. Lots of shopping and tourist activities. Close to buses and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tbeeri
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. The location is the best, the service was friendly and the room was very big. the breakfast was very good and was served in a beautiful indoor garden. we had a great time We found a deal for less than 100 eur per night. We would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame on the Dam”
Reviews.Author: Palm-Tree-P
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Location - couldn't have been more centrally located. Very helpful friendly staff, nice quiet large room and a huge choice of superb food for breakfast. Minuses: Rather faded from the hotel's glory days. Needs a refurb. with some luxurious textiles and 5* carpeting. Poor quality toiletries - I didn't want to smell like an orange!!!, water pressure and mixer in the shower needs attending to as you could feel alternate hot/cold streams of water. Internet should be available in-room at no additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be taught a lesson”
Reviews.Author: cgldsmth
Reviews.Content: Another example of a fine old hotel ruined by a chain. Just because the location is excellent they think they can charge exorbitant prices. The rooms are way overpriced for what they are: tiny, poor A/C, terrible in-room services, nasty bathroom products. Very cramped. Noisy. Breakfast is a total rip-off (even if there is champagne). Cold recycled food for 27-euros! Check-in/out involved a 20 minute wait for us. Movie channel charges you twice for a broken-up picture which cuts out and then you have to start from the beginning again. No free wifi or internet which is scandalous considering the cost of the room. Gym was rubbish

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nalced
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 3035 - small room, relatively clean but it needs a refresh. So does the hotel as a whole. The room was pricey for the time of year and for the quality of the room at a rate that was supposed to have been a special rate (â‚¬190 excl city tax. Wireless broadband very expensive at â‚¬18 for 24 hours. Breakfast is extortionate at â‚¬28.50 for buffet. So all in all a stay in the hotel turned out to be â‚¬250 (excl min bar items). My advice for business travellers is to look for other hotels close by which are newer, include wireless broadband for free, and preferably which have breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Average and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: no1toe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for one night for a business meeting. Although it is in a very good location I was not impressed. I had to walk outside and into another building in order to access my room. The room was outdated but comfortable, clean but very old. I did not use internet as the price was too high, even with me on an expense account. Check in was average but I saw multiple lines and not enough help throughout my stay and people looked extremely frustrated. I had breakfast the following morning prior to my departure and found it to be average and extremely overpriced (28.50 euros for the buffet). All-in-all an okay stay but I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam stay”
Reviews.Author: Iamdorothy430
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline and got a great rate for a beautiful and HUGE room, The staff was friendly and helpful and recommended waiting a few hours to move into the larger, remodeled room. We were so glad we took her advice! The breakfast in the Winter Garden was elegant though pricey at 28 euro. We loved the experience. Location is central, easy to walk to many lovely areas and museums. All in all an excellent experience. Hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: chuckiebru
