Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. Room was large and clean. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Could not have enjoyed the Hotel more. Room was on the second floor facing the square so there was a little late night noise but come on, its Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves. Paying 20â‚¬ for 1 day internet access is extorsion.”
Reviews.Author: tempmay
Reviews.Content: Hotel is standard, but I can't accept paying 20â‚¬ a day for internet access. This is pure extorsion!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jfredmugs
Reviews.Content: Originally I booked two nights for me and my kids at a different NH hotel. The hotel emailed me the week before the trip to say they'd upgraded us to this hotel and after reading the mixed reviews on this site I was a bit nervy but eventually decided to go with it - I'm so pleased I did. The hotel is big and I believe reviewers had the experiences they described but I had absolutely no inkling of it during my stay. The room was immaculate, in a wing of the hotel (that felt like an adjoining apartment block) overlooking a busy side street (Damstraat?) although there was no noise to disturb me or my 5 and 8 year olds. The buffet breakfast catered for all tastes and was outstanding. The location was perfect - right on Dam and very easy to find (10 min straight walk from Centraal Station), next to all tourist stuff, 10 min walk to Anne Frank House and a good location to get trams. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Words cant describe the class of this place”
Reviews.Author: MartK
Reviews.Content: I stopped travelling in business when my son was born in 92, how as he is a teenager I have started again. I used to stay here for business and pleasure when I travelled before and it was excellent, faulltless in every way from the rooms to the food to the bars, the breakfast in the winter garden is an experience everyone should try as the setting is stunning, the staff as near perfect as you can get and the variety of the food is truly staggering. When I started travelling again I booked this place and wondered how it had fared over the years and I was pleasantly surprised to find that if anything the current team have made it even better !

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel at Priceline rates”
Reviews.Author: southbound123
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms for a week at the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky. If you book on Priceline, it is a very reasonably priced place to sleep in a central location. The multiple building are a small pain if the rooms are in different buildings. The beds were decent. The hotel has good bathrooms and nice bathrobes. You are walking distance to the train station, lots of good restaurants and the red light district. Right around the hotel is too touristy and overpriced. Amsterdam is a great walking city so bring comfortable shoes.

Reviews.Title: “A dump...avoid if you can...”
Reviews.Author: marybRiverside
Reviews.Content: While centrally located, this is a hotel that doesn't have it's act together. It's a strange conglomeration of various buildings, and we were stuck in a tiny room about a block away from hotel lobby. Ridiculous uneven service (we had to sign a release to get an adapter), unhelpful staff. Bright spot was concierge, who booked us into several great restaurants. Hotel wasn't surprised when we left early to go to another hotel...they even said, "Was it the service and the room?" Yes it was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: CT-Traveler55
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline and after reading some reviews were concerned that we would be parceled off into a terrible room. Quite the opposite happened. Upon check-in the clerk suggested that we wait for a room in the renovated part of the hotel, which we did. It was lovely, and one of the biggest rooms I have ever had while in Europe. So I think the secret is to make sure you are located in one of the renovated areas. Everything was top notch and the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. We also enjoyed the breakfast in the Winter Garden and while pricey, it was well worth the cost for both the food and atmosphere on a chilly October morning. We hope to return again soon with family and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY EXPERIENCE, WE HOPE TO RETURN”
Reviews.Author: suzequeChicago
Reviews.Content: I checked with Trip Advisor before leaving and was a little concerned with what some reviewers said. My husband saw the Hotel years ago and has always hoped to stay there. There is no need for concern. It is a beautiful, sparkling clean hotel. The hotel has recently been renovated, and is just gorgeous. The staff is well trained in customer relations and service, something so badly lacking in the U.S. We called for help with the TV, and almost immediately, the technician was at our door. This is a classy, upscale hotel right in the heart of the city. We were able to walk to everything. Note of caution: most of the city is cobblestone and difficult to walk on, wear good,low shoes. I don't know if the facade of the hotel has also been redone, but I do know that my husband didn't recognize it from the street, no matter which corner we stood on. So, maybe there was a period when the hotel was in need of renovation, but that's all completed now and I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Tbrune
Reviews.Content: the hotel is rated a five star hotel....but it is not even a 1 star hotel. the entire floor we were on smelled like urine, the carpets were so dirty that your feet stuck to them, the maid never came to clean and pretty much everything that they "offer" on their site is not available. it is not worth the money...even if you get a great deal on it. i would recommend any hotel over this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money, excellent rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: dutchguy
Reviews.Content: Incredible how bad others rate this wonderful hotel. Nothing wrong about it. I had booked it through Priceline.co.uk and had done a bid of 50 Â£ and got a counter offer of 80Â£ plus 14 Â£ costs. I accepted it, but possibly could have gotten it cheaper. But obviously this is still way below the normal price. I asked and got a very quiet rooom, 1002, no sounds at all from inside or outside. Nice room, good bathroom, big bed, big flat screen TV with 50 channels and 13 Euro for movies. Computerized minibar, did not use (pity you can't put any own things in it). 28.50 euro for breakfast, did not use. This is the first hotel where I saw it is written in the room info that drugs are strictly prohibited (no problem, I hate it and don't smoke cigs either). Great is also that on Sundays youi can stay till 5 PM (only sometimes till 3 PM when there is a conference). This goes for the whole NH chain. Fabulous hotel, don't look further. Close to station (I walked), at Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fabinhobp
Reviews.Content: More than 24 hours without power (AC, TV,Elevator, etc.) and no compensation whatsoever received. Even before power failure the hotel was horrible: old, smelly, poor customer service, definitely one of the worst I have ever seen in my entire life. The only positive is the location, which is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view , great price !”
Reviews.Author: A140
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with six friends for two nights. I have stayed here before and wasn't overly impressed with anything for the price, but since joining their NH Hotels club ( do it on their wesite) I have been very impressed. They now offer rooms with balconies which is a must in Amsterdam, you cant smoke inside so the balcony is a great alternative also you tend to get the nicer rooms too. I booked online with the organiser rate which worked out at about â‚¬55 pppn for the hotel. And as anyone who travels to Amsterdam often knows this is very cheap, you could normally pay that for a 3* crap hotel. Everything was perfect with the hotel, we lost room keys , they helped out and sorted it asap, my sister couldn't get to the room I was staying in as I wanted the top floor with balcony, staff escorted her ... gave us vouchers for â‚¬30 off pppn for our next stay. Rooms spotless, movie choice very good, minbar fine, tea and coffee making facilities great. Bathrooms, water very hot, but excellant products. I didn't eat at their restaurant as theyre are too many good places with better atmosphere in Amsterdam.. As a bit of a Amsterdam vetran at this stage ( my husband is Dutch) I would highly recommend this hotel if you get it for the right price. Another great NH hotel is the Doelen Amsterdam, balconies and adjoining rooms etc for families. â‚¬100 per room per night, very cheap considering what they charge on some websites for 2* hotels. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION = Krasnapolsky

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, typical chain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: betsywanderlust
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the location of the hotel. The room was fine and the bed was very comfortable. It is a bit of a soulless chain hotel and the room was a bit dated, but was fine. It had all the facilities you'd expect from a big chain hotel. The room view was to another wing of the hotel, but think some rooms may have nice views. There were events in the main square and we could not hear it from our room which was nice. When checking out we had to check the bill I noticed we had been charged for 2 glasses of wine, when we'd only had one (I don't like wine and didn't have any) we politely contested this so they got the receipt out and showed we had infact signed for 2 glasses. My partner must have signed without checking. So if you get a drink from the bar make sure you check what you are signing for. In the end they took the charge off, think they must have thought we were lying but we were telling the truth. After that the manager was milling around, keeping an eye on us as we were checking out but I know we only had one glass of wine. I didn't go anywhere near the automatic minibar luckily. There are alot of fast food joints and restaurants, cafes etc nearby. We were on a budget, so we went to a pizza slice shop behind the hotel a few times. There is a fast food place with a yellow sign (cant remember name - fabo??) where you put the money in and get a burger out which was a bit novel but nothing special. Elsewhere, Chips and mayonaise is popular and i had some. Breakfast was not included in the hotel rate, so I can't comment on that. All in all I was happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel, fabulous breakfast and high tea”
Reviews.Author: HondaEX90
Reviews.Content: I vacationed to Europe to visit my in-laws along with my husband, who is Dutch in August 2009. We stayed mainly in the Rotterdam area but took a weekend trip to tour the city of Amsterdam and got to stay in the Krasnapolsky. This hotel is on Dam Square, which, if you've never been to Amsterdam, is the middle of the action. You want to be on it or near it. Everything is walking distance in Amsterdam, but this hotel is right in the thick of it. We took the train in and walked from the Central Station with our small luggage/backpacks. Some poor souls were wandering through the streets with their huge suitcases, not recommended, the streets are twisty, cobblestoned in places, rough, holey, and sometimes altogether dangerous for people on foot, let alone people lugging their life's possessions along with them, take a cab if you've got a bunch of stuff. I don't even know if there is parking, I wouldn't suggest driving in Amsterdam unless you're pretty seasoned to bikes, pedestrians, trams, trains, cars, whatever, going every direction at the same time, mainly headed at you it seems. The hotel lobby is lovely, photos of the crowned prince and his wife Maxima don the walls. Check in took at least 20 minutes and we didn't have any line, it just took that long. My mother in law was doing the talking and she is a native Dutch speaker so the language barrier was not the issue. It just took forever, but we finally got our keys. The rooms were very nice. Rooms 210 and 211, face a brick wall, but whatever, we didn't care. The hotel has a lot of nice wood furnishings, a large bed (even for USA standards, this bed was huge) and a nice bathroom, the bedding is divine, plush down pillow top comforter, nice pillows, bath robe in the room, and this was just a basic room, not fancy. The toilet paper is what I'd refer to as personal napkins....they are not on a roll, and sort of are like bifold paper towels, only tiny, so you might be surprised with the tiny toilet napkins, but that is a European thing I guess...whatever. They do give you very nice citrusy scented bath products. There is a safe in the room. We got passes for buy one get one free drinks in the bar - which is nice. Order a cheap drink first, then get your second drink free. margaritas are like $12.00 US at the bar, so order a heineken first $4.00 US and then get your free margarita! We toured the city and the hotel was always at our crossroads, so periodically we'd go to the hotel for the bathroom and to drop off souvenirs (since you normally have to pay for toilets in Europe, or there are none for the public, outside free standing male public no door urinals, which were funny.). We went to high tea the day of our arrival downstairs in the hotel restaurant, and sat by the windows facing Dam square watching the swarms of people move about. It was blissful. The high tea comes with looseleaf tea in two varieties, a myriad of petit fors, finger sandwiches, chocolates, and crumpets, and champagne, Well worth your money. Also worth the money, the breakfast buffet in the Winter garden restaurant. Oh my gosh. After a week in Europe this American was excited about all you can eat (laugh but it's true, we like our free refills and all you can eat buffets, and no I'm not a big person, I just like a variety). This buffet had everyting, bacon, eggs, toast, waffles, cheeses, fruit, breads, milk, many juices, and champagne. I made a mimosa (champagne + Orange Juice) and a German guy stared me down like I was a moron for putting juice in my champagne, then I saw him do the same, and then suddenly the whole room had them and we were out of champagne. So, things to remember, get the breakfast, it's worth it, use the coupons in the bar but get a cheap drink first to make the second one really count, the high tea is also awesome. The staff's nametags have little flags to show what languages they speak, and in our experience, some people working there weren't native Dutch, most people working in Amsterdam as a whole seemed to be from somewhere else, my in laws ordered dinner in Dutch somewhere and the waiter didn't get it until I said it in English to the guy, I ordered in plain english and he had no trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag of tears & smiles”
Reviews.Author: CAH000
Reviews.Content: We booked from Friday to Monday into this hotel and was from the work go very disappointed. We arrived to be told the hotel is over booked. What is the use in booking two months in advance if they are going to give your room to someone else? We then had to settle for a twin room after many words and arguments for the first night and were told weâ€™ll be moved the next day to a king room as booked and paid for. They couldnâ€™t refund us the difference for the Friday night â€œbecause weâ€™ve already paidâ€�. How does this work? We were checked in and sent up to a single room first, had to go back to reception again and was then moved and checked into a twin room. It took us close to 60min to check in and actually get into the twin room eventually. I have to say the hotel offered us two breakfast coupons for the next day for the trouble. They took â€˜n credit card swipe the Friday evening for extras that might be used but we found ourselves locked out of our room the Saturday evening because they said they had no credit card authorization from us so they blocked the room. Obviously they did not transfer it to the new room they moved us to on the Saturday. Again I had to walk down to reception, spend 30min to resolve the issue and to explain that they should have transferred the credit card details. We checked out the Monday morning. When I checked my credit card statement on the Tuesday back in the UK I noticed the Hotel deducted almost Â£80 for extras used where we didnâ€™t use anything extra in the hotel. Again I had to contact the hotel to sort this out and after a 30min telephone call I was advised that the money will be refunded as they made a mistake. The good points for this hotel were the location and the rooms which was stylish, clean and comfortable. This might only be because we ended up in the new part of the hotel. Overall we were left with a feeling of disappointment as I had to spend a lot of time sorting out something I booked way in advance not to have issues on the day. Little did I know the issues would be spread across the weekend of our stay there! We left Amsterdam loving the city but would make sure not to stay at this hotel again. There are just as many other good hotels in the city center that could make life easier on your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “location, location and locaton. the only thing.”
Reviews.Author: foammm
Reviews.Content: very convinient central locaton. not very coizy standard rooms. average size: neither big nor small. clean and simple bathroom. Hotel is a little bit shabby in general. it's quite big hotel so sometimes to get the room it takes 5 minutes walk from reseption desk. We had not pleasant view to the courtyard from the 2nd floor. unpretentious place for city discovering.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but dont expect 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: HalKen
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on a 2-1 lastminute.com deal. If we had paid full price for this hotel i would not have been happy. As it was, my boyfriend and I where very lucky, we waited a very long time at reception to check in behind some very annoyed guests, we took pity on the young man on reception who 'upgraded' us from the usualy lastminute.com rooms. So beware those who book through lastminute do not get to see the hotels best!! As it turned out our room in the royal wing was lovely. This made our holiday, had we been in one of the poorer rooms the long queues, often rude hotel staff, usless concierge and the fact we where locked out of our room every day of our stay might have got annyoing. On saying that this hotel has one of the best locations anyone could ask for when visiting Amsterdam,, just dont pay full price and make sure your nice to the recpetion staff you never knwo what you might get!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the 5 star price tag!...”
Reviews.Author: Muro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a perfect location and we were really looking forward to our "5 star deluxe" hotel as quoted on last minute.com. It looked really grand as we checked in, just what we were expecting however, we were packed off to the other side of the hotel into what I can only describe as nice Travel lodge rooms, yes they were very clean but that's about all - no 5 star quality about it at all. The only benefit was that we booked our room on a 'buy 1 night get another free' which cost Â£154. If I had paid Â£154 for 2 nights stay here I would have put a complaint in about the mis-leading advertising of a 5 star deluxe accommodation. Only stay here if you can get a bargin, as perfect location, friendly staff. Breakfast is a rip off at 22 euros each!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, relatively big room in EU”
Reviews.Author: SPEEDY_Q
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, found the hotel is best location in town: 1. Five minutes walking from central station 2. "Red light" about 2 minutes walking 3. China town about 3 minutes right by "Red light" 4. Shopping: Big Dept. store right next to the hotel at Dam square, the opposite end of the Dam square is the famous shopping street, 100++ store. 5. Behind the Royal Palace is the huge supper market Traveled many Euro big cities, the room is relatively large, services are ok, we have a 18 month boy, require a crib, called in to reserve a crib, but been told that â€œthe room is not assigned, hence cannot reserve the crib, but should not have any problemsâ€�. We are little worried. But After checking in, the crib had been brought it to the room right away. Never had any issue at all, very happy. Overall, I agreed we all the reviewersâ€™ comments, but we felt we are very happy with this hotel: I totally agrred that the hotel is not â€œ5 starsâ€�, but â€œ5 starsâ€� to me is depending on what I am paying, if I am paying for â€œ3 starsâ€� rate in Amsterdam, then I rate this hotel â€œ5 starsâ€� based on what I am paying and getting.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: belladorata
Reviews.Content: We stay here everytime we go to Amsterdam and we never get disappointed. My favourite part is the grand buffet for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: russy177
Reviews.Content: Hotel in apoor condition. Rooms extremely used. Which is why the prices are low recently. No doubt.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: sazmonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the NH grand a couple of years ago and we had a great time. the rooms were big and clean and we had are own balcony. The staff where all very friendly and helpful. Location was great as we where right in the centre and only 5 minutes from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “3 star with 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: Sibhls
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the Krasnapolsky for us and our 2 friends. We booked it with priceline so we got the rooms for a very reasonable price. I had seen the actual prices on their own website, and on staying there, I'm incredibly disappointed. It was mediocre at best. The room was small, the bathroom was tiny, even the interior, which granted isn't that big a deal, was old and outdated. The chairs were ripped and the doors were cupboard doors... The noise was unbelievable, but thankfully we were out 'til quite late ourselves so when we got back we fell asleep easily!! The price for breakfast, dinner etc. is quite expensive, although the bar is about the same as everywhere else. Bring a lot of money if you want to drink alcohol at all. A vodka and orange juice cost me 12 euro!!!!! The Location was fantastic, so if you can get it for 80 or so a night, it will do. Worth little more than that though. It's just not a 5 star, unless of course you're paying the big bucks, in which case I'm sure the rooms would be just lovely. If you want to go shopping, take a whole day for it. LOTS of shops and very very busy, so it takes longer than you would think :) and the cyclists WILL hit you if you get in their way!!! you can get tram tickets in some of the little newsagents, and they work out a lot cheaper than buying them on the trams themselves. Also, there is a free tour that begins in Dam square at 11ish, and it's well worth doing.

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: DublinMoose
Reviews.Content: location is brilliant, right in the centre of amsterdam queues to check in were ridiculous, plenty of staff on but most of them didnt seem to be doing much. No air conditioning in the room, it was impossible to sleep with the heat. Would expect more from a 5 star hotel. Breakfast costs an extortionate 28.50 euros per person, cant justify that! Also most of the lights in our room didnt work. Beds are really uncomfortable

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maltking
Reviews.Content: I was sceptical about staying at this hotel considering some of the negative feedbacks. However, I can say that we had a lovely time here. All the standard rooms were fully booked so we were upgraded for free in the 'Amsterdam Wing' of the hotel, which appears to be the most newest part of the hotel. The room was lovely and spacious and well equipped. The bed was very comfortable, so nice that we slept in every morning! We had to wait about ten minutes when we arrived, but then there are cues wherever you go, so not sure why people keep going on about having to wait. The hotel had four members of staff on at the time and we never arrived until after10pm. So I think that this is pretty good. Location is also superb, I would for sure return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There is nothing grand about the Grand Krasnapolsky - don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Belsizedave
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst hotel experince I have had in 40 years of travelling. To talk about everything that went wrong would take way too long; but these are the highlights: - room not ready for check in until 5.45pm - asked the desk manager for a quiet room; he assured me it was. When I was shown to the room, I was unhappy with it and went back to the front desk to be told that they couldn't move me. - the disco over the road played music so loud until 4.00am that rest, let alone sleep, was impossible. The desk manager had to know about the disco but, of course failed to mention it to me. - the check in lines were endless; there is no indication as to how customers are to queue so that you can be in line for 15 minutes and another customer will go straight up to the counter and will be helped. - I had prepaid in full and yet was presented with a bill for the room I could go on but you get the picture. Never again! The worst run hotel with the worst staff.

Reviews.Title: “mini bar - Im still angry about this”
Reviews.Author: 070310d
Reviews.Content: my sister and I asked them if we could use the minibar fridge to store our own drinks/food so they came and cleaned out the fridge. Long story short, I found out they charged us for everything that was in the minibar and refused to refund the money. Crooks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: heatherburns40
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 night bed and breakfast in this hotel. Cannot fault it at all. Friendly staff when checking in and out. Bedroom large with huge comfortable bed. Tea/coffee making facilities, mini bar, trouser press and flat screen tv. What more could you ask for and the breakfast in the winter garden was fabulous all the food you could think of and more. Fresh salmon, mackeral, eggs benedict, cereal, fruit juice, yoghurts, cheese, bacon, hash brown, ham and several different types of bread. Hotel right in the middle of dam square and within walking distance to everywhere, 10 minutes takes you to the station and red light district. Plenty of shops and restaurants all around. What I would say is if you book this hotel get breakfast included as it will cost you 25 euro per person if you dont. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: nickynocka
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. We have stayed before a couple of years ago and nothing much has changed since then. I would say that this is definitely a 5* hotel as the standards are not as high as they should be. But, we loved staying here, the main reason is because of the central location to everything. The cleanliness of the rooms was good, although after the fourth night the room could have done with a clean. Also, the TV had BBC1 and BBC2 which is good when you want to fall asleep listening to a familiar TV programme. The beds are fantastic and we really struggled to leave them in the mornings!! The breakfast is very good, luckily we got it included within the room rate, I would not think it was worth 22,50 euros per person per day. Every member of staff were friendly and always had a smile and a 'Good Morning'. The hotel may need updating or tarting up a little, but our experience was a good one and if I returned to Amsterdam I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Long lines in check-in, and poor maintanance”
Reviews.Author: gioram
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in June 2009, for a conference. The only advantages of this hotel is its location, right in the middle of all the action in the center of Amsterdam. Registration desk is understaffed, which means long lines and long waiting time for guests. We received a room with defected air-conditioning, so they moved us to another (smaller) room. The light switches in the room seems to have life of their own, and you must have a degree in electrical engineering to handle them. Room is arranged by the maid only after 3 PM, which means you can't rest there after lunch!!! In check-out, they try to charge us with a much higher rate than the one confirmed by them, and only after I presented their written confirmation they agreed to charge as agreed. Breakfast is tremendous, only of course if it is included in the rate - otherwise its price is outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: supermufc
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in feb and well i was very impressed. After staying in other 2/3* hotels this was definatly the best i have stayed in. The rooms were nice but could do with a bit of updating especially the bathroom, the location was perfect right in the centre of everything. 1 drawback was the price of drink in the bar costing around Â£15 for 2 drinks ( 1 beer and a cocktail) but this is the same everywhere in amsterdam. The food was excellent with plenty of selection but again quite expensive. would def go back though as good hotel compared to the general standard in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location to everything”
Reviews.Author: elanem
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff and rooms. May be a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for here. Parking is safe but expensive 50 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel can't seem to get the basics right...”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerIreland
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in this hotel, and Iâ€™m afraid to say some of the negative reviews on this hotel are not far off the mark. We didnâ€™t see any of the vermin mentioned in other reviews, or the long check in queues, but the hotel misses on getting the basics right for a so-called five star hotel. For example, they offer a multitude of pillow types, but canâ€™t seem to clean your room properly, or teach their staff how to deal with customers properly. One real treat was halfway through our stay we were unexpectedly checked out, no reason given or no apology, just a shrug of the shoulders. Thankfully nothing was removed from the room, but hardly reassuring of their hotel management or customer service skills. On the pro side, great location for the train station and sights, but can be a bit noisy outside, so if youâ€™re looking for quiet location, this is not the hotel for you. The breakfast is amazing, the strong point of this hotel stay. Served in the impressive Winter Garden, it has one of the largest selections of breakfast items I have ever seen. But do get this included in your room rate if possible, otherwise youâ€™ll need to bring your house deeds as a down payment. Our room was in the Royal Wing, and was large, pleasant and comfortable. Great bed, everything worked, a small kettle and tea/coffee were provided, good selection of toiletries, and an okay range of channels on the TV. They have a free late checkout and late breakfast times on Sunday, very handy if you are out partying on Saturday night and are checking out on the Sunday. But on the negative side, there is no free WiFi/Wired Internet access and the cost for using either is ridiculously high. The room cleaning is appalling â€“ the chambermaid barely made the bed, rarely cleaned, and on two of the six days didnâ€™t clean or restock the bathroom. Our room had one of those really, really annoying pressure sensitive minibars where if you open the door, it bills half the contents to your room, followed by the inevitable 5 minute discussion with the reception to have these removed from the bill as they look at you like youâ€™re a liar. The fitness centre has no pool and is a bit of a joke, to be honest. I have to agree with some of the other reviews that this is not a 5 star hotel, and certainly the decor could so with a little updating, but overall the stay was good and the location is great. Not sure if I would return here on my next visit though, you could probably do better for less cost. We used the train to and from Schiphol Airport, and with Amsterdam Centraal only 10 minutes walk away, it was a quick, cheap and reliable way to get to and from the airport. Train journey was under 15 minutes and trains are very regular. If you have a day or two to spare, Iâ€™d recommend a day trip to Haarlem, only 20 minutes away by train, and is a beautiful place to spend a day.

Reviews.Title: “This could have been sooo very good...”
Reviews.Author: Goldfrapper
Reviews.Content: All my previous trips to Amsterdam had been 3* and if you've done 3* central Amsterdam you'll know the 'steep stairs to a shoebox with half-a-window and catch-yourself-turning-round' story well. This time we went 4/5* (depending on which website you're looking at) central. The reception and front of house area were 'grand' in a tired, corporate kind of way so expectations were good. The room was a good size with a bed the size of a 3* room and a view out over the garden/terrace from a table and chairs in front of the window. The breakfast, in the Winter Garden, was fabulous. You name it and it was available: a glass of fizz to start your day, a selection of chopped up fresh fruit, smoked salmon, eggs benedict, a variety of fresh bread rolls, juices, yoghurt, cold cuts, cheeses, cooked breakfast etc. etc. This part of the stay really was top class and definitely 5*. In fact, all the ingredients were there for a damned (sic!) good stay... But, aside from the tired and imagination-free decor, some things just could not be ignored. The divan base had several very nasty and unseemly-looking stains along it that detered any application of imagination and should ideally have been cleaned off or at least covered up with a valance if time was short. It was the same story with one of the chairs. The bedsheet had a small but significant tear in it and nothing above average shoulder height had been dusted for some time. The window opened only four inches so we had to close it and have the noisy air conditioning on instead (which itself created problems of a malodorous nature) to cool the room down. In this day and age you'd expect free high speed internet but this was not the case, pity. These were problems of careless management which shouldn't have happened and which we did make them aware of so hopefeully they won't happen again. The hotel is fabulously central, about ten minutes walk from Central Station, and great for walking to the many bars and restaurants in the area. We didn't risk sampling the food or wine at the hotel as the prices forbade the risk of experiencing similar standards of hygiene that we found in the room around things we were going to eat and drink . We will probably go back but will not tolerate similar carelessness next time. We should have demanded another room but we were there to relax and couldn't be bothered with the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in the Heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Akramdash
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice Hotel , Centrally Located, KLM airport bus stops at the front of the Hotel, Room was big enough for 2 people, Housekeeping was excellent. I did not eat at hotel but it has one of the finest restaurants of europe. Location is really a big plus for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but not luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: pparisienne
Reviews.Content: I would say this hotel is more like a 3-star than a 5. There's nothing luxurious in this hotel as the lobby is quite dark and and plain and the room we were given to is basic, although clean. There are 2 long pipes in full display on both sides of the wall and that really destroyed the aesthetic quality of the room. Nevertheless, we did appreciate the clean bathroom, the plush towels, as well as the comfortable bed and soft pillows. Location is also very good as it's very central-- near the trams and walking distance to the must-sees of Amsterdam. We booked this hotel through Price Line "name your price" scheme and we paid around 75â‚¬/night which I think is a good deal in terms of the quality-price ratio. I of course wouldn't pay for their rack rate as this hotel doesn't deserve their 5-star rating at all! They even had a power cut starting from the afternoon until around 1 am. Good thing we were out late and had only experience the lack of electricity for around 10 minutes until power came back again. It's definitely not 5-star but for its location and for the price we paid, we can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located...large and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveler_1234070
Reviews.Content: The location in Dam square is perfect for first-time visitors, you're literally smack-dab in the middle of all the tourist attractions in Amsterdam. The hotel staff was friendly (and upgraded our room free-of-charge, as they knew we were on our honeymoon). Our room was really clean and large (bigger than we had expected). And the breakfast that is included as part of your stay? AMAZING. It was (by far) the biggest spread I have ever seen in a hotel. Try the waffles, trust me. The bed was really comfortable and the staff was really helpful. One tip: Instead of paying a costly cab-fare back to the airport, ask the Concierge to reserve the hotel shuttle (Connexxion) for you, it's much cheaper (if you're not in the mood to deal with Central station). But note, it's a shuttle that stops at a few (sister) hotels before heading to the airport, so allow yourself plenty of time before your departing flight.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MijasIreland
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two night stay at this hotel. Apart from slow check-in and out, I couldn't fault it at all. Had a lovely quiet room on the fourth floor at the back, overlooking the winter garden roof, I think. Everything in the room was perfect, temperature control, comfortable bed, windows that open, TV with BBC news channels, kettle & tea/coffee (I had to ask for milk to be brought to my room). The bathroom was nice & large, could do with updating but it was fine. Had a bath & separate shower/toilet. As a solo traveller, I felt v safe, could hear no noise at all from inside or outside and staying here was a pleasant experience. Front desk is usually busy but they were always pleasant and courteous. They cleared the minibar for me to use as a fridge, soon after I asked. Lobby and bar areas are very grand and quite expensive. I didnt eat at the hotel, the winter garden breakfast room looked beautiful. The location was fantastic, you are close to all the main shopping areas and tourist attractions. There are many less expensive hotels in Dam Square but I felt this was worth paying just a bit extra. I would stay here again on a future visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: RichmondFro
Reviews.Content: The Kras is a superb hotel, and on previous trips I have always found it to be top drawer. However this time I was not quite so lucky, and found myself in a tiny, tobacco-smelling room at the back of the hotel - no Dam Square view this time. Given that the hotel gets a lot of custom from our company, this was a surprise. The hotel is located on Dam Square, great location and just a 10 minute walk from Centraal Station. Staff are friendly and efficient, the downstairs areas are grand, and the bar is well-stocked. In short, great hotel but be aware that not all rooms are as good as each other.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shabby experience!”
Reviews.Author: Eileenov
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in this hotel about ten years ago and had a wonderful time, I had been looking forward to a great weekend stay with my husband and another couple. We had recommended the hotel to them and in fact paid much more than we had intended, but hoped it would be worth doing. It was apparent as soon as we arrived that things had changed. The number of people queuing to check-in/check-out was dreadful. Check-in was slow. The room we were eventually allocated was on the fifth floor. It was supposed to be non-smoking, but it was immediately obvious that this room had been smoked in. We must have spent over an hour sorting out a room change. We were very disappointed by the tiny room our friends were allocated on the third floor. The only saving thing about this hotel is it's location, which is perfect. I was very disappointed to see how shabby and well used the hotel fittings appeared. The dining room chairs in The Winter Gaden had seen better days. All in all, I would probably not choose to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: sloughboy
Reviews.Content: great central location, grand hotel, good service and value for money. couldnt complain at all

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Apartment at the Krasnapolsky”
Reviews.Author: tommyrey
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable 4 night stay at the Hotel Krasnapolsky. We had booked through a travel agent who asked them to provide early check-in since we arrived at 8 am on a Sunday morning from the US. The front desk staff was very pleasant and efficient and offered to upgrade us to one of the apartments they own in the canal row houses behind the hotel at no charge so that we could check in immediately. The apartments are a bit difficult to get to from the hotel (down the hall, out into the alley, down the alley and around the corner and up the steps to a separate building with a keycard access and then down some very narrow stairs once you are inside) but they are very nicely appointed and staying in the apartment gave us a better feel of what it would be like to live in Amsterdam. We had a nice modern bedroom with a flat panel TV and desk, a living room/dining room with a couch, another flat screen TV, a full kitchen and French doors out to a shared garden courtyard and a very modern and well equipped bathroom. Other than the doors to the courtyard, our lower level room had large windows facing various alleys and walls so we kept the drapes closed most of the time. The building that the apartments are in is in the first block of the red light district. It added to the experience but women traveling alone might prefer to stay in the hotel itself since there was no direct access to the hotel without going outside. Breakfast in the Winter Garden was included in our room rate and it was a great way to start the day. The food selection on the breakfast buffet was amazing and it is a stunning room. A definite plus. Not sure we would have paid for it had it not been included since it is fairly pricey. Did not try any of the other restaurants or bars. Lobby was large and pleasant with lots of places to sit but not very glamorous. As mentioned by everyone else, the location is convenient, though not particularly picturesque due to lots of construction in the area and a sand volleyball tournament set up on the square. We took a day trip by train one day and it was nice to be able to walk to the central train station. We would also highly recommend the Hop On, Hop Off canal boats which can also be boarded at the train station. You get a 24 hour pass for 20 Euro and it is good on all three routes. A great way to see the city. The only negatives were how expensive the internet access was and that no one came to make up our room the first 2 days we were there. When we called to complain we were told that housekeeping services the apartments only upon request since most guests stay there an extended time. It makes sense but it would have been nice to have been told that upfront. We asked for towels and a brief cleaning and they were there within 30 minutes and housekeeping also came the following day without being asked so they recovered nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the reviews suggested”
Reviews.Author: womantravelerZurich
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about staying at this hotel after I read the reviews here. I'm happy to report though that I had a great experience here!! I had a reservation for a standard-twin bed smoking room. At check-in I asked if it would be possible to have a room with a bigger bed. The front desk clerk checked and I was given a spacious room with a king size bed, no problem. My room was in the main building on the 4th floor. My next worry was a stinky room, which was not the case at all. It smelled very pleasant. There was a window that I could open (which had a sliver of a view of the dam) and along with the airconditioning system I was able to air out the effects of my smoking. The bathroom was old and outdated but clean. I ate the breakfast buffet in the wintergarten one time. The selection and quality of the offerings were great, however as it was not included in my room rate I had to pay for it. The price was outrageous, and I would have had to drink the champagne to get my money's worth. The location of this hotel is unbelievable!!! I found that using the trams very convenient for getting close to the attractions and to save on steps. Be sure to have comfortable walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Islanddiva7
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay at a NH hotel in Amsterdam, this is the best out of the many. Close to the Magna shopping mall, Central Train Station, and lots of restaurants... The bathroom is huge. Service and concierge are great. If you like morning coffee, there is none in the room (only tea). You have to go downstairs to the restaurant, or next door. Coffee is wonderful at the lobby lounge, but it cost 6 euros. Parking is 50 euros a day if you rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Disneybears
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, it should be made very clear that even though Priceline classifies this as a five star hotel, it is not. When one stays at a five star hotel, one expects a beautifully decorated room with Frette linens, high quality amenities and exceptional service. You will not find that here â€“ what you will find is a very large room even by US standards, very basic furnishings, motel quality linens and average service. We clearly stated that we wanted a non-smoking room when we made our reservation; however, it seems that the staff defines smoking and non-smoking rooms by whether or not the guests in the room at that time smoke. Not only was our room a smoking room, but it was located off of a small ante room that was setup for smoking conference attendees. Just walking to the room was like walking through an ashtray. When I went to the front desk to request something be done about our room, the clerkâ€™s comment was â€œWhat do you want me to do about it?â€� Not exactly the level of service one would expect from a five star hotel. This is clearly a hotel that could do with an express check-out â€“especially since this is clearly a convention destination and they have large groups of people checking in and out at the same time. Although they did have several clerks staffing the front desk when we checked out, there was no organization of the lines and people generally ignored any sort of queuing. There are a number of restaurants in the hotel, but based on what we saw and heard from other guests, they are very expensive and not that good. Fortunately, there are plenty of choices in the area that are more reasonably priced and serve better food. What does this hotel have going for it? Location, location, location. It is located right on The Dam which makes it within a block or two of the tram stops to the museums, train station and other locations. In addition, it is just about a block to the Red Light District and on the same street as a number of fun clubs. If you are simply looking for a place to shower and sleep, this is an adequate choice, but if you are looking for the exceptional lodging experience one associates with a five star establishment, youâ€™re going to be sorely disappointed. Having stayed here the one night, we would never choose to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_son
Reviews.Content: A Hotel review is based on a personal and subjective opinion. What may be acceptable to you, may not be to me, and vice versa. NH Krasnapolsky Grand Hotel Amsterdam 5* Rated 2 x weekday nights Location. Right on DAM square. A bustling tourist destination / hangout. Can get noisy especially at night. 5 mins walk from Central station. Great location for shopping, department stores, people watching etc. Mix of Business and Tourist clientele. Property: Ex Golden Tulip now owned and operated by Spanish group NH who have a very strong presence in Amsterdam today. Optimistically 5* rated. Some upgrades but dated in many areas. Check In: Busy check-in desk, pleasant and efficient. Was allocated the notorious Elevator # 5 wing. As has been reported, the rooms accessed thru the elevator # 5 portal, reflect the lower end of room quality at this property. I was prepared to go take a look before I asked for a room change. The room turned out to be small and unsatisfactory. Back at the desk after some to and fro, I was assigned 3rd floor in the main building. Much better. Clerk was not very cooperative and required some gentle coaxing on my part, but she came through. 7/10 Room: Bright and pleasant. 6/10 Large new flat screen. Selection of English channels. CNN, CNBC, BBC etc Tea coffee materials etc Mini Bar: Yes Closet stuff: In-room safe, iron, board etc Bed: King size. Hardish. I large duvet, nice pillows. 7/10 Desk and seating area. Good Wifi: Yes. In room and public areas. 11mbps @ Euro 10.7 per 24 hrs Bathroom: Clean. Selection of personal care products. Nice towels. What's close by: Pretty much everything, the location is geared towards the guest that came to experience what Amsterdam is famous for. Not unhappy to have ended up here on a low Priceline rate. Conclusion: A property in need of further modernization and upgrade. Excellent tourist location for all activities. If you get a good room it's acceptable. Stay again? Wouldn't choose this property. US rating: Currently 3.5* / 4* Value: Reasonable for Amsterdam $$. 7/10

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uk-NSE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Krasnapolsky for 5 nights over New Year 2005. It was our first visit to Amsterdam and the hotel we found to be fantastic. The rooms were very clean, modern, and comfortable, albeit slightly too warm. We didn't use the restaurant, so cannot comment on it. The only problems I experienced was that the reception staff seemed rude on more than one occasion. Then again it was very, very busy during our stay there so maybe this had something to do with it? The hotel was very nicely decorated in Christmas decorations during our stay. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just Big”
Reviews.Author: Gydko
Reviews.Content: Main square location, but not necessarily where you'd like to spend your time. Hotel is very big, and made of many interconnected buildings with different standards. Too few elevators, located at far away corners. Rooms have been renovated, comparing with previous visit few years ago, so are now really ok. Uncleaned drops on the floor, just next to the toilet, kinda spoiled the "luxury hotel" feeling.

Reviews.Title: “good location. not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: JoeDublin99
Reviews.Content: We went for weekend break to Amsterdam in Feb and stayed here. Great location and facilities were ok, but the whole place is no where close to 5 star. I would g 4 star max. servce was efficient, but cold. Food was a bit bland. I left my car keys in the safe of the room after checking out and when returing to get them it was quite a big deal for the hotel to sort out the problem. Not impressed! On the plus side the location is very good. Slap bang in the middle of Dam. We had a great weekend and were only slightly dissapointed with the hotel not living up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A great located hotel”
Reviews.Author: KC_TravelBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my Partners Birthday. We had a upgraded room which was in the seperaste part of the hotel. The room was very large and spacious. On arrival you get given a bottle of water and a gift in the room. We just had a room only basis so I did not sample the breakfast. The only thing to be aware of which I did not realise is that when you open the mini bar and pick up a item it automatically charges to you room. I had to take this up with recetion as I had been charge for 10 things that I hadn't eaten or drank i was just being nosey! They took this off of our bill You cannot get a more centrally located hotel in easy walking distance to everything and also once you have got the train from Amsterdam airport it is a 5 min walk to the hotel. The hotel is very clean and I would say a 4 star but 5 star prices. I would stay here agin but I would possibly see what the other hotel prices were as it is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Central Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller05
Reviews.Content: Hotel is actually rated as a 5-Star (as opposed to 4 on here). Got a very good deal on Priceline and was impressed by the service I got. I arrived late and the check-in staff were very cheerful and couldn't possibly have done anything more to make me feel more welcome and valued as a customer. Pros: Room size (Amsterdam Wing overlooking DamStr Centrum); Location (very central and walking distance to any of the central sights/restaurants/clubs/bars); Service (everyone I came across was really helpful, from check-in to room service and housekeeping). Cons: Twin beds pushed together to form a king size bed (with two separate duvets - luckily I was alone on this trip!); It can get a bit noisy outside, given its central location (It was Queen's day, so was a bit noisier outside than normal - with windows shut, you don't hear a thing anyway); Decor, carpets etc a bit dated, but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Aust_mum
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our 8 year old daughter on a 7am flight from Australia so were very tired. The staff were very welcoming and luckily our room was ready when we arrived so we didn't have to wait until the normal check-in time. I'd read the reviews before we had arrived but perhaps we were fortunate in the part of the hotel we were given - the Royal Wing. It seemed newer than other parts of the hotel. Our room was great - quite large for European hotels, with a very clean, modern bathroom. Excellent location. Love the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: two2tango68
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, fantastic location and quiet enough (if you get a high floor room) for you to enjoy the scene and not be bothered by it. The hotel room is large and the bathroom is very spacious for European standards; the staff is extremely friendly and the concierge was extremely helpful. The Internet was a bit overpriced, especially for business travellers; however, our overall stay was fantastic. The hotel is centrally located to many areas, we were able to walk to most. We would love to go back and enjoy the rest of Holland!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky”
Reviews.Author: vanisher77
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weekend days in April in the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky. We managed to book this hotel via Priceline for a very good price (way down the official rates) so I was very curious on what to expect... Let me say we were not dissapointed at all : * the location of the hotel is excellent (close to to where all the action is and also on walking distance from the central train station) * the room we got was large and silent. Furthermore the king size bed was one of the best I have ever eoncoutered so far. * The staff was very friendly and offered extended room access for free until 5PM on the day we left. We could use the room longer then foreseen which was very usefull. We didn't even ask for this ourselves so this is certainly something I really appreciate. Honnestly, I don't see any reasons why you shouldn't select this hotel being a leisure traveller. We will definitely come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located...Grand within”
Reviews.Author: SameerBansal
Reviews.Content: This NH group hotel is very conveniently located in the city centre...2 minute walk can take you to shopping street....wax museums or famous amsterdam night life area....just behind the hotel.....Its a lavish setup with good interiors ....rooms are spacious and well kept ....one of the cosiest beddings one can find in this hotel..... Staff is courteous and very professiona.....hotel boosts all kind of business ameneites and also allows free interneet access in business centre for 15-20 minutes a day ...which is more than enuff in routine ....Breakfast is served in open area in hotel center and is one of the most amazing setup ...one can jus feel so fresh with the interiors their and menu on breakfast is extremely lavish ....starting a day with fresh oranges and selection of fruis on offer made our day ....it offered a very comfortable stay indeed....

Reviews.Title: “At best a 3* hotel - nowhere near a 5*”
Reviews.Author: coachroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend for a single night in April on a layover in Amsterdam on the way to the US, and had the . The room was actually ok, a bit like a middle of the road Travellodge in the UK, but not what we had expected when having booked a supposed 5* hotel. The staff was also ok, but again just completely ordinary. Had we not gotten the price we did on priceline, we would have felt robbed. The location in the middle of the city is good for leisure, it you are looking to see Amsterdam, but everything about the hotel was just so incredibly average On another note, I had been looking forward to showing my partner the beautiful city of Amsterdam I experienced almost a decade ago, but what we found was an odd version of Blackpool or Benidorm. It is so so sleazy and downmarket, also the Red Ligth District, a and the local population in shops and museums were rude beyond comprehension. I am a very proud European, but the week we spent with the NYC population following our stay completely put the Dutch to shame. If you haven't booked to go to Amsterdam yet, my best advice is simply: DON'T!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Desperate Need of Top Drawer Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Caitlin_from_Toronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, good staff, great history and great potential to be much better. Overall the decor is tired. The current chain which owns it needs to spend a lot of $$$ to bring this back to its former glory days. Housekeeping is not doing a great job. Stay here if you must - but don't expect too much if you are accustomed to something like the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogervat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Krasnapolsky for three nights. The price/quality ratio of this hotel is one-of-a-kind. Great recently renewed room with a direct view on the Dam Square. Professional staff that know what staying at a 5 star hotel is all about. Restaurant Reflet has great classical French food at fair prices. Better than any other hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel? In your dreams!”
Reviews.Author: Nickjb4
Reviews.Content: The room I was in (3081) was by far the worst 5 star hotel room I have ever been in in my life (and there has been a few. Also this "person" stopped me from getting in to the hotel on the Saturday night unless I showed him my room key. I informed him I was a guest of the hotel, but he said he didn't care, he wanted to see the room key. I asked him approximately 10 times to call the hotel manager and he refused. I proceeded to go in and he physically tried to stop me knocking my hat off in the process, I eventually shoved him aside and carried on into the hotel. I have NEVER seen this behaviour at a 5 star before. I complained to the manager and she told me that it was policy to do this after 11pm (in a 5 star???) I asked her what about the previous night as it hadn't happened then and she responded saying, "well I wasn't here last night so I don't know". The guy on the door had said it was a rule only for that night due to all the football fans, so which member of saff is lying to me I wonder?

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: merluza
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The hotel itself is by far not worth the 5 star rating: outdated rooms, stains on the carpet, light switches broken, old bathroom furniture, water in shower changed from hot to cold,... . All extras were way overpriced (e.g. minibar and breakfast). At check-out, they tried to charge us for 3 beverages from the minibar we did not take. Their automatic mini-bar billing system clearly needs finetuning. We booked the room through their website and could have gotten a better deal through Priceline I guess. But that would not have changed my mind about this hotel. The grandeur of the old Krasnapolsky is gone. You can find much better offers online for other hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Long Term Apartments are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: smrtblnd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the long term apartments at the Krasnapolsky for 3 weeks while on business and the accomodations are wonderful! The apartments have recently been updated and are spacious and inviting. Staff service and professionalism are wonderful as well and the hotel is very centrally located in Dam Square and alking distance to the Central Station, tram line and many other Amsterdam attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Greatã€€location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack313
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a place to stay in for business. In the deep centre of Amsterdam. I took a upgrade to the `Royal Wing`,ã€€spacious room with wooden floor. The largest breakfast buffet I have ever seen! Very nice cocktails in the bar. Great quality, nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location but only if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: alexcaoimhelaura
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights end Feb/start March. Got great deal with 1800 hotels - two nights including breakfast â‚¬238. Was in the main building, room nice size, clean, nothing special about room, felt it could be more luxorious in fittings, bed linen etc. to merit 5 Star rating. Bathroom small but sufficient. Room cleaned each day and towels replaced and beds dressed. Breakfast was included in our price but on looking through information it would cost â‚¬17.50 for continental breakfast which was a bit much - mind you choice for breakfast was very good. Didn't eat in restaurants in Hotel as they were well over priced and didn't drink in hotel either as they were also very pricey. Check-in was slow due to number of check-in staff. Check out fine - as we left very early in morning. Check-in and out staff were friendly. Hotel lobby was nice but nothing spectacular for a 5 star. All in all - our room was by all accounts better than other reviewers and sufficient for us. For me, once its clean and not tacky its fine but i suppose if your going 5 star - it should have been better. Our area of the hotel was not smelly or dirty. There was a shoe shining machine on every floor. Was a bit noisey the first night but then it is Amsterdam. Would only stay here again and recommend it to a friend if the rate was right - as it was this time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mario-MC
Reviews.Content: For the travellers looking for a very central place in Amsterdam this is the place to go! Located on Dam Square with walking distance from the city main attractions. This was my second stay at Krasnapolsky. I upgraded my internet reservation to a better room for only 40eur. I also was able to checkout at 19h00 for 60 additional eur. Rooms very comfortable and clean. Excellent fast room service. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspiring & Depressing”
Reviews.Author: kingdom100
Reviews.Content: Before I launch into a monologue about this property I think it is useful to provide a little background to my expectations and usual aspirations as a frequent traveller. I always stay in five star deluxe properties, usually I pay rates offered directly by the property. My favoured "group" (inverted commas as strictly speaking it is not a group, more an association) is The Leading Hotels Of The World whose members are nearly always excellent, and as a member of The Leaders Club I am usually rewarded with an upgrade. A very lastminute break to Amsterdam prompted me to deviate from my favoured properties (on previous trips I've stayed at Hotel Okura which in a sentence or so offers super service, excellent dining, a good pool, but a somewhat sterile atmosphere and away from the centre location) and try my hand on Priceline. A quick search on the internet revealed that the five star property in Amsterdam is the Krasnapolsky. I secured it at a rate of 60GBP per night including all taxes/fees. The position is as central as you can get, however, it is a little in the middle of the most tacky, touristy area, although a minute's walk and you can be in more pleasant surroundings. I liken its position to staying in Leicester Sq. (London). From the outside the buildings which comprise this property look tired, think "fifties/sixties extensions", and unattractive. The lobby is characterless, international, and lacking in any style whatsoever. There is not any hint of grandeur, and it feels like a four star Hilton at best. Check-in staff were efficient enough, but impersonal. I am used to hotel staff knowing which room I'm staying in etc. so if I casually pass the concierge/reception I can make a request without the need to recite my room number, no chance of that happening here. The first room I was allocated was in an older (sixties) part of the hotel. Decor was fresh from the seventies, a very grotty bathroom and a small bedroom which again was more reminiscent of a four star Hilton back in the early nineties. I promptly requested a change of room. This one was located in the "Royal Wing" (royal by name only it would seem) which is actually located in an entirely separate building (keycard access only - no separate reception area). This wing was completed mid-nineties and doesn't seem to have been refurbished since. The corridors are narrow and often had the distinct aroma of cannabis being smoked. I mention this because it shows you the class - or lack of - guest that stays here. The room had a wooden floor, and pleasantly high ceilings. The bathroom needed replacing and felt very dated. Once again there was nothing to make me feel like I was in a five star property. Even the "easy" things like shoehorns, clothes brushes, etc. weren't present. I cannot comment on the restaurants as I didn't try them. Reflet, the fine dining restaurant is around 60-80EUR per head which seems exceptionally steep for a dated menu. One of the puddings was described as "canned cherry crumble", I am curious as to when canned fruit became something of a delicacy. The Winter Garden is probably the only room which could belong to a five star property, a very small oasis. The hotel has its rating largely because of the superb (but bland) conference facilities. As long as this huge hotel can fill rooms at decent rates paid for by conferencees' companies and fill the rest with Priceline type guests I am sure they see no need to fix something that isn't broken. It is very hard to see - from a business perspective - how they could improve other than a complete refurbishment, which I don't think would make much economic sense. As an hotel it feels like it's just given up trying to be anything special and is instead happy to tick along nicely. The Royal Wing should've been turned into an "hotel within an hotel" with its own reception area and staff, giving it more of an "executive/club floor" feel, an half floor lounge with the usual food and drink presentations would've completed this. This would be a very small step in creating something five star in this property! As an aside, the concierge recommended restaurants that had been recommended to me by a friend who used to live in Amsterdam - so perhaps this small service aspect is close to a five star standard. Would I stay here again? One must look at the prices charged by five/four star properties in Amsterdam, none of them get close to 60GBP per night. In the interest of fairness I must add that I saw no instances of the vermin and other horror stories mentioned by other reviewers, however, it is a large property so I wouldn't be surprised! Only stay here if you are getting a very cheap deal otherwise you are guaranteed to be disappointed. Don't expect anything more special than a bland, very international feeling, distinctly average four star Hilton type property.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Vicky2405
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Lastminute.com and got an excellent deal. The hotel is approximately 10 minutes walk from Amsterdam Central Station. We arrived before lunch time on the Friday and were able to check straight into our room. The hotel also offers a 'lazy Sunday checkout' which meant we were able to keep our room until we needed to leave at 3pm on Sunday at no extra cost. The room was comfortable, well equipted and serviced each day. Staff were very helpful when asking for directions and when we had a problem with the heating in the room an engineer was with us within 15mins and sorted the probem. The hotel was well placed on Dam Square which made it very easy to reach the main attraction areas. The only down side to the stay was we were asked to provide on arrival a credit card for any extras we might incur during our stay - not a problem. However we cleared our bill by paying cash on departure. On arriving home the hotel had charged Â£94.13 to my account. Following several telephone calls to the bank and one telephone call to the hotel this was refunded a week later. Apart from this 'blip' the hotel lived up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad smell like something had died”
Reviews.Author: Rubbiesarered
Reviews.Content: I took my son to Amsterdam for his birthday. The check in process was quick and our room was ready at 11.00am. Upon walking through the hotel and corridors we noticed a very bad smell - just like when a rodent has died and been left undetected. The bed covers had burn holes but the room was otherwise clean and comfortable. Restaurant prices were a joke so we did not eat there. Checkout was very slow indeed. I think from reading the reviews that which room you are allocated is very hit and miss but the main problem that everyone seems to complain about is the bad smell. I wonder if NH read these reviews and will do something about it or they will surely end up losing customers?

Reviews.Title: “Great Loacation - definately not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: saffylamb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the hotel with friends. We booked well in advance and paid Â£550 for 3 nights including flights. Although the hotel was clean and spacious, it was most definately not 5 star. Our rooms were of the standard of a travel lodge (with nice extras such as a dressing gown). We were put in the old wing which I'm guessing is much more dated than the new areas. The view from our window was on old office block roof covered in cigarette butts. It took us about 30 mins to check in as well due to a lack of desk staff, checking out wasn't much quicker. A word of warning - we had one thing out of the mini bar (Â£2.50 for a lion bar) and they tried to charge us for a collection of things - this also happened to our friends staying. However - if you manage to get this hotel at a bargain price then it would definately be a good place to stay. It is smack bang in the middle of Dam Square and everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: Diplomatico
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a winning Priceline bid of $70 U.S. (plus tax, $85 total). I was a bit worried after reading some of the harsh reviews here but had none of the problems detailed by others. Great location, large queen sized bed (very comfortable), flat screen TV, bathtub and separate stand alone shower. I wouldn't classify it as a 5 star hotel but it's certainly 4 stars by European standards. Worth a stay if you get a good price but if you're paying full rack rate go to the Hilton or the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “great location, by far not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: arnsch
Reviews.Content: The location of the property is great but anything else of this hotel is not 5-star: - the rooms (size, maintenance of furniture, etc.) - the service (no housekeeping by 3pm) - the hotel is huge but difficult to navigate and reminds me of a labyrinth If the price you see is what you would accept for a 3-star hotel, then you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 star, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: slickllh
Reviews.Content: I booked my room for two through Priceline. We stayed two nights during the week, in late January 09. We arrived at 2pm and had no problems checking in - staff was friendly enough. We requested a room with two beds, and were told that the existing setup was two twins connected to make a king, and that they could separate the beds for us, no problem. Within 5 minutes of getting to our room, the staff arrived to take care of the beds. The room and bathroom were spacious enough, but needs serious updates. Beds were comfortable. We didn't use the mini bar, but it was fully stocked. Having read some of the previous reviews, I elected to leave the items in place and not refrigerate our own things in there. It was cold enough outside, so we stashed our drinks and various things on the tiny terrace. The safe worked fine. I had thought that a '5 star' hotel that caters to business travelers might provide free wifi in the rooms, but they did not. 60 minutes of economy wifi was 10 euros. The carpet was stained in the room and some common areas, and the elevator (number 4) area stunk of a dead animal, not very appealing. A few times returning to our room, I noticed that they were trying to cover the smell with air deodorizer. Check out was easy, and the friendly concierge held our bags for us until we had to go catch our train. Overall, this hotel was fine for what we needed - a centralized place to sleep comfortably and shower. My friend and I are fairly laid back travelers, so as long as nothing is really out of line, we roll with it. I was a bit upset that this was represented as a 5 star hotel, as it most certainly is not. It's more of a 3.75. The rooms and common areas could use some updating and cleaning. PS: Love the NH toiletries! Also, if you need a good map of Amsterdam, ask for one at the desk. The one they had was better than our guidebook.

Reviews.Title: “vermin”
Reviews.Author: topguide
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for Christmas 2008 and to celebrate an Anniversary. The place being a five star hotel is a joke,however prices are no joke. We had to move rooms three times within 12 hours of arrival due to filth and mice.I. put a full review of this on WATCHDOG and I suggest any one going there to read my review there and decide if you really want to spent a lot of money to stay in a filthy hotel overrun with vermin and to make matters worse nobody cares they just want extortionate prices for everything. James Alexander

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kate787
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The rooms are tired and it needs a complete overhaul. If you are in the royal wing you are alright the rooms are modern and comfortable otherwise beware. If you aren't kept awake by the sound of the other guests they have frequent parties in the hotel which go on till the early hours..Good if you are on a bachelor party perhaps and want to join, not so good if you have to be at work at stupid oclock in the morning. the room for breakfast is gorgeous as is the food. Most of the guests probably need a good breakfast after clog dancing on your ceiling all night :-) It doesnt meet the standards of other NH hotels I have stayed in which is a shame b/c I am a big fan of this chain..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant - Could not fault it one bit!”
Reviews.Author: rsmith85
Reviews.Content: I regularly use this website to look at reviews before booking any hotel. I must also confess that whilst I use these reviews for my own benefit, I have never been one to bother writing a review on a hotel that I have stayed in myself. This is because normally I just tell friends and family about it, and not get time to write up a review on it. HOWEVER, on this occasion I felt that I must write a review because I was so happy with it. Here goes.. I booked up this hotel for my girlfriends 21st bday and stayed for a weekend. Booked hotel and flight with easyjet (faultless service). When making my booking I made a note that it was my gf's birthday on the day of arrival and also requested some tulips to be presented to her upon our arrival as a nice little surprise for her. When he arrived, the receptionist informed me that they had given us a free upgrade to the superior suite, which was music to my ears! Also, 15 minutes after entering the room, the phone went and it was the receptionist asking If I would like them to bring up the tulips now (Which I was suprirsed about also, because I thought they had forgotten or just not bothered fulfilling my request!). The staff are all very friendly and speak great English, and are happy to help. The Grounds are very large - Yes there is sometimes a busy lobby, but that is because top companies like to stay there and have meetings in their office rooms (There was a Tommy Hilfiger meeting the day we left!) The food and drink there was nice, but pricey so I'd advise you eat out - there are some lovely restaurants around the area! Location is second to none. Could not wish for better! Everything within close proximity including Red Light District, the Station is 10 mins walk, The sex museum, madame tussauds, the Amsterdam Dungeon etc. And with Trams on your doorstep and Cabs easy to get, you woud have no problem getting everywhere! To Summarise, I had a wondeful time at this hotel, and would recommend it to all! There is something for everyone in the area, and this hotel was a big part of why it was such a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: XYZ_2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located directly on Dam Square, in the historic center of Amsterdam. Incidentally, it is also on the edge of the red light district. The rooms are spacious but dated and in need of renovation (especially the bathrooms). The common areas could be updated as well. We ended up moving after two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with overpriced dining”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMick
Reviews.Content: The lobby can be total chaos - counter staff, lots of them, seem to take forever to get things done. You jockey for position with other guests to be served next. They smile and all that behind the counter but are not forthcoming with any information you might need.
