We stayed in the royal wing which was defintely not royal. you actually have to leave the building and cross a breezeway/lane into the royal wing.The room itself -"ooh you have a deluxe room" is how the counter staff termed it - wasn't deluxe. Clean, but jaded is the best way to describe the room. Bed killed my back....way too soft. They have a gorgeous looking restaurant and wintergarten but alas so expensive (28euro breakfast) they sit quietly empty. Staff didn't want to give me change for 50euros for the airport shuttle bus - not the treatment you'd expect from a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: secretsanta
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1 night stay here on priceline at a price of Â£80 + charges. Ended up in the Royal Wing in a "deluxe" room. The good: Location is superb - a 5 min walk from the station in one of the main squares. Noise was surprisingly good - despite being right on a main nightlife road, i didn't really hear a think in my room. Room was large. The bad: The hotel classes itself as 5* - an official 3* is about right, but in need of a serious revamp. I think I was in one of the newer rooms, and the fittings couldn't have been blander. The shower goes hot/cold and the toiletries were of a very poor quality. The bed was very soft. Check in is extremely slow - when we arrived there was a queue of about 5 waiting to check in, and by the time we were at the front (20-30mins later) there was a significantly larger queue behind. Staff suffer from a problem that seems to be an NH group quality - look charming and smile, but go extremely slowly and do nothing about fixing any problems (also stayed at the NH Zandvoort on the same trip where the staff were even more useless). Room service/mini bar prices were rediculous. For the money, the location meant that it was worth it. Had I paid anything like the rates they charge on their website, I'd have been very dissappointed... Amsterdam has a lot of very cool/stylish hotels - this one is just living on it's past name. One place worth a visit is Gauchos steak restaurant just round the corner - superb!

Reviews.Title: “Just Book Deluxe Room for the best luxury in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: renegadeLondon
Reviews.Content: Another pleasant stay at NH Krasnapolsky. The trick is to book just about 10-15 days in advance and select Deluxe Room. Off Course the price will be somewhat higher but you will expect to get a much larger room that is modern and has features that are well contemporary. All the Standard Rooms and Executive Rooms are in the main building so are very old fashioned and not modernly designed. Request your Deluxe Room in The Royal Wing which is seperate from the main building. All the rooms are Deluxe with excellent views, most comfortable beds and lots of space. Lower floor rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows and wooden flooring. bathrooms are well clean and enjoyable. Ask for rooms at the top floors that have balconies. Fantastic views and you can smoke !! The rest of Krasnapolsky is non-smoking. A very strongly recommende hotel for a memorable stay in luxurious atmosphere and feel good factor.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable rooms but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SimoneEv
Reviews.Content: Due to business trips, I had to stay in Krasnapolsky for several times on stays of 1-2 weeks. The rooms I had were always facing the back of the buiding or other corners of buildings across so not much of a view. The rooms were clean, decent decorations - I am not aware how the new rooms look like. One funny side it's the door to the bathroom : it looks as if you're going in a closet :-) Breakfast was amazing and I was always looking forward to get to this part of the day. On one side it's the room in itself, old elegant sophisticated with a luminator. The food was also exquisite. The hotel is located across the Royal Palace and round the corner from Red light district...funny combination but all in all you are exactly in the heart of everything.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: alyson.johnson-smith_123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband over the weekend at the end of November. Check in was quite quick. I arrived at 12 noon expecting them to tell me my room was not ready but it was (Good start). The hotel is very impressive and on walking through was expecting great things, the room however was average. There was nothing wrong with it but after being so impressed with the lobby etc I could not help be a little dissappointed. The hotel looks 4 - 5 star but the rooms make it a 3 -4. The bed however, was soo comfortable. We did eat in one of the restuaurants and whilst eating we saw a mouse inside and not too far away from us. We had a quiet word with the manager so as not to draw attention and it was explained to us that since digging in Amsterdam has begun for the new Metro system mice had become a big problem everywhere in the city. I have no doubt that the Kitchen was clean and I do believe the explanation. The manager dealt with the complaint well and gave us a free meal for the fright it caused. Staff are really helpful. This hotel operates Sleepy Sunday, which means you do not have to check out until 5pm on Sunday - An excellent idea You may think due to the mouse thing I would not rate it so highly but I really do believe what I was told and otherwise no problems. I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star but not bad”
Reviews.Author: yorkshireswallow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is by no means 5 star, more a slightly jaded 4 star. I guess it's got 5 stars because of its conferencing facilities (which meant it was packed out with people in formal clothes, which I guess is a good sign, although getting into the building when they were all having a cigarette break was a bit of a battle). We got upgraded to the 'Royal Wing', which is the new bit at the back, separated from the main hotel by a walkway. The room was bigger, though not much better and it was noiser as it was on the first floor above a main road. The room smelled a bit of drains (something to do with the water change over in Amsterdam and the rain). However, the hotel was very well located, meaning we could walk to most places and the staff were helpful. There's a decent alternative to the hotel bar across the square, it's called Majestic; good for a cocktail .

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: CherryC
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Lastminute, and was rather surprised to find the rate that was quoted. I didn't have a credit card with me, and foolishly didn't arrange to have a pre-auth sent through. No real problem - the Duty Manager could see I was unlikely to be much of a problem guest so a cash advance against room service was ok. More on that later. My room at it's bargain rate turned out to be on the top floor and was not one of the recently renovated ones. This was ok with me, the room had everything I needed and more despite being a little bit on the dated side. The bathroom looked to have been fairly recently upgraded. The bathroom contained a bit of a surprise to me, the wealth of toiletries which are supplied. Way above the usual and very very nice quality (the hotel sells them too, which I didn't take advantage of as I was travelling hand baggage only so couldn't have taken them home again). There was a little sponge, a comb, a hairbrush, a shaving kit and a toothbrushing kit as well as the usual shampoo, shower gel, soaps and body lotion. All in little wrappers! The comb was confiscated on the way back through Schipol (maybe they were scared I'd take it out of the wrapper and start demanding to comb the pilot's hair). One down side was some dust - possibly due to renovations however it did make me think that the rooms don't get used enough or are not being worked on enough by the staff. There was dust on the coffee sachets - this being said, the cleaning staff were very much in evidence so maybe just one of those things. I was given extra coffee sachets cheerfully on request by the maid. Everything otherwise was fine, though I did in the end use the minibar (I wouldn't have without having given a deposit). Possibly the most expensive thing going, 12â‚¬ for a diet coke, small can of Pringles and a Snickers. 12â‚¬!! Checking out, the balance was returned without any worries and the City Tax was simply deducted. Next time I might even not worry about upgrading to a "better" room. There were electronically remote controlled sunscreens outside the window, a little book of stories as light reading and even a packed of Smints!

Reviews.Title: “Love it, love it, love it! Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: SGRR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night in Sept 2008. Booked from priceline so we did not have any high expectation especially after reading the comment. However, the hotel was by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in Europe. Our room was in the 4th floor, very big spacious room with large bath tub. Everything was perfect that we regret we did not stay longer. We moved to Hilton Amsterdam but Krasnapolsky is way better.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: LancashireBluebell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend break. We had a fantastic large clean room in the Royal Wing. It was cleaned well each day. We found the staff very friendly and courteous. We arrived early in the morning, too early for check -in, but we were able to leave our baggage at the hotel free of charge. As mentioned in a previous review, the mini bar is sensitive. I moved something inorder to put a drink in it, it registered on reception that 2 items had been used. This was not a problem, the young receptionist immediately made out another bill minus the 2 items, explaining the above. It's a great location close to shops, bars, trams, restaurants. We walked from Centraal Station to the hotel. Our stay was enjoyable and comfortable, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “decent sized room; clean, modern bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: yellowbear613
Reviews.Content: Overall, I liked the hotel for its central location (we walked almost everywhere), modern rooms, and clean bathrooms. It is right in Dam Square and a quick walk to the train station. We stayed in a side building and the rooms were quiet. Check in and out was easy and efficient. It is also right next to a yummy fries stand!!

Reviews.Title: “Vastly Overrated Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: musicben
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Krasnapolsky about 5 times over the years and often found it disappointing. On my most recent trip I had to pay about 450 euro's a night for a room due to a conference in Amsterdam. For that I got a TINY room with a single bed out in their back building backing on to the red light district. Perhaps the rooms in the main Hotel are better but I would strongly advise clarifying exactly what you will get before you walk hundreds of metres through the Hotel to the second rate annex at the back. On the upside breakfasts are fantastic and the location is right in the center. That said I would rather stay at the Lloyd or the John Lennon Hilton instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: smileman
Reviews.Content: Great hotel perfect location. Close to everything. Amsterdam is a great city and the Kranapolsky was the best place to stay with its nice size rooms and location. It is easy to find, if you dont have too much luggage you can walk from the train station, it might be a quarter mile. Dont waste your money on a cab from the airport, the train is less than 5 euros per person to Amsterdam Centraal. Instant coffee and tea in the rooms and the usual overpriced mini-bar . I could not get the internet to work, supposedly its wireless but you can rent time on their computers which was cheaper for my limited use. The hotel includes 5 euros worth of free use of the business center computer. My Priceline room did not include breakfast and Im not much on breakfast anyway. Overall very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel at most!”
Reviews.Author: akis4
Reviews.Content: first night experience: an extra small room with an awful smell coming from the bathroom ( almost vomited...) breakfast: descent reception: willing but insufficient and as a cherry to the cake: they tried to charge 350 euros for a phone call that never took place. when i denied it they implied i was a liar... what a wonderful attitude! beware...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: chermeyer
Reviews.Content: I know others have panned this hotel but we had the most wonderful experience and I would highly recommend the hotel to others. My husband and I booked a 3-night stay in Amsterdam via Priceline and honestly were a bit concerned when the Grand Hotel Krasnoposky accepted our bid due to some of the reviews, but it turned out to be the best stay we've ever had in the city. Check-in was fast, the staff was courteous, location was great and we were not only given a nice non-smoking room with a king-size bed - but we were given a suite! We also bid less than others mentioned on Tripadvisor. One thing I would mention is that once our Priceline bid was accepted, we called the hotel to reserve a king-size bed in a non-smoking room. In terms of location, the hotel is very close to the Red Light District but also within close walking distance to the canals in the "nicer" part of the city. We walked everywhere (did not take the tram once) and had a wonderful time. I was so sad to leave Amsterdam and I know we'll go back again and hope for the same hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: VeryPickyLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through lastminute.com and we didn't know the hotel name (the secret hotel offer that they have). We got it for very good price (240 GBP for 2 nights). When we got there, the reception girl wasn't very smart and it took her 1 hour to find us in system. She was nice and smiled a lot but couldn't figure out how to do it. We waited there long and then got bored waiting and went and walked around hotel. When we came back she looked at us as if we are new guests and asked if she can help us!!!! Then she picked up again our papers and started looking for our room again. Strange. Anyway, the room was big and clean. The location is great. We walked every where. Getting to hotel from airport using public transport was very easy. We didn't try the hotel food. I would recommend it if you don't pay the full price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there for the service, not for the rooms, Stay for the view.”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for 2 nights in the executive level overlooking the Dam. The room was located on the second floor providing a wonderfull view over the Damsquare. Unfortunately the room itselves was very very basic, a very small and hard bed, one inconvenient chair and a very oldfashioned and little dirty bathroom. The lightening and electronical equipments in the room are ok, even as the television. Don't stay in the Krasnapolsky if you are looking for something "stylish and tatty", the Krasnapolsky has become a place where people enjoy breakfast in bermuda's and on bare feet. The service is as in most NH Hotels, good but basic.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible end to a lovely time”
Reviews.Author: Ndablend
Reviews.Content: My family had lived in the Netherlands and were at the end of our stay. We stayed at the krasnapolsky for a total of 3 weeks and 4 days. They ruined what would have been a nice end to our Holland saga by throwing us out! We had asked that our reservation be extended as we had problems getting flights out, but the staff we spoke with did not put our request in the system. the hotel proceeded to force our family of five out, relegating us to a poky 2 star hotel. We were VERY shabbily treated and i will remember that Hotel with a bad taste in my mouth. The staff lied, threatened and took advantage of our ignorance of hotelling laws. The fact that we were regular paying guests counted for nothing. I will write formal letters to their management. Expect that at some point, if u stay there, u may be maltreated at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ugly rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sciamano
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is excellent, right in front of the Royal Palace. But that's basically it. First of all I have to say that we "won" this hotel with Priceline at around $160/night (not exactly cheap, considering we won much better hotels in Germany for less than half that price) This is important because it seems that they have very different room "levels". This is understandable and I'm aware that when I book with Priceline I might receive the worse rooms of the hotels I win. The problem is that this facility is officially a 5-star rating hotel, but the rooms they give to Priceline users are much worse than what you'd expect in a 3 star hotel. The first room they gave us was officially a non-smoking room, but it smelled like a cigar lounge. I complained and was given another room, just a few doors down. This time it did not smell, but -as the first one- it was simply ugly: small, dirty, rundown and with a horrible bathroom. Suffice it to say that it does not even have a real door, just a couple of saloon-like shutters. Not only it looked old and dirty, it was also one of the smallest bathrooms I've ever seen. When you check-in, be aware that if you are given a room in the back of the hotel, reachable through elevator #5, you are going to have a terrible experience. On the other hand, the public spaces of the hotel are very nice, although they too look pretty old, and would need a renovation. The Winter Garden where the breakfast buffet is prepared is very nice, although I'm not sure the buffet itself is worth the high price. If you don't want to spend that much, there are a few places that sell bread, croissants and rolls just a few meters from the hotel (especially on Damrak). Otherwise the department store that is just outside the hotel (on the right, looking at the Royal Palace) has a nice cafeteria. Also, if you arrive in Amsterdam by car, be prepared to spend an arm and a leg for parking: we parked at the Krasnapolsky's garage and we paid EUR 47.50 (~$75) per night! This hotel might be a 5-star when paying full price and given the best rooms, but it hardly clinches 3-stars level when given 'Priceline rooms'. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad room”
Reviews.Author: tonguepaste
Reviews.Content: The Kras is in an optimal location in Grand Dam Square in Netherlands, just a few blocks from Centraal Station, just on the edge of the red light district ... It's a beautiful hotel with great desk-service and all required amenities. Good a/c, nice bathroom, very clean. I have no complaints about any of this stuff. However, we were given a room overlooking a construction site, and the construction workers began throwing metal and whatnot around outside at 6 am. Horrible! Impossible to sleep in on what was supposed to be a vacation ... I don't know if I was given this room because I booked through Priceline or what, but I have to give the Kras a big thumbs-down on service for this. Even if my placement in the room wasn't purposeful, they should have known about the construction and simply not given that room or adjoining rooms to anyone, no matter how they booked. Otherwise, no complaints, and I would stay there again. But I'm still angry, a month later, about this and about their more or less unrepentant attitude when I complained upon check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at this hotel many times, my favourite in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: CYarranton
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It's definitely the best one that I've stayed at in Amsterdam. I can't recommend it enough. The room was a very good size. Nice bathroom with an amazing power shower. Very helpful staff at the check in and concierge. The location is ideal, right on Dam Square. It has a lovely atmosphere ...there is often a pianist playing in the lobby. My favourite part of the experience is the breakfast. It seems a little steep at 25euro, but it's the nicest breakfast I have ever had. You can help yourself to champagne, there is a chef cooking your eggs/omlettes however you like, another chef to cook hot cherry waffles also pastries, fried bacon & sauages, yogurts, cheese, fruit ... I could go on. It kept me filled up for most of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Shocking service”
Reviews.Author: spannerpan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand krasnapolsky for one night. It was a special occasion so after I booked I called the hotel to see if they could put chocolates in the room or anything. They said please call back in the daytime so I sent an email instead. That was 5 days ago and I still haven't had a reply! Room service was dreadful. They didn't send us all our breakfast and when I called about it they hung up on me! Reception didn't care and amazingly they still charged us for it! I would never stay there again because of the shocking service but on the plus side the rooms were nice (but we asked specifically for a double bed and got 2 singles joined together).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not 5-star”
Reviews.Author: geeper
Reviews.Content: Not bad. I wasn't there long. Pretty much just enough to sleep. Room was decent. I wouldn't say 5 start but probably more 4-ish. Staff was helpful and friendly. Location was pretty good and central. About 10 minutes walk to Amsterdam Centraal. 5 minutes to RLD. Right off the Dam plaza. Ate locally in the neighborhood (Argentinian steakhouse) and took off for Schiphol early the next day from Centraal. Used Priceline and would PL there again but it's overpriced at regular rates IMO

Reviews.Title: “needs rennovation a severe dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: mattmerch
Reviews.Content: stayed one night here was quite dissapointed first when i checked in was given key and directions to room verbally and written on key holder unfortunately the directions were to the wrong lif and the other end of the hotel first room we were given had a quite nasty smell of sewage after ringing reception was offered an alternative room which was better but had a smell off smoke even though was a non smoking room room was large and clean but i think the hotel needs rennovation as there is a musty smell in most parts of the hotel bathroom had a municipal feel to it to sum up this hotel has agreat location but it seems past its sale by date was not worth the discounted rate i got 100 gbp

Reviews.Title: “Good service and early check in and late check out catered for!”
Reviews.Author: KfromBelfast
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in mid June. I had emailed in advance to request an early check in and when no non-smoking standard rooms were available early we decided to upgrade to the royal wing. This was 45 euro per night and the room was very nice. I would say certainly good 4 star standard. We were on the second floor and had no trouble with noise from the street below. We also had a late flight home on the Sunday so being able to check out at 5 was great. The desk staff were helpful and friendly The hotel is very well located and a 5-10 minute walk from central station. Our only disappointment was we decided to go to the sunday brunch in the winter garden and it was over when we arrived- even though the info in our room said it was from 1-3pm (so you might want to check if you want to do the same.) Mini-bar was well stocked - no price list in sight though! We ordered a pizza from room service which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Glamour”
Reviews.Author: 0Venera0
Reviews.Content: This is an old-school, old-world hotel with slightly fading glamour, but great location, service, and amenities nontheless. We got an amazing price for this place, given the location (right on the square) and the room (HUGE, with a king bed the size of a trampoline, a bathtub big enough for two, and a seperate marble shower stall that could fit four comfortably). The room was decorated in rich burgundies and golds, very old-school, very classic. The bathroom was enormous even for US standards (not to mention European standards), and made us feel like we had a mini-spa in our room. Room service is available 24 hours a day. Staff is very polite and gracious. Check-in and check-out took about 10 minutes, which was slighly frustrating. They know they have a large hotel with many people coming and going, they should staff the desk with more individuals at peak times. This seemed like a hotel for the older, gentried set. We saw many people coming in for the night right around the time we were leaving. Unlike with many European hotels, breakfast was *not* included with our room. (At the room rate we got, I couldn't blame them.) An enormous buffet is available, for a price.

Reviews.Title: “A superb location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoefitz
Reviews.Content: Such a superb location. A lovely hotel and the rooms we got (2 twin superior rooms) were lovely. It was very comfortable and the breakfasts were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: oxxygen
Reviews.Content: There was not a great choice of hotels in the beginning of May, and we had to choose this hotel for a short city break. Overall, it's a good place close to everything in the city. Service is ok, breakfast is good (although costs 20+ euro)... But there are some drawbacks that I wouldn't expect from the 5star hotel priced at 250 euro plus. Room was not cleaned properly, some stuff was left by previous tenants in bathroom. Somebody barfed in the elevator, and this smell lasted until I checked out... it was really disgusting and encouraged to use stairs. So, next time I would find something more modern and better served, or at least cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Not staying at the Kras anymore!”
Reviews.Author: Meanwhile
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Kras and was our last. In short, the shower door was nothing but coated wood and didn't have a seal on the bottom, so the bathroom floor became sopping with each shower, the hairdryer worked dismally, the linens on the bed and the mattress under reminded me of something in a nursing home, and the housekeeping was attricious! Upon checking into the 1st room (on this trip), we moved immediately because there was hair all over the bathroom floor. The second room looked cleaner, but the lighting was horrid, and I think it ended up being just as "not clean" as the first room. While the location is good, it's the only place in wonderful Amsterdam that feels touristy, which we hate. It seems to be a choice for business meetings because it can accommodate large groups. But for that, we would have stayed someplace else. Amsterdam is a lovely city but, unfortunately, their 5 star hotels are few and often not even close to a 5 star that we are used to, but there certainly must be someplace better than this!

Reviews.Title: “First Class at the Kras!”
Reviews.Author: lidzfromchi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 16 year old daughter to Amsterdam on our way to Egypt. We only had a long weekend so we wanted to be close to everything. The Kras (as it is known) was absolutely amazing. We arrived incredibly early, way before check-in time, tired and hungry after the overnight flight. Check-in was a quick and very curteous. Although they did not have our rooms ready, they offered us the option of either having breakfast on them or if we wanted to upgrade for 10 Euro a night for both rooms we could be upgraded and have our rooms right away. We opted for the rooms which were huge according to European standards, very clean and well appointed. The breakfast is a great deal if you include it in your room price, otherwise its very expensive but is much like a Sunday brunch spread at any top American hotel, even champagne every morning (if you can drink that early) All of our requests were quickly attended to (like extra towels and pillows) The halls were nice and quiet and the decore of the hotel is an interesting mix of old world and modern. It is also literally around the corner from shopping, the Red Light, and anything else you could imagine. A trip to the museum district will set you back about 10 Euros as it is on the other side of town. The train station is within walking distance and the view from our rooms was breathtaking! We looked right onto the main square and at the old palace. We loved it and would return again and again. Hopefully next time the dollar won't be in such sad shape!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gaweca
Reviews.Content: We absolutely fell in love with Amsterdam. The city buzzed with culture, energy, and fun. Hotel was quite large in an excellent location. Service at front desk was very friendly and efficient, but unfortunately was not in bars and restaurants (breakfast buffet in main restaurant was very impressive). Room was good size, but a bit shabby. Easy to get around city on trolleys. Recommend canal boat tour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: penangnite
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is as near perfect as can be. Right on Dam Sq across the road from the Royal Palace and the Old Church, the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky is presumably a five-star grand dame of Amsterdam. While its a wonderful hotel by many standards, I am not convinced about this 5-star status. Nevertheless, its location is impeccable, about 10-15 mins walk along the Damrak from the Central Station, 5-10 mins walk to the fame Red Light District, literally around the corner from the shopping district, 5 mins walk to Anne Frank's house and about 20 mins walk to the Museums, it is a perfect hub for discovering Amsterdam. The rooms are of ample size - mine measured approx 300 sq foot. with a modern-fitted bathroom and the usual amenities, bathrobes, slippers etc. Cable TV and Wi-Fi in all rooms as well. Staff is professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Refreshing Change”
Reviews.Author: RedGiraffe
Reviews.Content: Great staff, good tourist location, amazing breakfast and large apartments. I would recommend a stay at this hotel. Having been a regular visitor to Amsterdam over the last 10 years I finally got around to trying out the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky. An easy going friendliness was instantly evident from the doorman, receptionist, luggage chap and waitresses. The whole staff provided a warm welcome and were highly efficient. No niggles at all. We were given an apartment rather than the standard room that I had booked. This was a short walk through the rear of the hotel, accompanied by the luggage chap. Might be a viewed as a â€˜dark alleyâ€™ if you didnâ€™t know Amsterdam too well. No problems during our stay but if you are a nervous traveller it might not be the right part of the hotel for you. Get someone to take your bags. A 5 Euro tip (per case) always gets a good response. We were on the 3rd floor in a corner apartment where Pjlsteeg meets the Oudezijds Voorburgwal. This is the edge of the Red Light District and it is busy into the small hours. There will be noise. The apartment was massive. Split over 2 floors. The lounge/Kitchen-diner on the first floors with windows over looking the canal and side street. A further set of steep, narrow stairs leads to the bathroom (Washer/Dryer) and the huge attic bedroom. Seemed like there were fresh towels, robes and toiletries for 10 people. No mini bar or coffee stuff but the kitchen had a fridge and everything else you might need. There is a shop below that sells basic supplies (open till about 7pm). The safe is in the bedroom (I never used this due to previous reviews about problems with cash being stolen). TV on both floors, stereo and VHS player. It definitely needs updating but it was reasonably clean. Housekeeping doesnâ€™t seem to come daily to the apartments. I think mainly because there are enough supplies to keep you going for the duration of your stay. This did not cause us any issues. Breakfast in the Winter Gardens was very nice indeed. Comparable in price (25 euro pp) and semi-self-serve format to most of the big Dutch hotels, itâ€™s enough to keep you going all day. Donâ€™t be shy to ask for more champagne if you find the ice bucket empty. The location opened up some parts of the city that I hadnâ€™t been in years. I even ditched the usual taxi ride in from Schiphol in favour of a train ride and a short walk from Centraal. Pretty much hassle free but donâ€™t forget to keep some coins handy (about 4 Euro one way) for the ticket machines at the airport/ train station (the machines at CS donâ€™t accept visa cards for some reason â€“ only maestro). Dam is always busy and expect to battle the crowds at some point. You will feel like a tourist as this is the main drag for those visiting but the central location and easy transport options give you access to the whole of the city. I was a little disappointed that I didnâ€™t get a chance to experience more of the main hotel but the apartment was good overall (mainly because it was roomy enough to relax in when the weather got too bad). I will use this hotel again. If you are looking for dining options I always take time eat the following â€“ Indian â€“ Akbar : located at the Korte Leidsedwarsstraat 15 near the Leidseplein/Leidsestraat. Chinese â€“ Sea Palace : Oosterdokskade 8 near Nemo. Steak - El Rancho Argentino VI : Korte Leidsedwarsstraat 71- 73

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and very friendly staff but rooms are less attractive”
Reviews.Author: rail_traveller00
Reviews.Content: Was participating at a congress in AMS and this hotel is ideally linked with the Congress Center by tram in about 20 minutes. It is very well located in the heart of Amsterdam, not far from the Central Station. Check-in staff, Reception staff are extremely helpful and friendly. During check-out time, glasses of orange juice are put at disposal on the front desk. It is a pity that the rooms need a renovation; my bathroom has been renovated but my single bed room looked not attractive at all and very small compared to the price. Defintely not in line with a 5-star rating ! No newspaper service, small choice of foreign TV channels. Ask the reception for a good indonesian restaurant: they will give you an excellent adress just a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: rayBelfast
Reviews.Content: we had a really great weekend in this hotel, the rooms were huge and spotlessly clean, the location is in the middle of dam square so central for everything, the breakfasts were great and had an extensive choice, staff were friendly and helpful and there was also a good range of bars and restuarants on site, overall a great 5 star choice

Reviews.Title: “Yeah, pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Broadens_the_mind
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on business. Great location on Dam Sq, well decorated, professionally run with pleasant staff, I found. Asked for a non-smoking room, but none available when I arrived so arranged to be moved on day 2 - this was a good thing cos my 1st floor smoking room was small (I paid EUR 120/night, room only) and v. noisy from the street outside. 2nd & subsequent nights in 4th fl non-smoking room was much better. Room bigger and more importantly, quiet. Wifi is available in the rooms & costs a pricey EUR 17.00 or 22.00 per day - to send/receive email via POP you need the dearer one. In the business centre you can get 15 minutes free internet access at hotel PCs only. Had breakfast in the hotel on day 3 - they charged us a delusional EUR 27.50 per head for buffet breakfast. Good quality, but what a rip-off! We didn't go there again. On my last day, Housekeeping rang my doorbell at 8:30am & told me they wanted me to hurry up & check out because they wanted the room! In conclusion, a good hotel experience marred by one or two things and rip-off extras. Next time I'd look around for other places before staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Thedevils
Reviews.Content: We had booked this weekend away as two couples, but because of illness ended up going minus one half of one of the couples. This didn't stop us having a fantastic time at this hotel.The hotel is in a fantastic location and easy to get to from the train station, 5 min walk. Check in was easy and quick which was good as we arrived at 10:30pm. The rooms were well stocked and very clean. We did ask for rooms next to each other as we didn't want a woman on her own too far away. We were told that they had no rooms any closer together. We needn't have worried as once we had got to our rooms they were only seperated by a small flight of stairs and a landing.The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful and were always on the go.The breakfast, included in our bargain priced break, was excellent, just the thing to set you up for a day walking around Amsterdam. There was everything you could imagine including champagne, all on a self serve basis. My husband did get his moneys worth out of the breakfast and the champagne! On returning from this break we have searched to find the same deal, we paid just over Â£140 per person for Fri to Mon flight hotel and breakfast, but the cheapest we can find is Â£270. If you can find the deal we got, book it and have a fantastic time at the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsy, cos we certainly did!

Reviews.Title: “FAB”
Reviews.Author: AllieDorset
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group from my husbands company, so as we didn't pay I can't comment too much on the costings. However, we loved it. Everywhere was spotlessly clean, from the hotel rooms, the restaurants, the foyer and the bar to the steps outside. Our room was cleaned to an extremely high standard every day and the accessories in the room to help your stay more comfortable were great. The staff were always friendly and all of them said Good Morning/Good Afternoon, whether they were management, restaurant staff or chamber maids. The only time we ate there was for breakfast in the Winter Garden restaurant and there was everything there you could possibly want - no one could go there and say they didn't like anything on offer! There was even champagne if you fancied it!!!! The location couldn't of been better for a tourist. The Hotel was so quiet inside you could never imagine that you were in possibly the busiest part of the city. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Small Room”
Reviews.Author: CitiBreaker
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great service, Restaurant didnt have a huge choice but pleanty in the locality. Expensive services. Only negative point: Room was very very small, the bathroom door was two pieces of wood (saloon doors) unlockable. general room standards were dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “A great time at the Kras”
Reviews.Author: SimonALeicester
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of reviews for this hotel and they are decidedly mixed so we were a little nervous about what to expect. We went as two couples for three nights and had booked a 3 nights for 2 deal with breakfast included, double rooms. Impressions? Well above average! We arrived early on a Monday morning, check in was quick and efficient, and we were porterted to our rooms, all by 11am. The rooms were in the 'elevator 5' block which previous reviewers had warned against but we needn't have worried. The rooms were clean and comfortable if a little small. King sized beds (not singles pushed together), new flat screen TVs (although not connected up to the hotel's info system yet), small bathroom but well stocked, seperate (small) toilet, not much storage space. A safe (good), bathrobes and slippers (good) - although our friends did not have bathrobes, an oversight that was not corrected by the hotel. Free tea and coffee, Minibar but not used (buy your snacks from the supermarket at the other side of Dam Square behind the Royal Palace. There are ice machines on each floor to chill your wine!). We did not make much use of the hotel services but the staff were always friendly and helpful when required. Breakfast - fantastic! The Winter Garden is a wonderful, large. airy conservatory and the buffet is endless. Anything and everything to eat, including champers should you want it! Checkout was equally quick and easy and you can leave your bags in the luggage room if you are not travelling back until later. Overall, we had a good three days here. Lots of conferences on the go so there are always lots of sweeties to pick up on the way to and from your room! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: rooba63
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of nights in the royal wing at this hotel and while I would not rate it as five-star, it is difficult to find any major fault . Admittedly, I did come here on a flight & hotel deal - and if I'd paid full price I may not have been quite so happy. Minor annoyances for anyone expecting five-star luxury would be the lack of assistance with bags, no bathrobes, no price list for minibar (simple solution - don't use it) and, in my case, a room looking right out on the next door building. However, the location is perfect, the room was spotless and very quiet, while the staff, while hardly what I would call friendly, were highly efficient. All in all, a pleasant hotel I would recommend to anyone (just don't pay full price!). Holiday hint: Get the train from the airport, it's very easy to use and fast. Don't even think about shelling out 30 euros for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Okay- but pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Krakas
Reviews.Content: I went there with girlfriends for a 40th birthday. Overall we had a good experience, but we were assured it was a 5 star hotel - not everewhere in that hotel; no way. We asked for a room that could accomodate 3 people , we all paid individually. They put us in a double room , and added a fold up (albeit comfortable) bed. We then had to request toiletries and towelling for 3 people from housekreeping; but they kept on leaving enough only for 2. I know it is a knit picky thing- but in a 5 star hotel, I expect luxurious service. The breakfast is great, and there is something for everyone. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful; except for the Concierge; who was just downright rude!! However you cannot fault the location as we walked almost everywhere from there. we all agreed that we would go back .

Reviews.Title: “Room in the Royal Wing did not impress me”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the check in was slow and not so friendly. No assistance with bags we just got a key card and instructions to go to the Royal Wing. The room there was nice but nothing what you would expect in a so called Royal Wing. We stayed from Saturday till Sunday so when we read that there were the NH Lazy Sundays with check out in the late afternoon we thought that that was also for us but no: when we came back from some shopping at Bijenkorf at 1 pm we could not enter our room so we had to walk all the way to the reception where they said we should have asked for a Lazy Sunday! how wonderful that is... For parking our car we had to pay a lot of money so that was not nice either!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: balf70
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel several times over the years. There are 2 parts of the hotel, main hotel rooms are more traditional some in need of refurb. The Royal wing is adjacent to main hotel through and alley - its enclosed and safe. I prefer the rooms in the Royal wing as they are modern with wooden floors, large bathrooms good toiletries. Hotel is very central - right on Dam square, just behind Red Light District, lots of shops, restaurants, coffee shops, bar close by. 5 mins walk to central station

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NOONNIE
Reviews.Content: Have recently read some not so hot reviews about this hotel but I must say that I have just come back after having spent 2 nights in it and will definitely be back. The hotel is in a perfection location for seeing all sights of Amsterdam. We arrived early on Saturday and although check in was not supposed to be until 3pm we were greeted by extremely friendly staff who booked us in immediately. Our rooms where very clean bright and airy with loads of space. The bathroom was stocked with every concievable item of toiletry that was needed. I would highly recommend this hotel and for a bargain price of â‚¬200 for the 2 nights would have no hesitation in going back there.

Reviews.Title: “We love the grand!!”
Reviews.Author: Holly290
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Grand for two years running. At christmas time. We absolutely love it. Yes it does need a bit of upgrading in areas but it is a luxurious and spotlessly clean hotel. The rooms are big and very comfortable. The restaurants are lovely as is the reception area. You cannot beat the location. Its on Dam Square opposite the royal palace. Despite this we did not encounter any problems with noise. The square has a great atmosphere at christmas. The hotel is within a short walking distance of the station, the restaurant area, the vondel park and the red light district. There is also a supermarket nearby (just behind the royal palace). We love amsterdam and would always recommend the grand.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it”
Reviews.Author: cindywashere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Amsterdam, right behind the Dam Square, Kalverstreet, Central Station and Red Light District. The service was excellent, staff friendly and the rooms were clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag...”
Reviews.Author: mikegreen
Reviews.Content: Well...after a rather stressed start to our Christmas break in Amsterdam what with flights being cancelled out of Heathrow & Gatwick (including our own) and having to waste most of Xmas Eve at an airport we arrived early evening at the Krasnapolsky on 24/12/07. Check in was fast and the receptionist plucked room 2002 out of a hat and we headed to the lift. This room is I believe a standard which has windows facing onto the building(s) to the immediate right hand side of the hotel with an alley seperating them. Very impressed with the standard of the room very large bed clean and modern(ish) fixtures and fittings with a minimum amount of "leftovers" from previous, like carpet stains/marks or scuffing around the skirting. Spacious bathroom with power shower in a little cubicle and a bath and large mirrored washbasin area. The only strange thing being that the toilet was seperate from the bathroom in a tiny room of it's own completely tiled in white, not good for the claustraphobics among us! The main blot on our stay was having some money stolen from our room safe...the room contained a safe with a digital lock which we used to stash our passports & money and travel documentation. I had been using it on a daily basis up until the Thursday evening which is when I discovered it unlocked with our valuables scattered around the inside and 100 Euros missing. Now, AFAIK I had locked it that morning (but of course it is possible I just thought I had and it was in fact left open!) either way money had been stolen. I in no way hold the hotel responsible but the reaction of the staff I reported really could not of been more indifferent (receptionist) or more sceptical (the hotel head of security). I got the distinct impression from the head of security that I was lying which made me almost as annoyed as having money stolen. I had to repeat myself over and over in an effort to convince him that we HAD had money stolen and in the end we were advised to claim on our insurance and that he would "look into the matter". No further communication from the hotel staff followed so this in my mind confirms the apathetic attitude I felt initially. Not wishing to have the theft of our money overshadow a well deserved break we decided to cut our losses (in fact we did visit the local police station TWICE in a effort to fill out a crime report but on both ocassions the two different officers could not find a copy of the relevant form in English...doh!) So in summary, a really nice hotel but given it's location I urge fellow guests to LOOK AFTER THEIR VALUABLES!

Reviews.Title: “Great once up-graded!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsH69
Reviews.Content: On arrival the hotel looked very impressive. Our first room (Floor 4 from lift 6) was not exactly what I would call 5* albeit manageable for a 2 night stay. However due to a very noisy party taking place in the main lounge (right outside our window) and several calls to reception later, we were moved in to the Royal Wing to a junior suite. Now this is where 5* begins! The rooms were large and airy, with fab views over the canal. The bathroom was spacious with a great shower/cabin. Also as we were at the very end of the coridoor it was most of all quiet! The food choice for breakfast was fantastic, if you managed a bit of everything you didn't need to eat again till night! The reception desk and concierge were very helpful, although a little popular at times (it did take a while to check out even thought we got to keep our fabulous suite untill 5pm on the Sunday) Overall a lovely hotel in a fantastic location with great staff and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you like to sleep”
Reviews.Author: elpasoed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov 28 for one night. They gave us a decent room near the alleway...but definitely not worth the 200 euros we paid. the only thing that made it bearable is that my company paid the cost. Everything was ok until about 2am when all hell broke loose. from 2am until 5am, there were constant yelling and laughing coming from the alley way. Couldn't sleep at all!! The central location of the hotel means that you will be hearing all the drunk and stoned people coming out the clubs late at night. stay somewhere else not near the Red Light district...everything is close in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly Average - go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: derosa
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively in The Netherlands on business and stay in Amsterdam a lot. I usually stay at the Golden Tulip Hotel in the centre which I have always been happy with. For some reason I recently ended up booking the Krasnapolsky and certainly would not want to stay there again. It is not terrible but it is distinctly average. I had requested a non-smoking room but they tried to allocate me a smoking room and when I said I really would not like this they said the hotel was full etc. Then they "found" a room and the TV did not work. It was not the end of the world but I just wanted a quiet night in so the TV was something I wanted. To cut a long story short it took over an hour and half to try to sort this and they then ended up moving me to another room. The hour and a half wait was prettty poor but what made it frustrating was to keep being told "We are on our way now" which was quite simply just a succession of lies. Not the end of the world but it was at the end of a long day and getting late for dinner. The room was average and certainly not somewhere you would particularly want to go back to. But there was nothing terribly wrong with it except for the drab decor and well-worn bed. The staff did not show any particular interest. At one stage when I was getting a rather poor response I asked for the manager and was told "I am the manager" which I found hard to believe. So my advice would be to go elsewhere as there are plenty of alternatives. It is certainly not worth the money and the staff really do not show much interest at all in really looking after you

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAussieGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during a weekend trip to Amsterdam. We booked the hotel as a top secret deal, so we didnt know where we were staying until after we had paid. Once I found out where we were staying I had a look at the website and thought it looked alright. Then I read some reviews on tripadvisor and got a little worried - there were some scathing reviews! So with much trepidation we arrived at the hotel at 10.30pm on a Friday night to check in. There were no queues, and the reception staff were very nice and helpful, giving us suggestions on places to go out, and answering other questions about the city. We got to our room and it was lovely. It had a recently renovated bathroom, and a huge bed. The bed was admittedly two singles pushed together (or maybe king singles - the bed was massive) but having stayed in many european hotels we have found this to be quite commonplace. The bed was very comfortable and we cherished the extra space!! We didnt have any meals at the hotel, but what we saw of the restaurants and other facilities seemed quite nice. The location of this hotel is possibly its best point - it is right on Dam Square, only about five minutes walk from the main train station, right near tram stops, shopping centres, a block or two from the red light district, coffee shops and bike rental places are in abundance and it is directly across from the Palace and the New Church. Check out wasnt as smooth as check in, not because the staff didnt know what they were doing, but because there were several people queued in front of us who were checking in, and asking a lot of questions. One of the great things about this hotel is that check out on Sundays is automatically extended to 5pm - perfect for weekend trips. Highly recommended hotel, had a fantastic weekend and cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “great location ...poor hotel 3 star at best”
Reviews.Author: ANWAS
Reviews.Content: after staying in the excellent hilton on my previous trip i noticed how the krasnapolsky appeared to have it all , location and looked the part and promised my next trip would be booked there. cost a fortune to book but as it was on dam square expected it to be the best...it was not checking in was a nightmare you are ignored by the army of staff and stand there barging your way through to get attention. rooms were in the back of the hotel a long walk away and it was obvious we had been given the poorer ones so i upgraded to two suites as they advertised on the desk a 50 euro each upgrade , these rooms although called suites are most certainly not they do face onto dam square though (see pictures) location though could not be better and you are in the middle of all the action ! afternoon tea with cream cakes is expensive but very good, breakfast in the large open area was average, ignored by the staff constantly and on one occaission i was embarassed by the lady at the desk as i had booked for both rooms on my amex and we had ordered room service and she stated i must go to reception to have extra credit authorised before we ate breakfast ! which she said in a very loud voice embarassing me and my guests. In closing i would go to the other NS hotel down the road which belongs to the same group looked a lot better of the Botel if you want location at a small cost, its a real rip off here and they take full advantage of the location , its full of dutch on business meetings and the rest of us are treated like the lowest of guests even though we had paid a lot to go, hilton ten times better but far away this hotel is very very average AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Poor Apartment”
Reviews.Author: CaptainCarlPerth
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in Apartment 7305, 1 bedroom with lounge, kitchen, bathroom and laundry plus a small entry. I would rate the apartment 1 star and very hard to find any comfort in this apartment. On Arrival to the hotel I had booked and pre paid for a standard single room, I asked how much to upgrade to an apartment and they said it would be free, that was great. I knew that the stair case was going to be steep so the porter led me to the back of the hotel, down an alley and up the stair case which was like a ladder on a slight angle. The apartment on first view seemed large and I wanted privacy and got it too. I firstly un packed and put on some music but found out the stereo speakers had blown so had to turn it off. The apartment had lots of bits and pieces all arranged in a disorganised way so after a few hours I arranged it to the way I thought would be comfortable. The bedroom had 2 small single beds which are light and cheaply made they did not feel comfortable and I did not use them, the lounge had a pull out sofa bed similer to a futon and I used this bed but it was very hard to put together and everynight fell apart so I never had a good sleep. The kitchen had sufficient cutlery, crockery and cookware to cook basic foods and I cooked each night (suparmarket food in Amsterdam is incredibly cheap and I spend a total of 84 euros for 3 meals a day for 7 days). The fridge is very small so don't buy too much, the oven and hot plates worked well, microwave was fine and good lighting. The lounge has a TV, bookshelf, sofa bed, very large dinner table which takes up most of the space in the lounge, 2 chairs and 2 lounge chairs plus coffee table. It all looks like what you would see in an apartment of young guys who have just moved out of their parents house and have collected bits and pieces and hand me downs, nothing very comfortable or pleasant on the eye. The lounge also has a video player but my one did not work and no one could fix it, they also supply a file with the leaflets of all the appliances in the apartment but as so many of the appliances have been replaced over time the leaflets had not been replaced and are for appliances no longer in the apartment. The cupboard laundry has a washing machine and as savvy as I am with these kinds of appliances and with full instructions I struggled to use it as it i not your normal automatic front loader. After 3 nights in the apartment I started to get ill so I thought I need to give this place a good clean, I pulled the sofa away from the wall in the lounge only to find heaps of rotting food scraps and this is when I realised the apartment was dirty, I stayed ill for most of my time at the hotel. What did work superbly was the mini in room safe. The area around the hotel is awful, I saw so many drug addicts taking hard drugs in every corner of the hotels ally and area that connects the Royal Wing to the Main Hotel, every time I left my apartment to go out I was met with endless amounts of people asking me to buy drugs or promising me to help me find my way or offering info on Amsterdam, I was cleverly taken in by a few of these people as they seem so trustful only to find I was duped and again these are the people that are the drug users. If you are not use to this kind of environment you would just think they are friendly locals helping a tourist. I had breakfast in the hotel and it does cost 25euros but its really good, top quality foods well prepared. I enjoyed having a glass of bubbly in the morning before breakfast. The area that the hotel is located is the Red Light area and its very sleazy, loaded with drug addicts, husslers and all sorts of people hanging around the streets looking to make a quick buck. I spent the balance of my time in Leidersplane and found that the Park Hotel and the Marriot are well located in a more conservative healthy part of town. The stair case to the apartment always smelt of vomit and the apartment comes either cold or hot no in between. I hope my review will help you make an informed decision, I paid Euros 120 per night for this experience. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, convenient!”
Reviews.Author: pytrash
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through priceline, but not through the "name your price", just regular booking. I think I got lucky and catch a good promotion. It was 99 euros per night + 5% tax I believed. The hotel is right at Dam Square, about 10 mins walk from Centraal Station, you can take the tram, but we just walked, there were tons of stores and restaurants along so it was a pleasant walk. The hotel is a few blocks from red light district as well. Tons of restaurants just right next to the hotel, as well as pastry shops for breakfast. We were lucky enough to get a room at the Royal Wing (need to take elevator 6, which is a separate building than the main lobby). The room was completely refurbished obviously not too long ago. It is very modern, nice wood floors, comfortable bed, nice modern bathroom with great amenities. We were there with four other friends, so we had 3 different rooms. 2 of us got rooms at the Royal wing, my friend's room is at the 6th floor (top floor) and it has a balcony as well. Not a lot of view, but it was still nice. However, my other friend got a room in the main building, and it was dated. Still very clean but it's definitely the 70s style. Very spacious room. The check-in and check-out process was quick, we didn't have a long line and it was quick. Overall quite polite but I didn't interact with them too much. We got a free drink coupon as well as a sudoku book since we are new customers. The friend who got the older style room doesn't have it since it's their 2nd time staying at this hotel. They are definitely trying to attract and retain new customers.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator 5”
Reviews.Author: yachtracer
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Krasnapolsky many times in the last few years and sometimes it's been very good and other times very average. There is a big variety in the quality of the rooms, which makes a big difference to your stay. This week it felt like the hotel is rather tired. Of course, the location is great right on Dam Square, 10 minutes walk from Centraal Station, but that's probably it's best feature right now. Arrived at 8PM to face a 15 minutes queue at check in. I had booked a standard room and apparently got the last non-smoking room, accessed from "Elevator 5" ( I think that the rooms in this block are the worst in the hotel). 4th floor room size was small, but OK for the price. However, the room was very tired and smelt of smoke - what some hotels call "classic" or hotel speak for not refurbished for a long time !!). The bathroom was honestly the tiniest I have ever experienced in a hotel. If you are offered this part of the hotel, see if you can change at check in. WI-FI in the room works fine but expensive at â‚¬17 from Swisscom. I didn't bother with breakfast as it's â‚¬25 for a continental and there are plenty of places nearby. The breakfast room is really beautiful though, so if you have the time to enjoy it, why not. There is a coffee bar at the front of the hotel, where you can get a coffee and pastry, but it is tired and soul-less that's why I guess it was empty at 8.30AM ! There are much better NH hotels in Amsterdam, such as the Barbizon Palace, worthy of the 5 stars they claim. In my opinion, the Krasnapolsky is no longer one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Tired of queueing”
Reviews.Author: weaselclaff
Reviews.Content: Room was ok but sheets didn't fit the bed!! Shower was either boiling hot or freezing cold and took about an hour to check out! Apart from that hotel is OK

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: nerv0usflyer
Reviews.Content: It really was fine. We arrived with some trepidation, considering the reviews. But we needed a hotel with a car park hence the reason for booking. The reception was friendly and professional and speedy. The room was BIG with a huge bed. Everything was in order. The concierge whilst helpful wasn't overly friendly but he helped in many ways e.g. where to find a camera shop and where to eat etc etc. He began to recognise us and greeted us with a smile each day. The doormen were unhelpful, it has to be said. We didn't eat here but one morning we did venture into the lounge for coffee and apple strudel - all fine. The cappuccino was the best we found in Amsterdam. Car park is more than ample. We also took our bicycles and the storage facilities for bikes is good. So all in all, it was fine. I would have to agree with the reviews in one respect: I have no idea why this is 5* but perhaps it is trading on past glory. I would say it is a 4*. Socks need pulling up, Krasnapolsky. PS health and safety pointer - do NOT burn yourself on the ludicrously boiling hot water. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Fading fast”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_7
Reviews.Content: With a 5 star rating I was expecting a great experience. The location is wonderful and the staff were friendly but the hotel is a dump. The carpets are worn, paint is obviously old, walls and doors scratched, etc, etc. For 250 euros I got a room that dated to 1950 in its decor and was 5 x 10 feet in size! The breakfast buffet was too expensive for what was offered, costing 25 euros. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great room”
Reviews.Author: KiaOra1
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was concerned about staying at this hotel. This was my third trip to Amsterdam, so I knew the hotel's location was great, but the GH Krasnapolsky sounded somewhat shabby. My friends and I booked through Gate 1, and I must say we had an excellent experience. My room was quite large (I paid an additional amount to have a "superior" standard room) and very comfortable, with windows that overlooked the Dam Square. The bathroom was great, with double sinks, a tub and a separate walk-in shower. The toiletries were very nice and refilled every day. Our breakfast was included, and there was a huge variety and the food was good. The coffee, however, was not up to Amsterdam's usual standard. My friends' standard room was also very nice. I don't know if we were just lucky to get such good rooms, but I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel krasnapolsky”
Reviews.Author: alaberdeen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Hotel Krasnapolsky to celebrate our friends 25th wedding anniversary. Picked the hotel because it was central and it was true to its word - came out of train station and walked straight for about 10 minutes and you are there. Was worried about check in as had read so many bad reviews about this - but checked in about 3pm and with no hassle or queues. We had booked with last minute.com and paid extra to get the best room available - wouldn't waste money again doing this as got standard room with no view in the conference end of hotel - think we would somehow have got this room no matter what. Room nothing fancy - but clean. Didn't spend too much time in it as so much to see and do in Amsterdam. Only complaint we had was the smell when you exited elevator 5 - 2nd floor - the smell in the corridor was horrendous. Luckily smell didn't filter in to our room - and only seemed to be on floor 2. Breakfast dining room looked magnificent - but the price was just too over the top. All in all we really enjoyed our stay for the 3 days and definitely will return to Amsterdam - but probably stay at another hotel in and around the area of the Krasnapolsky now that we know the area and other hotels around it - as it was really central and easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With Our Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: ArubaAmy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amstedam and I really wanted a decent hotel for our 8 night stay. Read all of the reviews and was a little nervous since the reviews were either really good or really bad depending on the type of room you received so I just gritted my teeth and hoped for the best. Had read numerous reports about a busy front desk and not enough help. Yes, it was busy when we checked in on a Friday afternoon but we stood in line patiently as others jumped in front of us. I was a little tired from the flight and annoyed but really it only was about a 15 minute wait until our turn to check in. The people at the front desk were great. They gave us a message right away that we had waiting for us from a friend who lives there and even dialed his number for us right at the front desk so we could call right away. Our room was located in the Royal Wing and we loved it. Very spacious, new furniture, queen size bed, lots of closet space and a HUGE bathroom. We did have to go through a corridor outside using our keycard to get to our room but that didn't bother us. What did bother us was that sometimes it took a few swipes of the keycard to get into our wing. We noticed others having the same problem. No big deal though - we were going to get a new keycard but it seemed to be working better by the end of the week. They also gave us a coupon for 2 free welcome drinks in the bar. The bar also had great service and served a few light bites around happy hour. Included in our hotel package rate was the daily buffet breakfast. I'm not sure how much this costs normally but it was a great buffet. It was held in a beautiful room and had anything and everything you could want for breakfast for both American and European tastes. Also included was unlimited champagne that you just poured yourself - think we had champagne and/or mimosas at every breakfast. We used the concierge once to make a restaurant reservation for us. Turned out that the place we wanted to go to was closed for their vacation so he recommended a different one. It was a great recommendation (we told him what kind of place we were looking for ) - turned out to be our favorite restaurant for the entire trip! Right around the corner about a block away from the hotel is a little champagne/wine bar called Bubbles and Wine. This place had our names written all over it and we were frequent customers during our stay. Great service, great drinks, great appetizers! The location of our hotel was perfect. Had to take the train on a couple of days and it was an easy walk to the train station. Also an easy walk to almost anywhere! All in all, we were very pleased with our hotel choice and with Amsterdam. We saw alot of the city and also ventured out to other towns as well. The people we met during our stay were wonderful - very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “where was the Grand?”
Reviews.Author: larksie
Reviews.Content: This was a highly rated hotel and came recommended by a friend who lived locally. Therefore, I was slightly disappointed when I found me room in a building next door accessed by a corridor crossing an alleyway ... when opening the door, I saw a fair sized room and a huge King size bed, which turned out to be two twins pushed together. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BobD99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Kras on the first night of a two week European business trip in July. I received a great rate via Priceline, but was very apprehensive after reading the inconsistent reviews. My room was small, but clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The location was fantastic and the folks at the front desk spoke good English and were very helpful. I had a nice view toward Centraal Station. I'm going back to A-dam at the end of an upcoming trip in August, and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent experience here...”
Reviews.Author: lindakessler
Reviews.Content: I've just read the most recent reviews and can't understand all the negative comments. We had a beautiful, spacious, very clean room for 159 euros a night. I am quite picky about hotels, especially the cleanliness, and our room and the hallways and lobby were spotless! Our bathroom was large, the towels big and fluffy, the bed linens fresh and comfortable...I called and asked for an extra pillow and it arrived within 15 minutes of my call. There was a lot of storage space for our clothes, a large in-room safe that could accommodate my husband's laptop, and a modern thermostat that controlled our room's temperature nicely. The bathroom was equipped with a basket full of lovely shampoos, lotions, toothbrushes, combs, shower caps, etc. and the bar soap was a delightful orange-scent...very nice! The large cupboard contained a variety of drinking glasses and tea cups along with a water-heating pot with tea, coffee, sugar, etc. There was even a blessed ice machine down the hall--a rare treat in any European hotel. We rented bikes and the hotel staff were very helpful in providing us with a parking ticket that gave us access to the parking structure attached to the hotel so we could lock up our bikes there for no charge. Our two nights at Hotel Krasnapolsky were delightful and I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Karen1981London
Reviews.Content: Just to put you in the picture i am in my mid twentys and i went to amsterdam with my boyfriend for a nice weekend break. Compared to the majority of accommodation in Amsterdam this place was a god-send. It is located right on Dam square which is such a brilliant location to explore the city. - The staff were polite and efficient and the rooms were a nice size and were very clean (i was on the 5th floor - not sure if this makes a difference). They also provided all the essentials in travel size (toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, hairbrush, shaving kit, shampoo, shower gel etc etc) - you dont get all of these in most hotels. Being from the hotel industry myself i can say that this is very satisfactory indeed. Dont book if you are looking for a good 4 star hotel and have high expectations but if you are expecting a mid range 4 star or high end 3 star then this is your place. Amsterdam was brilliant. Reccommendations are: Hire a bike!! This is my top tip. The first day we walked and our feet were killing by the end of it. Hiring a bike allowed us to visit all the sights at ease - and it was lots of fun too!! I reccommend the bike shop in between central staion and Dam sq (if you're at Dam sq and looking in central station direction then its on the right hand side). They charge 7euros per day whereas others we saw were 6 euros for 3 hours. We had the bikes for two days and it was only 13euros BARGIN Vondelpark - beautiful. We only meant to pop in for an hour or so but ended up staying for 5 hours (it was a nice day). Make sure you take your bike! Goucho grill - we had spare ribs and steak - you get as many ribs as you can eat! Lovely food, nice setting! Leidseplein - buzzing atmosphere - good to dine alfresco or have a drink and people watch. Brown Cafe - we went to a cafe called 'Get down to it' - great atmosphere and everything you would expect from a brown cafe in Amsterdam Red Light District - we walked through about 5 times. Definitely an experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Dastonm
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here in late July/Early August 2007. How, why and where this hotel gets its reputation for being a Grand Hotel is beyond me. The carpets are stained and smell through out the hotel - and smell of must and damp. The Bedroom was akin to something you might find in a 2 star hotel in London with old chipped furniture and the saloon style swing-door on the bathroom was cheap beyond belief. My friend found a small cockroach in the closet as we were leaving - which is just as well as had we known about them our stay would have been far more unpleasant than it already was. All in all, a shabby hotel resting on a reputation undoubtably earned many decades ago. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: Leipsuig
Reviews.Content: Definitely not 5*. Worst Hotel I have stayed in. First they tried to book us into a room with a three quarter bed... Then we were moved to a filthy Smoking Room (we requested and confirmed a Non Smoking room before our travels as my wife is asmatic). We were told that it is a "priviledge" to get a non smoking room and not a right by the most incompassionate reception staff I have ever had the digust of meeting. We were moved to a 3rd room the following day. This room was much beter and according to the reseption staff one of the "best" rooms... well if that was the best room a 5* establishment like this can offer I will never book at any of the NH Group of hotels ever again. Oh by the way you can forget to check in at 15:00.. rather aim for 17:00 (this is probably why they have so much seating in the reception area)

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent time, however your results may vary”
Reviews.Author: theanxiousaardvark
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday celebration, the second of two 5-star rated hotels in one weekend in Amsterdam, allowing some interesting comparisons. The good: We booked a superior room, in the Royal Wing. Our room was on the third floor facing Dam Square. The view, location and size of the room were excellent, the furnishings were in very good condition, the bathroom nicely done, with a large tub. The selection of food and wine available for room service was extensive. Not the usual listing of a hideously overpriced cava and one or two overpriced Champagnes, they offered 6 or 7 sparklers, each in varying sizes. The staff. Everyone we dealt with was quite good, even when visibly stressed. (See: The Bad and Summing uo below) The indifferent: The bed. Comfortable enough, but...twin beds latched together? That came apart resulting in her amused investigation and repair? This is not what one expects in a 5-star, especially in a superior room. The bad: Reception area. A swirling pool of chaos. Nice people at reception, trying to help too many people with conflicting requests, with what appeared to be an antiquated registration system. Rooms not ready on time, requiring people to stand in line multiple times. This resulted in long lines and fraying tempers. This wasn't an issue for us, however the tension was papable. Summing up: To be very clear, many of the complaints, and problems we overheard appeared to be self-induced, with people attempting to extend reservations after checkout time; staying past checkout, resulting in delays; attempting to haggle rates, upgrades and prices at the counter; and large tour groups and meeting organizers hosted with their own issues. We'll go back for a special occasion. We live in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “give it a try if you can get a cheap deal”
Reviews.Author: janiebubble
Reviews.Content: we booked on priceline, then were really worried when we read the reviews here ... but ... we'd only paid Â£66 a night which is a fraction of the rack rate and couldn't cancel!! It was fine, yes there are a lot of tour parties there, yes the breakfast is expensive, yes its not ultra modern chic. BUT ... the room was huge, air con was ok, we had a room at the back looking out onto a quiet courtyard with the largest opening window i've seen in a hotel. The red light district didn't bother us, the staff were helpful and friendly, and the location great. I wouldn't pay the rack rate, but for less than most of the budget hotels on expedia and the like it was a good deal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: SneakySnufflez
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky is a lovely hotel if you are willing to pay extra for one of the best rooms in the place, otherwise you won't be very happy. I've stayed at this hotel twice so far, more so because my friend likes it and books it, mainly because it is 5 star, but other than that, the staff are very helpful when it comes to helping you with your bags, and getting you a taxi.
