The rooms are quite nice too, but the bathrooms are tiny, and some of the rooms have a bathroom where the door isn't even a proper door and there is a split down the middle, so god forebid if someone walks past while you are using the bathroom. the bar in the hotel is very expensive, and some of the drinks aren't even very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated and over priced”
Reviews.Author: tjjism
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. I can't believe it is rated 4 stars! Our room was old and dingy with nasty carpeting and broken down stained furniture. We were in a newer wing of the hotel that was probably built in the '60's or '70's but this room would be what you expect in a $50 a night motel in the US. Maybe the old wing is nicer? Besides the quality of the room, the staff was not friendly or helpful. The common areas were packed with attendees at two different conferences that were being held there as well as a number of tour groups that were being dropped off by bus. I assume these groups were getting BIG discounts compared to the $249 euro I was paying. The only thing good about this hotel was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we got it at a reduced rate!”
Reviews.Author: mariruthl
Reviews.Content: We booked a package literally at the last minute through lastminute.com, so we paid a fraction of what the rack rate for this hotel is. I'm glad we didn't pay full price, as it is certainly not a 5 star hotel. I think it is in various stages of renovation - the common areas need more refurbishment, and although our room furniture was nice (the pillows were great but the bed was pretty hard) the bathroom was awful - complete with MDF doors for the toilet and shower (which leaked everywhere) and plastic tiling on the ceiling. The hot water knobs become very hot - to the point of burning when touched. The breakfast which is served in the Winter Garden was good - huge variety and a great setting. Every hotel breakfast is over priced, but 25 euros didn't seem too bad for the choice and quantity. We didn't have to eat lunch! The location, as others have mentioned, is very central. We didn't experience noise problems because we were tucked away in the middle of the hotel (overlooking mechanical equipment on the roof below). It was a very busy area at night though. If we return to Amsterdam I think we would stay closer to the Museum Quarter - where it is less busy and more scenic. From Dam Square it was a 25 minute walk to the Van Gogh museum. The trams seemed perpetually crowded and it was much easier to walk. We purchased the "I amsterdam" card for 48 hours on our arrival (at the tourist bureau at the airport) and it was well worth it!! We visited 10 sites for essentially half of what the normal admission would have cost us. The only site we visited not included in the card was the Anne Frank House. We really enjoyed our visit to Amsterdam, but recommend this hotel only if it is part of a reduced rate package deal, as you're not paying for anything close to 5 star accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMDMPH
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location, right in dam square. Check in was efficient and fast. We were given a room in the royal wing, which was supposedly the new part of the hotel (an adjacent building). We had to cross through a clean well lit covered "alleyway" to get to our room. The security card readers had a lot of trouble reading the key cards to get throught the "alleyway". You have to swipe it at least 5 times. Saw other hotel patrons do this. Rooms were average, but my bathroom was NICE. It was bigger than my bedroom in NYC. Clean. Nice toiletries. The faucets were really cheap. I burned my finger (with a blister) trying to turn off the water. The hot water knob heats up dangerously hot. You must use a hand towel to turn it off. The bed was really lumpy and old. The first night I had back pain from sleeping on it so I made my husband switch sides. They did not have an iron or ironing board. They have an electronically sensed refrigerator in the room. When we arrived in our room, we noticed that a bottle was missing from our refrigerator. The next day it was replaced. I'm hoping that they didn't charge me for whatever the prior visitor used. Internet cost 25 euros per day. We went to a local internet cafe and paid 2 euros for 1 hour, valid for 48 hours. Breakfast was served in the Wintergarden. Very nice selection but often ran out of pastries, hot milk, and hot cocoa. They did offer champagne with the breakfast but it tasted like vinegar with bubbles. This hotel is located 1 block from the beginning of the red light district. There was a lot of noise from people partying at night. Trams were located in dam square, a several feet away. I would recommend this place because of the location but only if you can get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Choice”
Reviews.Author: manlaw
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Nh Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky and was very impressed. Iâ€™ve stayed at a few other hotels in Amsterdam before and I must admit this was the best. The location is ideal, right smack dab in the middle of the city close to virtually everything. The hotel lobby is gorgeous and check-in/out was relatively smooth. My room was very nice, spacious with a large King sized bed. Didnâ€™t have much a view tho. DÃ©cor was suitable, sort of quaint. Bathroom was large with a big tub. They even provide complimentary bath robe and slippers. The room safety deposit box is computerized and very easy/convenient to use. They have cable television however most of the channels offered are pay-tv and they only have 1 free channel in English. Contrary to other reviews, street noise wasnâ€™t a problem at all. They do lock the main door at 1 am and you have to show your room card to get buzzed in which was a little annoying but really not a problem. The only thing I noticed that could use some improvement was the maid service. Got the feeling that they were in a rush sometimes (if you know what I mean) but everything else was fine. I highly recommend this hotel for tourists and business travelers looking for quality in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Smilesx
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here as a last minute a few days ago, due to booking last minute we really did not expect much, but on first arrival and walking for approx 10 minutes we arrived at Dam Square, and to this beautiful hotel, firstly someone helps you with your bags, the staff really are truely wonderful and helpful, really nothing was to much trouble. After checking in at reception two hours early Semra (whom really is an asset to the company) informed us that we had in fact been up-graded to the Royal Wing, we really could not believe our luck! On arriving at our room, the room was totally breath taking due to being a special occasion for us both, the hotel had arranged fresh flowers in our room, and rose petals in our bath (maybe a girl thing)! We really could not of asked for a better room, on returning later that afternoon we came back to a bottle of wine and fresh fruit, this hotel was truely outstanding. The bed was just so comfortable, ideal after all the walking, and the shower was one of the best we had known, and in the past we have travelled to a few places, for us this really was 5*.. Thank you to all the staff especially Semra whom made our stay truely memorable, and one we will never forget, the hotel really is in the heart of Amsterdam ideal for all Amsterdam has to offer.... PERFECT!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel for tourists”
Reviews.Author: gjn75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great situation, right on dam square, short walk from centraal station etc. Our room was small, dark, had peeling wallpaper and was in need of complete redecoration. For â‚¬200 a night i expected a little more. There are so many better hotels in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel right on Dam square”
Reviews.Author: angelee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for about 5 days in Febuary. The hotel is right on Dam Square so close to the red light district and everything... The room, service and food was absolutly peferct... the only little thing though i found it beautiful...was that i could easily see my boyfriends point of view that for us it was a bit old fashioned looking.. for example the decoration and furnishings in the room were really old styled and could be made slightly more up to date looking...

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birdy21
Reviews.Content: This was the third time staying at the Krasnapolsky. It is a fine hotel. Always clean. The staff is efficient if not overly friendly. Rooms are big enough and well appointed. The location is terrific for tourists and biz alike. Only complaint is that the 5 star price delivers a4 star hotel. However, you won't have to worry about one of those miserable hotel stays.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary hotel, ordinary service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Gustofers_travels
Reviews.Content: Had to stay there for a conference. I think they get a lot of their business via conferences so they don't seem to really care how they treat you. Certainly not 5 star service, with reception staff quite rude and the term concierge is being applied quite liberally here. No baggage service, no calling of taxi's for guests, breakfast extremely expensive......would not stay again unless someone else paying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Majmacc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights before taking a canal cruise through Netherlands and Belgium. By booking through Continental Air Lines, our room was about $200 per night (without breakfast: 25 euros p.p. was outrageous). The room 506 was on the top floor overlooking a court yard and the city sky line. It was quiet, comfortable and what I expect from a 5-star hotel in Europe. The main bar was excellent and the fitness center was well maintained. I would stay here again in a minute, as long as the price was about the same (It's probably NOT a $400 a night property.)

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel lacking character- 5 star rating a stretch”
Reviews.Author: boston8368
Reviews.Content: I have ended up at the Krasnapolsky on three different occassions, and each time has been a completely different experience. On the first trip, 5 years ago, I was in an executive room which was acceptable and clean. Last year, however, I was in a standard room which was really quite grim- a walk in shower, folding bathroom door, and dated, tattered linens and decor. I had vowed never to stay again, but because my most recent trip was spontaineous, it was the only central hotel with availability, so I booked the executive room to be on the safe side...The room which was said to be in the newly refurbished "royal wing" was very basic and was certainly not like any other 5 star hotel I've ever stayed in. When we asked to upgrade further, the staff insisted that we were in the nicest possible area of the hotel...The inconsistency probably lies in the size of the hotel- it is really massive. Despite the disappointment in the rooms, the staff are lovely and friendly and the service has been fine...It's suitable for a business traveler, but not especially comfortable for a romantic weekend or family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, NOT 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: Penelope111254
Reviews.Content: We were bitterly dissapointed with this 5 star hotel....On arrival and departure we received no assistance with our luggage, we had to cart our suitcases through the lobby, down a long corridore and locate the lift by the entrance of the car park ! which one wouldn't expect from a 5 star hotel. I would rate it a below average 4 star Our room was clean, but very dissapointing. On the plus side... the hotel is very central. I wouldn't recomend this hotel, and we certainly won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Excellent, A++”
Reviews.Author: bonbon05
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam & I felt I had to write a review about a fabulous hotel & an amazing city. I was slightly wary after reading some of the reviews about this hotel but I found the staff charming, the hotel immaculate & the rooms although maybe note quite 5 star, definately 4 star & very comfortable. We booked with breakfast included & I am so happy that we did. The food was amazing ranging from cereal to eggs & bacon to waffles, fruit, bread, fish & plenty of bucks fizz.... It really allowed us to go out for the day without needing to stop for anything more than a snack. Amsterdam itself is the most amazing city I have ever been to. It is mad, full of push-bikes & trams but so quaint, picturesque & cosmopolitan that we were sad to be coming home!! We walked & walked throughout the whole area & I have to admit for location this hotel cannot be beaten. right on dam square it really is in the heart of everything. Food is gorgeous, the only problem seemed to be choosing where to eat as there really is an enormous ammount of choice. The nightlife is brilliant too. We did venture into the 'red-light' district out of curiosity & although it was busy it was still an interesting place to see & an absolute must even if you just go once. I cannot praise the hotel & the city enough & cannot wait to go back although would probably pick a cheaper hotel as bar sleeping in it we were out continually.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room...shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: Ray07
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam as a treat from my partner just before Christmas. We stayed at the Grand because it IS soo convinent right in front of Dam Square. And very easy to walk to from the Train Station. We were given a big room that face the side street off Dam Sqaure. The room is spacious & comfirtable. Reasonable modern deco (but don't expect chic Minmalist deco) thick velvet curtains & nice King Size Bed.....with a pair of complimentry ear plug on the pillow. That was suspicious & sure enough when we came back late in the night. The noise on the street are unbearable. The window turn out to be single glazed with some ventilation grilles. Unfortunately the room face onto the road leading to the Red Light District. So the merry o' sound of drunken party goers lasted all night. Mind you the hotel was very accomodating (they obviously expected it) and allow us to switch room to one facing the rear looking out onto back yard. Although the room was smaller & now a Queen size bed with no view. It was much quieter & we settle down for nice sleep the next night. The Winter Garden only do Breakfast & it close quite early for Amsterdam (10am I believe) so we did not manage to catch it as late risers. But there are plenty of nice cafe around the area. We enjoyed the Cafe next to the old church which is now Amsterdam Museum. We had fun when they had a fire drill & locked all the clientel inside the cafe, while the staff run around like headless chicken. Do be careful when walking on the pavement in Amsterdam. They have complicated designated cycle path & the locals bomb along these with little or no consideration for the pedestrian (may be only tourist walk in this city, & they deserve to be run down?) My partner happen to be hit by 1 of these maniac & he just dust himself off & got on the bike & went right away. Not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: MissJA
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a weekend away in Amsterdam. We selected the Grand Kransnapolsky because it had an excellent location in the centre of town. The hotel itself was lovely, however, upon check in they asked for a credit card as a guarantee - which is normal practice in hotels. The hotel then took an authorisation for 700E from my account which means that they hold the funds incase you want to charge to your room. Normally hotels will take the equivalent of the first night's accommodation which would be Â£150 and many of them only check the funds are there they don't proceed to hold them. Due to the fact no one had told me that they were doing this I was unable to access any funds during my stay as they had charged Â£300 for my room and on top of that held the 700E totally alomst Â£900. As I was unaware that they would do this I thought that someone was fraudulantly using my bank card so I cancelled it and reported it to my bank. So please beware and find out what amount of money they are going to take out of your account. Personally I think holding Â£700 - Â£500 incase we wanted to charge to our room was excessive.

Reviews.Title: “krappy krasnopolsky”
Reviews.Author: tomandjean
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ABSOLUTELY not five star.The lobby and dining areas are above average but the bedrooms.are way too small,virtually no closet space,and what's up with those heating pipes banging and groaning all night long.Good thing we brought ear plugs....Great location but not enough to sell me for our next trip to beautiful Amsterdam........

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but needs some attention”
Reviews.Author: brooklyncouple
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to the NH-K after our reserved room at the NH Schiller turned out to be non-existent due to hotel renovations. The Schiller paid for our cab for the short ride to the NH-K, which is very centrally located on Dam Square. You're just a short (5 min) walk from the Western Canal Belt and the Red Light District (which is actually located along 2 incredibly pretty canals) is literally behind the hotel. We were put into the "new" wing of the hotel, which is located behind the main hotel, which fronts onto Dam Square. The new wing seems to date from the 80s. The furniture in the rooms seemed to be a mid-90's attempt at a boutique hotel look. Things were all in good repair and the bed was comfy, but the furniture is a bit dated and looked a bit worn. Our view was of the hotel courtyard, which means we were looking at some back walls and mechanical equipment. The room was quite large (I had primed myself for the typical small European room) and very quiet. No complaints at all on that front. In summary: if you're looking for charm, look elsewhere. If you're looking for a decent, comfortable, central hotel, this may be a good bet. I wouldn't stay again, as I prefer hotels with a bit more character.

Reviews.Title: “rooms basic & dismal”
Reviews.Author: cazi
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at this hotel supposed to be a 5 star not in my opinion...we got a room for Â£175 euro per night thought breakfast would be included for this price but it was not asked how much breakfast was and they wanted another 25 euros per person per night...the room was at the back of the hotel and quite a walk away from the reception..and were noisey because of water/heating pipes banging all through the night very smokey lobby.we stayed twice before the The Grand Sofitel and it knocks the spots of this hotel ..no intention of every staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Krasnapolsky”
Reviews.Author: Prefer5star
Reviews.Content: The Krasnapolsky was touted as a 5-star hotel but it is anything but. Many of the rooms in the main hotel are small and outdated. We stayed in the newer rooms, but you have to leave the hotel and go through an alley to enter the building with the newer rooms. Some unsavory people hang out in this alley. It was overpriced for the experience. The concierge was extremely rude to us and the hotel lobby is always crowded and full of smoke (from all kinds of things). If you have the resources, I suggest the Intercontinental Amstel. It is a bit off the beaten path but it is a haven with the most pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Grand Krasnapolsky”
Reviews.Author: AmsterDaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four wonderful nights staying in an executive room. We have stayed at five of the five star hotels in Amsterdam and this just about comes top of our list all things taken into account. We ate in the Reflect restaurant a couple of times, which was expensive, but well worth every penny. Breakfast was excellent, the only trouble here was that the staff were a little too keen to clear the tables (on one occasion I lifted a roll to take a bite and the plate was whipped away before I could empty my mouth to call her back)! I would wholeheartedly recommend the Krasnapolsky to anyone, but please remember we stayed in an executive room, I can't make comment regards the basic business rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a five star”
Reviews.Author: MaryCork
Reviews.Content: Whereas it was clean, modern, there wasnt really much in the way of friendliness or service. The lobby was lovely, and the location was perfect for access to city and country excursions. Good restaurants and bars all around too. The Winter Garden restaurant was fantastic and you should visit it even if you dont stay in the hotel. We would probably stay there again if in Amsterdam but only because we heard that lesser star ratings can be awful in that city. We really enjoyed our time in Holland but we were disappointed with the litter in the city. The fries in a cone were gorgeous. A local 'delicacy'.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Joint”
Reviews.Author: A2TMFK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just the one night, (28/12/06) managed to book this hotel for one night, room only for Â£75. It is well worth looking around for the deals, [----] and [----] are two of the best I have used in the past for Amsterdam trips. I did not give this hotel 10/10 as the one complaint i had was that the room (4081) was not that well sound proofed, so without the ear plugs, you might be awoken by someone closing their room door in the early hours. I doubt you will find a better location for exploring Amsterdam, right on Dam Square. Staff very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but do not pay 5-star rates”
Reviews.Author: knaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH-K a couple of years ago and overall we were very pleased since we got it on the cheap through a travel agent. But if you are looking for cutting edge decor, an elegantly aged hotel or any other wow factor this is not the place. Having said that the location is fantastic for tourists (although I personally prefer the Jordaan) and so is their breakfast spread. The rooms are spacious by European standards and everything was in good working order.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING. Definately NOT worth a five star rating.”
Reviews.Author: diegomh
Reviews.Content: Dear Hotel Seekers in Amsterdam. A note of WARNING! Please note that the Krasnapolsky does not meet the required standard of five stars! Hence lower your standards if you are prepared the pay the overpriced amounts charged by this far below ''five star'' standard hotel. I stayed in an executive room in the royal wing despite my suspicions after seeying all the varied reviews on different websites (should have been a warning already!!!). This leads me to the first and only advantage over other five stars in Amsterdam - it's location and the only reason I went forward with my reservation. Here's the horror in a nutshell. -incredibly slow reception. honestly, only two receptionists for a hotel this size. what are you thinking? you could see the build up anger/ frustrations of everyone waiting in 2 queues of minimum 5 people (and more during checkout times!!!) - non smoking room. nonetheless the room stank of smoke and there were cigarette burn marks in the curtains and night stands!!! - the exec room wasn't sound proof at all. I was woken up by someone elses wake up call. had to get up myself at 5 AM walk into the already vacant room and switch it off myself!!! To illustrate the noise levels even further I could hear other peoples conversations in the corridors word for word!!! - the exec room is thus far from the main hotel that any ''hot'' food from 24h room service is served cold. as was my experience with the bltc sandwich and margarita pizza! - the alley between the hotel and the royal wing is often visited by drugdealers and or youths smoking drugs. o.k. it's Amsterdam but single females, older people could feel threatened. - prostitutes tend to visit this hotel. coming back one night and going up in the elevator a ''lady of the night'' offered me her services! could not believe it!!! after declining kindly she asked me whether I could buzz her out since the door is key activated. obviously she did not have one!!! - it's design has been radically changed the last 4/5 years. the winter garden is beautiful but the rest of the hotel lacks in design and luxury. Most certainly not the interioir one would expect from a five star hotel! It has been downgraded to an unoriginal and plain ''modern'' design which is a shame considering the hotel history. - the standard rooms are quite cheap but attract all kinds of riff raff. definately not the kind of people one would expect in a luxury hotel. please don't get me wrong im really open minded but this is simply an observation. - the products offered in the bath room were very cheap and horrible. really I do not want to use shampoo that leaves me smelling like an orange or a yelly bean!!! - frankly you cannot charge 254 euros nighly for the exec room and have all the above happening to you. All in all. Please take my advise and stay away from this hotel. I'm a Dutch citizen living in London and a fond lover of hotels. I most definately do not hold a grudge although I should after experiencing the above!!! There are much much nicer hotel in Amsterdam along the grachten/canals that are worthy of their 4 and 5 star rating!! Krasnapolski...i'm sorry you should only have four minus!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: falling-star
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend break with some friends. Location was perfect, all toursit attractions in easy walking distance and easy to find from the train station. Did not have breakfast in the hotel as on the pricy side, would recommend cafe directly opposite the hotel on the damrak, better value for money. High tea in the hotel was great, sat looking out over Dam Square while recharging our batteries. The rooms were clean and spacious (there was plenty of room for the 3 of us). Rooms were cleaned everyday, with clean towels left. Check in was quick and efficient, staff at reception were excellent and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel has a lovely bar but as you would expect extremely expensive, acted as a good meeting place but would not stay for longer than one drink. The only negative being the noise late at night, but the price you pay for such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lon101
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a recent business trip. The location was great only a short walk from the Central Station and easy access to Amsterdam attractions. However this is not a 5 star hotel, in reality it is a very tired 4 star hotel. My room was small and in dire need of updating. I was on the 5th floor, which was accessed via one lift that seemed to be hidden away in the back part of the hotel. Despite the higher floor I was still left a note from the hotel management with ear plugs to block out the noise from Dam Square, when I actually needed them to block out the very loud and very awful music that was piped throughout the hotel corridors. Looking out my window I had a perfect view into some apartments opposite, which meant I had to keep my blinds closed at all times for privacy. The bathroom had seen better days and the hairdryer was in shreds and unusable. However when I called the front desk I was brought one within five minutes. Overall the staff are very friendly and helpful but the rooms are in need of updating. The hotel needs to downgrade its star rating or else they will have many dissapointed guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meridian35
Reviews.Content: Cant fault the location, have stayed here several times, always had really spacious room overlooking the royal palace. Breakfast is very american but everything there you could ever desire.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Weekend_getaways
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights whilst on business in Amsterdam. Whilst not being a five star hotel it was fine as a business hotel with larger than average rooms and a good breakfast. It is also well located and on arriving back in the evening it was easy to walk and find a selection of good resteraunts near by. I also needed an iron and board bringing to the room, and they arrived within 5 minutes of asking for them . My room service breakfast was also on time and served with a smile ( at 6:00 a.m. ). I also have to say that the concierge staff were extremely nice and helpful and not at all snotty like you often find at 'top' hotels. I would stay here again, and if you are booked in on business or as part of a tour it is fine. However if I was given a free choice of all the hotels in Amsterdam I think you could find better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: John_Lewis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky at the end of August and start of September for 4 nights with my girlfriend. It is a nice hotel, very opulent on pictures you see on the Internet but fairly run-of-the-mill inside. The room was nice and comfortable, and had a big bed. The bathroom wasn't that great- the decor in it was a bit odd and so were the double-opening doors to it. Basically though we had no problems in this hotel, but it was expensive, due to its Dam Square location. I think this is the key thing, if you like being in the centre of the 'action' this is the place to say. Personally I didn't like having to fight my way through crowds every time I left the hotel and having to have the window shut at night even on the 4th floor because of the noise from the clubs below. I think the NH City Centre is probably in a better location, but as I say, that is purely for my tastes. One other thing - this is a 4 star hotel, not a 5, whatever the website might say. It's nice, but is well lacking of the sort of facilities you would expect in a proper 5 star (ie nice bathroom for starters).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ChuckaDuck
Reviews.Content: I found the central location of this hotel to be perfect. The tram stop was in front of Dam Square and there were always taxis queued in front. The restaurant was very good and the overall staff of the hotel was very pleasant. Having stayed at the Hotel del Europe down the street twice, I found this at half the price to be just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could do better”
Reviews.Author: Dean2468
Reviews.Content: I came to the Krasnapolsky with my wife Jessica to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. The good points of the hotel are that the room size was generous by European standards, there was plenty of storage space in the room, there was a separate bath and shower in the ensuite bathroom and the proximity to the Central station , trams, bars, restaurants and shopping precincts. Also the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. In addition to this, the view overlooking Dam square was special and the breakfast in the Winter room was fantastic. Of course at â‚¬ 24 per head, it's not cheap, so Jess and I had our first breakfast there and spent the other mornings at one of the many places that sell a good breakfast. The bad points of the hotel are that even on the fourth floor, noise from Dam square could clearly be heard in our room at about 6.00 am. Also, on our first night we lost electricity in our room after switching on the kettle. This ties in what others have said about the hotel needing refurbishment. But on the plus side, the kettle was replaced quickly and without fuss. I agree with what others have said in that this is not a five star hotel. In order to achieve this status, the hotel needs to add extra value. These would be perhaps bathrobes, branded toiletries and free shuttlebus to the airport. At the moment this is â‚¬12 per person. Overall Jess and I enjoyed our stay here because thanks to the reviews here we knew what to expect. If you want a peaceful stay in Amsterdam, go to a remote hotel. If you want a decent hotel in the heart of Amsterdam then enjoy your stay at the Krasnapolsky.

Reviews.Title: “Krasnapolsky was fine with us!”
Reviews.Author: emmajane7
Reviews.Content: We were at a conference that was held at the Grand Hotel Amsterdam, but we were put up at the Krasnapolsky. After looking at some of the comments on this website, we were a bit apprehensive, but everything was just fine. We arrived early in the morning, having requested a non-smoking room. No non-smoking roons were available, but as recompense, we were upgraded to a spacious executive room in the 'royal wing', which may be a bit newer than the main section. I'm very sensitive to smoke odors, and I was NOT bothered by any odor in our room. We were on the second floor, overlooking Damstraat (very busy street) and were not bothered by noise as long as we kept our window shut. Location was perfect for exploring the city; Dam Square is not so lovely, but walk a few blocks away from the bustle, and you're in a lovely area. Front desk often harried but helpful enough. A/C was adequate; perhaps it does not dehumidify too well, but it does cool. The humidity may account for the slight musty odor from time to time. We'd stay there again, if the price were right. Certainly just fine for staying on OPM (other people's money)!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: Spencertraveller
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awful. Everything that everyone has writen here is so true & happened to me. My reservation was for the new Movenpick Hotel but it did not open on time. Was sent here and given a lovely upgrade to the ROYAL WING! Felt so good after a long flight... it takes 10 minutes to get there you pass through so many doors one could get lost. Then like everyone else the door key does not work and the so called 5 star royal wing does not even have a bathrobe. Nice big bed I must say for Amsterdam. The service here is teriible like 98% of Amsterdam. Just awful and the front staf are the worst. 2 people checking out 16 people at peak time with so many people walking around its absolutely bizarre. Breakfast @ EUR24 was a rip off - Cheap Champagne, watered down Orange Juice and then we discovered this so call 5 star hotel caters to Cruise Ships and Celebrity Cruise at that! You can do much better in amsterdam for Hotel. Save your MONEY!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: spunky181195
Reviews.Content: i had the worst stay ever in this hotel. i had planed a relaxing 10 day vacation with one of my friends and when i got to the hotel they needed my credit card just to confirm the room is what they told me but no they charged 1500 euro to my card and that put a block on my card for 10 days to wait for the authorization and by the time i left today ...yes that is today they still had not figured it out and told me that i could not leave until the bill was resolved.. all in all bad room service bad,customer service bad , and everything was overpriced i paid 15 euro for a pot of water and 1 tea bag ...not good so i would not suggest to stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: vermeer
Reviews.Content: You can't fault the position of the Krasnapolsky, it's right on Dam Square. The facilitiesare in the main very good and the staff are very pleasant and helpful. However this is a very large and busy hotel. There are permanent queues for reception and the concierge. The place is obviously on the list for tour groups and the reception resembled a refugee camp for the entire duration of our stay loads of piles of luggage and people killing time waiting for their coach to arrive. Our room was well fitted out. It has a separate bathroom and toilet which has it's benefits but makes both facilities rather small. The hotel is so large that it was a 5 minute route march from the room to the lobby. We had to use elevator number 5 which is right at the back near the car park entrance. One staff member cheerfully told us that the elevator was so old it broke down frequently. He was right. When we checked out we had to carry our heavy suitcase and try to find another lift. There was also some problem with the room keys. They didn't work and we changed then 3 times. They still didn't work! All in all if you are looking for a bit of luxury you can do better in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, but several items were stolen from our room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam after a nine-hour flight from Seattle, and dragged our bags from the train station to the hotel. Since we were way too early to check in to our rooms we checked our bags with the hotel and toured the city (canal boat). The person who handled our check in was very nice and upgraded our room and offered suggestions on what to see during our brief stay. Our rooms (one for the parents and one for 18 and 21 year old sons) were nicely furnished, a bit small, but that's how it is in Europe. We had a king sized bed and the boys had twins. Our bathroom was huge, the boys was what you'd expect. . In the mornings we got coissants and coffee for no charge in the casual dining area on the first floor and took them back to our room to eat. We didn't eat in the famous restaurant, but did enjoy the bar where I actually had a glass of good chardonney, something that was hard to get in Holland. The hotel is situated right across the street from Dam Square and a short walk to everything. Once you get your barings you'll have no trouble walking nearly all over Amsterdam, which is really easy to get around in. The tram is just a block away, as well. The only negative thing I would say about the GK is that while on the train from Amsterdam to Leiden my younger son realized his I-pod and headphones were gone from his bag, and my older son realized he'd left his sunglasses in the room. Needless to say, neiher item was recovered. I don't remember if there was a safe in the room, but if there is one, put your valuables in it. We would definately stay at the GK again. It was much nicer than the other NH hotel we stayed in on our trip back through Amsterdam, the NH Amsterdam Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashaghedia
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Krasnapolsky on a weekend break to Amsterdam. Althought it definitely is not what I would call five star (more like a three-four star) it was very clean and comfortable and the staff were very pleasant. The Lounge restaurant was fantastic- great food and service. Although they seemed understaffed in the restaurant, it was worth the wait because the food was so delicious. The wine was also great. Location is great for easy access to all the coffee shops and local attractions. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: jujubee72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights. The location is fantastic (right on the edge of the red light district, in the center of town). I found the staff helpful but not overly friendly. The room was adequate and comfortable. Probably not worth the luxury price tag, but still a beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: cheung8
Reviews.Content: I utilzed this hotel for business puposes & everbody who knows Amsterdam informed me this is one of the better hotels in the city , I hope this is not true. I would have rated it a poor 3 stars.The only positive was the location which is very convenient if not the most scenic i.e. no canal view.I requested an early check in and the reception tried to be helpful but after three estimates 'the room will be ready in 1/2 an hour' I eventually returned after a 6 hour meeting to the answer the 'room will be ready in 1/2 an hour'. The room was very small & dark with a bed suitable only for a child although the reception did accomodate me with a change of room . the new room was passable, one of my travelling partner's room was even suppiled with complementary ear plugs as it faced onto the square with all its bars. The overall decor needs updating one positive the conciege was very helpful though. Ultimately if you can get a good rate this may be passable for business or a 'lads weekend' but I wouldn't recommend for a family or luxury break with your significant other.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very flash in places, couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: bristol_traveller_06
Reviews.Content: This is a very flash hotel in Amsterdam right near Dam Square. I was there on business for a conference which was also held at the hotel. The rooms are good, though the doors to the bathroom do not close fully which I found a bit annoying but got used to. The hotel itself is very nice, the main restaurant is quite an incredible sight, huge with a chequred floor and the breakfast buffet was FANTASTIC, absolutely loved it. The conference held there was very professionally run. We initially had some problems sorting out our internet connection but it was up and running in time. I woudl recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4*”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I rate this hotel average. I have just returned from a business trip having been booked into a small room that only had a shower on the 4th floor and a view of a wall!. It was clean and the staff friendly / helpful. There were more grander rooms as a premium but I'm told they are noisy as they face Dam Square. I was happier having a quieter room at the back. The breakfasts are good but never ate there for any other meals so couldnt comment. On the plus side Amsterdam is a lovely city and this hotel is in the middle of everything - you can walk to practically all the tourist places and some nice restuarants. All in all an enjoayble trip but if I went to Amsterdam again I ouldnt pay the prices they charge at this hotel - definately not a 4* hotel but 4* prices!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent, first class, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DivineDonald
Reviews.Content: Five stars, with the best food in Amsterdam. We stayed here twice after a trip to Brugge. First class. Serious amenities. Great service. Rooms were clean, updated with great views. Stayed with a friend and we both enjoyed it immensely. He is very fussy and loved it. Close to everything. Location, location, location. No complaints except for the high price of the parking garage. Avoid that! I am surprised that this is not number one on TripAdvisor. We had no problems and loved it all. Email access at the business center. Staff was very professional. This place is grand. It fit our American standards and then some. Quiet, clean, luxurious, centrally located. Fabulous food. Grand decor. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “return every year”
Reviews.Author: VERTEX
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times over the last 3 Christmases and enjoyed each stay in 3 totally different rooms. Love the location, easy to walk to anywhere and close to some wonderful restaurants and bars. Bar in the hotel is expensive but what hotel bar isn't? and we have paid more for a drink in the Waldorf Astoria New York....I smoke so I can't say that the cigarette smoking bothered me, however, I do think that if you are particularly anti-smoking then Amsterdam (and similarly Prague) are not the cities for you, there are many, many other cities you can go to in this world where it is banned totally.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a five star hotel! It is a tired, run down dump. Quality of finishes, fittings and furniture is of a Travel Lodge in the UK......which is a very tight budget hotel. Public areas are very grubby and needing paint, new carpet and general good cleaning......we faced a long queue at check in but only one person working. Room seemed unfinished, but to be fair, both room and bathroom were clean. Location right in the centre of tourist tat, kebab shops and pizza joints....but only a short walk to real Amsterdam. Would NOT stay here again. Ever!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 17th & 18th March 06. Our room was adequate, having a third bed. There were plenty of towels, the toiletries provided were nicely packaged and plentiful. The bathroom was small but very clean. The hi-light of the hotel for us was Breakfast in the Winter Gardens - a fabulous room. There was just about anything you could wish for for breakfast and we were able to take our time whilst staff cleared away and topped up tea and coffee quietly around us. To get your monies worth meant that we didnt feel like eating until well into the afternoon! For anyone preferring a light breakfast in the hotel I would advise taking room service as there is only one charge if you choose to take Breakfast in the Winter Gardens. Sadly we never managed to take Afternoon Tea in the lobby, but the cakes on offer looked fantastic. The hotel is well placed to discover Amsterdam with plenty of small restaurents close by. It is easy to locate if you choose to walk from Centraal Station which we did. We would stay at this hotel again and have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: herbsUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our wedding anniversary. I booked two months in advance and requested a room with a view. We did not get a view unfortunately however we were upgraded to an executive room which was really great, lovely clean room with everything in that we might need - even bath robes and slippers! The hallways smelt musty and the decor in the main part of the hotel does need updating.The bar prices and hotel restaurant are all quite expensive but then that is to be expected in a four star hotel in the centre of a european city. I think this hotel is supposed to be a five star but I don't feel that it is. The facilities are really good but it is missing the luxury feel of a five star hotel. As other reviews have stated the hotel does need some redecoration and the bedding and curtains could do with a splash of colour. That said the room was really nice and clean, the staff friendly and helpful, the in room safe was free and there was also free tea/coffee in our room. All in all we had a great time here and would come again - that is when we have saved up enough !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: londonlover2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Nh Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky after spending 5 days there. We e-mailed ahead of our arrival requesting a non-smoking room on a high floor. We arrived to find that they had no record of our booking, we showed them our internet confirmation and we were duly checked in. We left our bags in our room and went out. We returned later in the day tofind our room smelled of tobacco smoke. We opened the windows and it seemed to clear. We had read on this board that the heating could only be left on by placing the room key card in a slot in the room. However, we found this not to be the case. There was plenty of dangerously hot water and fantastic water pressure. Later that night we returned to the hotel bar, which was extremely busy and had a good atmosphere. Unfortunatley we couldn't stay there as just about all of the guests were smoking and the bar was so full of smoke that visibility was poor!!. I can only think that this chain smoking is a continental thing as in England you have to check that smoking is permitted and in which areas. In every bar and restaurant in Amsterdam, everybody smokes. The hotel reception staff were unsympathetic when told that even though we were on a non smoking floor, everyone was smoking. As soon as you walked into the hotel you could smell smoke and probably smoked five of those cigarettes and/or cigars before getting to the lift. In every day situations at home we come across smokers in bars and restuarants and cafes and it is never a problem. In Amsterdam it was totally intolerable. On the plus side the hotel is very well situated and all major aeas of interest are easily accessible from there. The rooms are comfortable and clean. However, we expect better facilities and levels of service in a 5 star hotel. The hotel looks jaded and in need of an overhaul. It looks as though it hasn't been upgraded at all in the seven years since we last stayed there. We found that the bar prices were almost double to the same drinks served in bars outside. We also had to pay again forour room on departure as they claimed not to have been paid by the tour company despite showing them our receipts stating payment made some 9 weeks earlier. A matter now having to be resoved by our credit card company. They have an attitiude that all guests are transitional and will be gone in a few days. There are far nicer hotels in Amsterdam with good views and reflective of 2006. We certainly would not stay here again and had we known prior to departure that we were having to pay again, we would have stayed somewhere else.So if you want the comfort and service of a 5 star hotel, don't choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jqk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was gorgeous, I couldn't fault it. The staff were friendly and helpful and the overall the hotel was extremely relaxing. The breakfasts were lovely too, with a lot of choice. Apart from all of this the location was fantastic, near a lot of the tourist attractions and shops. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One NIght in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer1
Reviews.Content: I have to say this was a great location for a quick trip through Amsterdam. We only had one night waiting on a flight to connect to the States. I called ahead to let them know we would be arriving early in the morning. The hotel did accomodate us, check in was quick and easy. The young men at the desk were very helpful. I did not see the perks that other five star hotels offer (ie. shuttle from airport), but it was comfortable and a great spot to tour from. We had a great trip. It was in walking distance to the Central train station, a lot of nice shops and resturants in walking distance. Our room overlooked an alley, so not a great view, but the room was comfortable. There was a lot of noise in the alley after midnight. I talked to the front desk about it in the morning, and they said I should have called them. Overall we had a nice stay. I would stay again, but not in an alley room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: emmas0831
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Hotel Krasnapolsky between Christmas and the New Year 2005. The entrance to the hotel is very grand, revolving doors opening into a very elegant reception area. There were queues to check in but they were not too long and we kind of expected a wait because of the time of year. We stayed in a business room, which was nice, had a large bathroom and king size bed, but the second morning we were woken up by construction noise. We complained to reception and they promptly moved our room. The second room was smaller and the toilet was seperate from the bathroom and had no ventilation, so smelled a bit like a public toilet, although all was clean! We had an issue with the room safe and after speaking to reception and security the problem was solved very quickly. The location was fantastic, right on Dam Square and so easy to reach all areas of the city and just around the corner from the must see Red Light District. There were several good bars and restaurants close by, try Riks Cafe and Twenty One (nice cafe for food and coffee). We ate in the Hotel Restaurant one evening and the food was good although for what is was, was quite expensive, three courses and wine cost approx. Â£50 per head. The waiter was very helpful with choice of wine and explained the menu well. All in all it was a pleasent stay and the deal we found on Expedia was reasonable taking into account the time of year. I would recommend the Kransnapolsky for its location and for the helpful & friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stag party”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the English spoken by the beautiful check in person. The hotel personel was very discrete and the hotel had a very attractive old world decor. The standard room was on the small side but in very good shape. The bathroom did not have a tub but did have a very good shower. The Royal wing was larger but had less classic charm; with a more euro look. The Royal wing was out of the way of the lobby -which is neither a plus nor a negative. The Sunday brunch in the Wintergarden looked extremely popular and the location awesome. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel in Central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: galileocan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on business in late January, 2006. My room was located in the "Royal Wing", which I think is quite an overstated description. Nevertheless the room was quite large by European standards with hardwood floors and a nice sized bathroom. Everything was spotless. Had to adjust to inserting your room key in a slot inside the room to keep the heat and lights going, but you get used to it after awhile. I actually took a card with a magnetic stripe and substituted it, so that my room would be warm while I was out - it worked like a charm. The hotel is big on security. You need your key card to get most places. The staff is quite cheerful and polite. For those who require internet, the rooms are wireless (charge) or for those on a tighter budget, there is a wonderful business centre with four state of the art computers, printers, etc. All for free. I never had to wait for a computer at any time. The breakfast was included in my rate - a buffet in the formal and expansive "Winter Garden". Quite a huge selection, but rather pricy if you had to pay for it. We used the meeting rooms at the hotel while there, and there were many of them, and the staff were very attentive on keeping water jugs re-filled and coffee and tea well stocked for our break times. The hotel is well situated in Amsterdam, near most anything you need. Red light district is right behind the hotel, the train station is about a 15 minute walk (5 minute cab ride). Located at Dam Square. This is a very nice hotel, and although it probably is a bit on the pricy side, its certainly a lovely and comfortable place to be while in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: CubaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had a two night stay at the hotel and was very impressed by the service. Check in was quick, on my floor I saw staff patrol the floor serveral times which comforted me as I was a women traveling alone. Best surprise was the free internet! The front desk was very helpful in arranging the shuttle to the airport for me with frequent updates- suggestion- call 3 hours a head of time for the shuttle! As well they were kind enough to hold my my larger bags for me for a few days when I was back-packing at no charge. Very nice but expensie breakfast buffet but their is champange with it! All in all while I did not feel the room itself was that impressive, the service and location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Spooky apartment hotel!”
Reviews.Author: efc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking forward to staying at this lovely looking hotel, but upon check-in we were told that there were no rooms available even though we made our booking in advance. But the unsmiling staff told us our room will be "upgraded" to an apartment hotel. The apartment was big - 2 bedrooms, dining room, living room, kitchen, toilet and bath complete with washing machine and drier! All for us! However, there's this strange feeling we had upon entering the room - a feeling that we are not alone! I had goose bumps and the hair in my head all stood up! We did not see anything (whew!) but the light in our bedroom got busted, the radio in the other room was on upon entering the premises and we heard some noises. Of course it may just be our imagination, but neither my wife and I want to be left alone in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 00bex00
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at this hotel in October 2005 for a 3 night stay for my birthday. I paid 210 pounds which i thought was reasonable especially considering alot of the other nearby hotels are very exspensive. I was slightly concerned because some reviews posted were not the most encouraging but i would recommend anyone to go to this hotel. on arrival the porters helped with my bags. Our checkin was smooth and the receptionist was helpful and welcoming. We were also upgraded to the Royal wing which is where the executive rooms are. The room itself was clean modern and had everything you could need. It was slightly noisy at night but quietend down after about 11.30. The retsuarnt at the hotel was very good with a wide array of food. The service was exceptional. I would definitley recommend this hotel without a moments hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kaktuz
Reviews.Content: this is simply a great hotel , very helpfull staff, very clean & comfortable rooms , the only problem i saw was the UN changed menus , u have to eat eggs with beakon 7 days in a raw , besides this the hotel is simply amazing just in the middle of amsterdam! would defenetly recommend to stay there during your tour! top noch hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Did the job, I suppose”
Reviews.Author: Bustamove
Reviews.Content: I had heard that this was supposed to be one of the best hotels in Amsterdam and was looking forward to staying there. We got a cheap internet deal and our room really reflected that fact. It was stuck out on a far away wing of the hotel and was small and rather unspectacular. We also had an unfortunate incident when some of our money disappeared, probably taken by a cleaner. In fairness, the hotel did act concerned but the matter was never resolved to our satisfaction. On the plus side the location of the hotel cannot be faulted. It is right on the main square and close to the railway station and main tourist areas. Overall this hotel did the job but the place itself just lacked something and when next in Amsterdam I will probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Sandy007
Reviews.Content: My wife & I arrived from the USA around 10am and were offered a choice of different rooms. We chose to stay in a room for 3 people - all at the same cost we had booked. The room was decent sized and clean. The bed and pillows were surprisingly comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. I didn't like the idea that we had to pay extra to gain wireless internet access, but the business center was made available to us - so we used their computers to email back and forth to the states. The breakfast buffet we only okay - not at all worth the 22 euro charge - fortunately, it was included in the low-rate we received from one of the last minute online websites. The location is great - right at Dam Square. However, I believe that if we visit again, we will stay closer to Leidesplein as that is where we often found ourselves. The location is quite convienent, near shopping, canal tours, red light district, many dining options, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the spacious apartment!”
Reviews.Author: fishgod1010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apartment portion of this hotel earlier this month. It is a little difficult to book as the link seems to be buried in their website to do it. Overall, we really enjoyed it. We were a bit apprehensive due to a few of the reviews here, but we were completely satisfied. Since we enjoyed the location, the extra space vs. hotel room space and the ability to sleep in w/o maid service constantly knocking on your door, I will just highlight a few drawbacks. First, there was not any oven. We had no intention on "cooking", but we are fond of take-out from our favorite restaurants and sometimes the microwave "re-heating" just doesn't cut it. Not a big deal by any stretch of the imagination. Second, there a A LOT of stairs. Not only in the apartment (which I tried to photograph) but also to get up to the second floor was quite tricky with our luggage. The stairs are narrow, very steep and whindy (sp?). We utilized their bellhop, but it was a chore regardless. Again, not a deal breaker, just something to consider if climbing up 2-3 flights of stairs and down every day is not "your thing". Bottom line, we will absolutely stay here again. Dam Square is beautiful at night and the apartmemt made it feel like home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: partytime2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, we were there for just one night, Sept. 27, 2005. Big, beautiful room, lots of storage, beautiful new bathroom. Front desk was quick and efficient. Great location! AC could have been better, but that's Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 3.5 star hotel in a great locale”
Reviews.Author: Deadlast01
Reviews.Content: Well, Dam Square is the center of Amsterdam, so the location is perfect. The room had wood floors and a modern Scandanavian motif. My wife and I were given robes and slippers in our room. While we were happy with the room (5138), the hallway outside our room was plain and musty. The lobby and dining areas of the hotel were very beautiful. Overall, I recommend this hotel. TIP - The hotel bar is the regular happy-hour hangout of Northwesten pilots and crew members. They were nice and fun and gave great tips for seeing the city. 2nd TIP - This hotel is the "5 star hotel" on that well-known site that doesn't reveal the hotel name until you pay (I don't know if I can say the name, but email me for it). Obviously, it's not a five star, but we used that site to get a very good rate of $205 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LGWATL
Reviews.Content: After reading the last couple of reviews I feel like I stayed in a different hotel. The room was on the shabby side and the air conditioning did not work. I had 2 meals there and can say the food was terrible. However, the service was fine and the employees were pleasant. The place seems better suited for large tour groups. I will not likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Krasnapolsky for 3 nights. Front desk staff was very efficient on check-in, and the room was wonderful. Apparently remodeled within the last several years. Lots of storage space, interior furnishings and amenities were very nice, bathrobes and slippers, and the first hotel where we had a doorbell (!). Business center on first floor will let you use their Internet computers for 10 minutes at a time for no charge. Hotel overall was very nice, in very good condition. Location was excellent, right on the square, across from the royal palace. This is a great place to stay, as you can walk to everything. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JGH444
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 2-night stay at the Kras. Situated on Dam Square opposite the Palace, it was a prime location. Bus and tram stops are right across the street, so it was easy to get anywhere. The hotel itself was inviting from the lobby onward. We arrived early in the day, yet a room was ready for us. It was clean and well appointed. The business center was handy, and the front desk staff was pleasant and eager to serve. We would stay again if the occasion arose.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Great.. Room ok..?”
Reviews.Author: Katzen
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the room, which was ok in size, had a big balcony, good bathroom and comfy bed, but no better than average. Not five star. The hotel was really rather ordinary. It was not at all 'Grand' and in places scruffy. Although the central location and extravagant breakfast (champagne!) redeemed the experience, the service was not great, (no ice bucket as requested, long wait at check in, wrong information, confusion over bill etc etc). Look around before you choose your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCW
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located on Dam Square, this certainly maintains the ambience of a traditional European 'Grand' Hotel, with comfortable public areas and decent service. My bedroom, although not the most modern in the world and suffering from noise outside late at night, was large and comfortable. Very pleasant, but more four-star than five.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Apartment/Tenement squalor”
Reviews.Author: josef3
Reviews.Content: Don't be duped into renting one of these "luxury apartments". I rented a two bedroom deluxe for a week and it was filthy and disgusting. I checked out the following morning. Words can not describe this experience other than to say that I felt like I was in a ghetto. The hallway entrance should have been my first clue as the carpet is torn and filthy, the walls are filthy and it just gets worse from there. I will say that the night manager that I spoke to was very professional and polite vs the girls at the front desk who giggled and laughed when I lodged my complaint. I am very puzzled by some of the other reviews regarding these apartments and their glowing comments. I cannot believe that the hotel is even associated with these "luxury apartments"; it is false advertising to describe these as "luxury apartments". I will never stay at the Krasnapolsky again!!! And yes indeed you do wander aimlessly through the kitchen to get to your "luxury apartment". I recommend you keep wandering right past them to the Pulitzer or the Dylan. Luckily, I was able to get a room at the Dylan so my trip wasn't completely ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Romantic Break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 28 Aug - 1 Sept as a romatic break for two. The hotel was immaculate. The room was clean and a decent size for Amsterdam. The hotel's facilities were fantastic and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The food was a little expensive so we ate out most of the time, but we would highly recommend the American breakfast via room service as it was ample for 2 people; and priced at 23euro, it was the same cost as eating out for two anyway. We would strongly recommend this hotel as it is so central to everthing and having viewed a number of other hotels in the area, this one was by far the best. Try to get a special deal though. We paid 520euro for double room (back of hotel as its quieter) via bookings.com for 4 nights and that was a fabulous rate considering the real rate was well over 1000euro. Cannot fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaydee41
Reviews.Content: went there during the most dirtiest week of amsterdam, they had a sanitation strike. the hotel was great, housekeeping did a wonderful job. but the reception was a bit unfriendly. the porter was a great help. do not eat at that japanesse restaurant inside the hotel. it sucks! it tasted burn and lot of salt. . over all its a cool place to visit. but not much to see. went to ann franks museum, thats what i like the most. dont waste ur money on that palace, museum, rather walk around town, and shop. i was a bit scared. but it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: NadÃ¨ge
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam where I took my boyfriend as a birthday treat. As it was both our first time in this city, I originally wanted to stay at a canal house (more typical) but I found out that most of them had a 2 or even 3 night policy. I ended up booking a â€œsupersaver double roomâ€� internet deal at the Grand Krasnapolsky, mainly on account of its great location, right on Dam Square. The hotel is a 10-minute walk from the Central Station and you can walk to pretty much anywhere in the city centre (we walked to Anne Frankâ€™s house, cruises are available just up the road and the Red Light District is only a few streets away). After what seemed like a rather long wait to check in (be warned!), I was a bit anxious to see what room we had been attributed, as according to other reviews on this site, the size, furniture, (and even cleanliness!) can vary from one to the other. Well I was pleasantly surprised! The room was spacious, clean, and well furnished. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was great with a bathtub and a separate shower room. All the toiletries you could have needed were provided, plus bathrobes and slippers. Definitely what I expected of a four-star hotel! We were not overlooking Dam Square and therefore we had no noise at night. We did not have any of our meals at the hotel, although I was tempted to try the Sunday brunch in the beautiful Winter Garden. As a cheaper alternative, you could try the Pancake Bakery on Prinsengracht (good omelets and pancakes, but expect a queue to get in on Sundays)). All in all, perhaps we were lucky with the room we were given, but we certainly enjoyed our stay at the Krasnapolsky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: brianc_li
Reviews.Content: The period of 17-27 August 2005 saw Amsterdam host 'Sail'. This is an event which happens every five years where the tall ships complete a major crossing from Boston. Amsterdam, a city with a population of only 750k gets 2.4 million visitors during this event. In 2000 I visited for a day and promised myself that the next time it was on I would stay in Amsterdam and fully take in the event. I originally booked a three night weekend stay at the three star Boatel. This I switched to the Krasnapolski when i saw on bookings that I could get a superior room at this five star hotel for the same price. We arrived shortly before 11am and were told, not surprisingly, that our rooms were not yet ready. They did say however that they had been vacated and that they would call up to housekeeping to get them cleaned. True enough, an hour later we were able to check in. The only criticism I would have of the reception process is that when we returned to collect our keys the queue at reception was long. There did not seem to be the necessary extra staff or reception points to cope, it thus took us some twenty minutes before we were seen to. The reception area itself is modern and perhaps not as ornate or interesting as one would expect of a hotel in this class. Our rooms were situated in the 'Royal Wing' of the hotel. This is an annexe which you reach across a short covered alleyway to the side of the hotel. To access this you had to use your keycard, that aside it is very much a part of the hotel. The rooms are spacious, with wooden floors and modern prints on the walls. As you would expect from such an establishment they are equipped with every imaginable amenity, in room safe, mini bar, tea and coffee making facility, Towel bath robes, slippers, etc. There are comfortable seats and adequate working area. The marble bathroom had a good size bath with an excellent combi shower. The towels were plentiful and thick, there was a hair dryer, separate makeup/shaving mirror and a comprehensive array of toiletries. As we were looking out onto the street our window arched out over it giving the impression of an internal balcony. The downside of this is that the one night we tried to sleep with the aircon off and the window open the street noise was intrusive. Both rooms we had were spotless and maintained to a very high standard. Breakfast is held in a very ornate room, The Winter Garden. At 22 euros it is expensive but if you have the time and the inclination it is worth going for. Perhaps the widest buffet I have ever seen, covering all tastes, is on offer. This is complimented by champagne for those who feel up for it. One word of caution, breakfast finishes at 10.30 and this does mean that it is finished, the buffets are mostly empty by then and will not be refilled. My best advice to anyone considering this option is to get there by at least 10am if you want to fully enjoy it. During our stay we did not try the hotel's restaurant. This is in a cosy, panneled, attractive looking room. The menu itself didn't appeal to me but this may be doing the hotel a disservice. I visited the bar a couple of times. It is in modern Dutch design. The service and choice of drinks was good but otherwise it was unremarkable. Throughout our stay the staff were efficient and friendly despite being somewhat under pressure on this busiest of Amsterdam weekends. There is arguably no greater location for a hotel in Amsterdam than that which the Krasnapolski occupies. It is on the principal square in the city, Dam. This is about ten minutes walk, in a straight line, from Central Station. As a base for exploring the city, be that on foot, by bike or by public transport there is none better. We paid 130 euro (plus 6 city tax) a night for our rooms. At this rate the hotel can only be described as excellent value and well worth the stay. On the Saturday night of our stay a colleague who had booked somewhat later was in a standard double room at the rate of 200 euro plus tax. That is probably about the right rate for such a room in such a hotel. The rack rate of 350 euros per night is certainly too much. All in all it's a lovely hotel, but not at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyIreland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend recently stayed in this hotel (Aug 2005) and we adored it! It is in a prefect location. It is in the middle of Dam Square, which is the heart of Amsterdam. You could not be in a better location. The hotel is in perfect walking distance to all the main sights. We walked to the Anne Frank House, Van Gogh Museum, and the Heineken Brewery. It is right beside the two main shopping streets and department stores, and is surrounding by great restaurants and bars. The hotel is beautiful inside, and the staff were very friendly - our hotel room was upgraded on arrival. Our room was huge and the bathroom was massive! If you want to really enjoy Amsterdam then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: daisydeadpetals
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel! The location was perfect, which really made our trip. We were within walking distance of almost everything we wanted to see. The concierge was extremely helpful with directions, booking our canal cruise, restaurant reservations, and no request we made was too much trouble. Our room was not overlooking the Dam, but that was just fine because it was extremely quiet. The room was spacious, as well as the bathroom, and we loved the soaps & shower gel they supplied. The bed was huge and so comfortable! A piece of advice- we arrived in Amsterdam at 8:00am after a long flight from New York, and check-in time was not until 3:00pm. My travel agent advised us not to worry, as they often have the rooms ready sooner. Although they did try their best to have our room ready sooner, it simply wasn't possible with so many people checking in that busy Saturday. I had so wished I had not listened to my travel agent and booked an extra day- it would have been well worth it for us, just something to consider if your flight schedule was similar to ours! The Japanese restaurant in the hotel did not disappoint, food was great. A bit on the pricey side, but not a great shock to us New-Yorkers. The Winter Garden is beautiful. We didn't opt for the breakfast plan, as there were so many nearby places to have breakfast that were much cheaper, plus- we aren't exactly early risers, and breakfast is until about 10:30 am. We did have breakfast down there one morning and it was wonderful, with so much to choose from, even champagne & strawberries! Check in / check out was easy, and leaving for the airport was a cinch. We asked the concierge to call us a taxi, and they came up to our room and promptly brought all of our bags down ahead of time, taxi was right there--no problem & painless! WHEN and not if we go back to visit this beautiful city, we will be sure to stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A faux pas”
Reviews.Author: phiphimomo
Reviews.Content: If we return to this hotel, it would only be its location. However there are plenty of hotels around there, which would certainly do more in every aspect than only acclaiming its history, reputation and services on pamphlets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NatV
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Kras on many occasions including twice over New Year's Eve, but most recently over the Easter weekend. I have never been disappointed with anything there: the rooms are spacious and well equipped, the staff polite and helpful and the facilities are excellent. I would highly recomment the Kras for anyone travelling to Amsterdam for business or leisure purposes.

Reviews.Title: “excellant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i took my boyfirend to amsterdam for the first time and stayed at this hotel about two years ago..and i remember every single bit of it! it is a beautiful hotel and we were greeted immediately by two bell boys...very grand indeed..the rooms are spacious and of high quality what you'd expect from a four star hotel...a really memorable first time to dam..and it's location is just fantastic in the midst of everything..we had no problem getting around as it's centrally located..if you go to dam you must stay in this hotel ..highly recommended. happy smoking!

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about late night noise outside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall excellent hotel but avoid Square facing rooms at weekends unless you stay up to 3 am. Street noise through poorly insulated window frames is obtrusive.Due entirely to the fact that this hotel is unfortunately on walking route to and from red light district.Great hotel but ask for inner facing room unless you party late.

Reviews.Title: “Weed had a fantastic time !!”
Reviews.Author: PatsyPie
Reviews.Content: Visited Amsterdam with some friends and stayed at this great hotel. We had rooms overlooking Dam Square, where there was lots of activity well into the early hours, but it didn't disturb our beauty sleep.( at least I don't think it did.) We did not eat at the hotel as it was expensive. The location is excellent as you are central to everthing Amsterdam has to offer. As my friend and her partner are quite partial to a ruby murray they found a nice Indian resteraunt and then had to agree with "Robbie Williams" that Amsterdam is the best place for a good curry. The Coffee shops are excellent we had the best coffee ever !!!. Visited Anna Frank museum for the second time and it was still amazing. The Red Light District is a must but be warned, you will offered certain substances which we politely refused. For anyone thinking of going to Amsterdam I would highly recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker121
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Krasnapolsy from 28 to 30 May 2005 in an executive room in the Royal Wing. The large and well-furnished room was superb with a "walk-in" bay window from which we could see the whole street. The room and the rest of the hotel were clean and the staff extremely courteous, friendly and helpful.
