The Winter Garden room where breakfast was served had one of the best buffets we have eaten and the main restaurant, the Reflet, where we ate on the first night, was excellent. Both were wonderful rooms in themselves. The hotel is ideally sited on Dam Square in the centre of the city with the main shopping streets and markets within easy walking distance. This was our first trip to Amsterdam and the hotel is the perfect choice for a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: AZSH01
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at the Gand Krasnapolsky. My first 2 nights I stayed in a standard room. Not much of a view, but bed was very comfortable and bathroom decent with good water pressure. I decided to stay 2 more nights and upgraded to better room. This room was was very nice, contemporary design and and incredible view. My room overlooked Dam square. Queen's Day was held on April 30 and my room overlooked the stage they set up for their Queen's entertainment. I would recommend visiting Amsterdam during this local holiday, one of the coolest events I have ever attended. The hotel staff was great also. I recommend taking the airport shuttle for 11 Euros, convenient and worth it. Great location for hotel, in the middle of everything. Lots of great restaurants and bars close by. I recommend Gaucho for steaks, also the NY Pizza stand and falafal sandwaches are filling and cheap. I also recommend the scrumptious pastry shop next door. Avoid the EuropaBar next to hotel, 5 Euros is too expensive for a beer. Amstedam is a great city to visit and the dutch residents are very nice. London is getting too expensive, I think Amstedam will service as my base for my Europe travels now because although hotels expensive, everything else is fairly reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Location... not a palace but excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevenBrussels
Reviews.Content: I booke dthe hotel at the NH Hotel site at an attractive rate. The room was spacious and quiet. Very clean. The hotel is a bit unpersonal and very big. Breakfast is tremendous !!! and teh breakfast room is art nouveau..; a real experience. Location is very ok altough a busy neighbourhood even at night. But rooms were sound proof. I stayed at several hotels in Amsterdam. This one is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came to Amsterdam for New Year Dec 2004 and were lucky enough to stay at the Kras. Superb hotel, very friendly and helpful staff and you must have the Sunday Brunch (which was on New Years Day) An eat as much as you can buffet, with champagne, perfect cure for the hangover from New Years Eve. Very centrally located Hotel and so easy to get to from the Airport, just hop on a Train and it's a few minutes walk to Dam Square. So much cheaper than a Taxi. We walked everywhere in Amsterdam and WOW what a lovely city, great food, friendly people and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping”
Reviews.Author: eddyo
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the GK on a number of occasions, i have to say that i think the standards have declined over the last year or so. The check-in is always considerably longer than it need be for a hotel that lays claim to a five star rating and the staff at the front desk these days,seem a little ignorant of the fact that people are waiting and waiting. It seems that they aren't interested in making sure guests are given a good first impression. I guess when your hotel is situauted in what is arguably the finest location in one of the world's most visited cities, you can do as you please. Shame really because it's a lovely hotel. We always book a royal view room, slightly pricier than other rooms but worth it we think for the view.The key cards always seem to need a few swipes before they give you the green light and eventually, on the last visit, they stopped working altogether. After informing reception where it was obvious that it was an inconvenience to be unloading problems,we were asked to wait outside our room until someone came up. Fifteen munites later we were begrudginly let in to our room and asked to produce passport I.D. which we promptly did, after this, we were reluctantly handed our new keycards and the guy just turned and left. No apology for the inconvenience, no word of any kind, just a suspicious look and he left. Ignorance personified. It really p**sed me off, we were treated like (--). Ultimately, the hotel is worth it for the location and the view but some, not all, of the staff need to learn a thing or two about manners.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: donny34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in March as a special treat and overall the hotel was great. When we arrived, we were placed in a room which was quite near the front of the hotel and was very noisy (there was a fair on in Dam Square) and so we asked to be moved to somewhere quieter. 3 rooms later, we settled in our room which although clean, was not quite what I expected of a 4/5 star hotel. The bathroom was the smallest ever - I've NEVER had swing doors to a bathroom containing a bath with shower over a washbasin and with a toilet in its own room. It was quite a feat manoevering out of the bath when the glass shower door didn't really have enough space to move back ! The bed was very comfortable and room service food was more than adequate. But what really makes this hotel is the breakfast buffet (fantastic - amazing amount of choice AND free champagne!) the staff who are really helpful and friendly (unusual for such a large hotel) and of course the location - perfect for discovering Amsterdam. We'd stay there again without any hesitation. Shame it doesn't have an indoor pool though....

Reviews.Title: “Totally Fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was clean, spacious (not large) and comfortable. Main lobby was faded opulence but we didn't really spend any time in there (when in Amsterdam - go walking in Amsterdam). The location of the hotel is pretty good - very central, and VERY convenient. Not on a canal, which may be an issue for some, but close to canals (only a few blocks). The street behind the hotel can be noisy, but not overly concerning. The hotel is right across from The Palace - which is lovely. Advice: Don't waste your time (or Euros) taking a cab - just take the train straight from the airport to Central Station and walk 2 - 3 block north to Dam Square - and the hotel is right there - so easy!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location!”
Reviews.Author: Mystie
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent time at the Krasnapolsky. The only critism I have for this hotel is the unorganised management of the check-in process. However, this problem was partly due to ignorant and aggresive tourists who actually reckoned that they were better than the other people in the queue and should be served first. The rooms are small, but very clean, and very comfortable. The location is absolutely marvelous. Opposite the hotel is a main train-stop, and also surrounded by some of the major shopping centres in Amsterdam. The Red Light District is just a few streets away for a leisurely evening browse, much safer than we had expected! A lot of superb & affordable Chinese restaurants dotted around the surrounding streets. The dim sum at some of these places must be tried!

Reviews.Title: “Sheer luxury in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: southendbootboy
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a cheap deal for the Krasnapolsky in mid-January - I've always wanted to stay there! VERY luxurious, very comfortable rooms, nice little bar, and so handy for everything - right on Dam Square. Very friendly and obliging staff. Having said that, this Hotel is definitely NOT in my normal price range - thought the Hotel's website allows you to locate and book the cheapest possible rates very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Krasnapolsky Apartments a Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: NYCJanet
Reviews.Content: I found a 99 Euro/night rate on a Junior Apartment at the Krasnapolsky through Hotels over President's Weekend, so I consider myself extremely fortunate. The plusses: location, location, location - just a few blocks from Central Station, right on the Dam, where all the trams stop. The "Junior" size we were given was 1 bedroom, a separate living room/kitchen and a view overlooking a pleasant, quiet courtyard. We had plenty of space to stretch out, 2 tv's (we don't watch, but I mention it for those of you who do), good interior lighting, comfy furniture, and we saved a bundle preparing our own breakfast and a few other meals, which helped with the Euro/dollar conversion. There's a supermarket and plenty of other shopping close by. The hotel concierge is very helpful, plus you can buy a multi-use tram ticket (strippenkart) in the hotel's Business Room. Amsterdam is so compact, in good weather you can walk (or rent a bike) to most museums, etc. The minuses: check-in wasn't until after 3 (absolutely no relief for the jetlagged), the apartment entrance was through the hotel's kitchen area, those narrow, steep Dutch steps, the mattresses were soft (although we slept fine), and we couldn't get the smell of cigarette smoke out of the room. Also, for those of you with small kids or poor eyesight, our apartment contained two floor-to-ceiling steel supports that you wouldn't want to bang into. Also there was a step down from the bathroom into the bedroom. Other apartments may be arranged differently, but if this kind of safety is a concern, I suggest writing to the hotel in advance and requesting a room without these items. On balance, considering the location, price and spaciousness, we were more than happy to make the other tradeoffs. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The apartments are great, if a bit quirky.”
Reviews.Author: milepig
Reviews.Content: Please note that this review concerns the apartments that are owned by the Krasnapolsky hotel, not the main hotel itself. I stumbled across the apartments by accident and, after checking trip advisor, decided to get them a try. I couldn' have been more pleased. Information is hard to find, without any real link from the hotel site itself, but a check on search engines turned up several locations for booking, including a well hidden page on the hotel's main site. I'm not quite sure what the story is. The hotel is large and complex - the sort of place that needs to specify "for your room use elevator six, which is around five corners and down a long hallway....". It occupies the majority of a square block, and includes several small buildings that I suspect are listed. It is these buildings that contain the apartments. In many cases they are in mixed buildings, some apartments seem to be either not owned by the hotel or on long-term leases, while others are available for rent. The ground floor may very well contain a shop. The hotel site indicates that the minimum booking period is one week, but I was able to secure a four-day booking from one of the online sites. Other reviewers have accurately described the process, you check in at the hotel, etc. Our particular apartment, one of several with this characteristic, was accessed through the hotel kitchen. Sort of strange, but we got used to it. Problems first: the entrance through the kitchen. the fact that our outside door was never locked, not once, in the four days we stayed there. Granted you had to walk through the hotel lobby to get there, but still.... the hole in the wall at the bottom of the steps where someone probably lost control of their suitcase (along with drywall debris that wasn't swept up the entire time we were there. The upside: EU119 for a two room apartment with a loft. The unit was squeeky clean. We had all the normal hotel supplies, soap, towels, etc. We had a kitchen with microwave, fridge, pots and pans, corkscrew, etc. The living room was huge and we felt like we were at home. Although there were other units on our hallway, the only thing we ever heard was faint TV noises as we walked past the units. Once inside our unit, nothing. The furnishings are indeed a bit like HoJo's, but they were fine. The living room had a big leather couch with matching chair, coffee table, several lamps, a dining table with four chairs, fully equipped kitchen. More than I had possibly hoped for. The pictures presented online are spot on. Every unit is different, but based on my experience I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to "Toon town"”
Reviews.Author: CarrieHooton
Reviews.Content: I entered Amsterdam with some trepidation. My partner had lived there for some years before we met so I was visiting his old haunts (he was keen to ensure I hhad a great time) but I was concerned about the stories of drug us and prostitution. Absolutely no need to worry I soon discovered. The Dutch have such an open attitude that those sort of activities are well out of the way and you are highly unlikely to stumble across them unless you particularly want to. I found Amsterdam to be liberating, fresh and exciting. The people were vibrant and individual, the transport was amazing: buses, trams, underground, bikes (more than I've ever seen) a few cars....and the canal system was breathtaking. Our hotel was really well located in the centre of town. It was a five star but I wasn't overly impressed by the facilities. Still, it was nice enough - just nothing special. What was something special was the restaurant "Christophes" It is the best restaurant I have EVER eaten at and the cheese board is out of this world. Don't go to Amsterdam for a boozy stag-night of seedy goings on ... you're missing out on a wonderful wonderful city !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Adrian9
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam many times, but I've just got back from my first stay in the Krasnapolsky. It won't be my last because the service is excellent. The room is pretty much what a hotel room is anywhere, perfectly adequate but nothing to write home about. What impressed me was the service. The first room we were given turned out to have two single beds pushed together, not the double I had requested, as soon as I complained we were upgraded with apologies and they even offered to have my luggage moved too. My girlfriend needed a pair of scissors, they arrived in minutes as did anything else I asked for (dinner menus, ironing board etc). The Reflet Restaurant is again excellent, both in service and quality of food. The location couldn't be better, right on Dam square so all the big shops are out the front door and the coffee shops are out the back door. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Kras about this place”
Reviews.Author: Scousejetsetter
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in an ideal location. After reading some of the reviews we were a little hesitant regards the hotel, but I can honestly say we could not find fault with the place in anyway. Our rooms were spotless and the staff were always helpful and curteous. The extras in the room - shower gel, toothbrush, bath robe, etc., were all very nice, of he highest quality and a lovely bonus. Having said all that, the highlight has to be the location. Overlooking Dam square and close to everything you may want or need. Get a map and enjoy Amsterdam as this hotel is at the very heart of the city. Also, one of the best restaurants in Amsterdam for the price is just around the corner in the form of Gaucho's. If you go, go here and have the 'Classic'. A three course meal for just 19,50 Euros. You will be far pushed to eat better! We did get the rooms at a slightly discounted price as we booked so far in advance (eight months) but when we return to Amsterdam (and we will very soon) this hotel will be our first check out for availablility, largely irrespective of the price. Amsterdam is one of the nicest cities in Europe and the hotel perfectly combines 5* quality with Amsterdam's uniqueness. Having recently stayed in a Hilton in Prague which was nice, but you could have been anywhere in the world. The Krasnapolsky manages to keep the 5* factor and mixes in the great Amsterdam feeling. We cannot find fault with the hotel and happily recommend it to anyone who vists Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A_Shropshire_Lass
Reviews.Content: Having booked a weekend break online and got a very good rate for flights and hotel I was a little nervous about what we would find upon checking in to this hotel after reading some of the negative comments on here. I needn't have worried! Our whole weekend was excellent. First of all the location was fantastic! 10 minutes walk from the station and within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to visit. We had a non-smoking room on the 5th floor which was spacious, immaculate, warm and quiet. The bed was huge and comfortable with soft sheets and a choice of pillows. A real surprise in a European hotel was the tea and coffee making facilities in our room - wonderful! The first morning we were too hungover to face a euro22pp breakfast so we ventured out to find something to eat. We did have breakfast in The Winter Garden on the Sunday morning and it was amazing! Champagne and smoked salmon with scrambled eggs in the most beautiful setting. Worth every penny (or cent!) Every member of staff that we encountered was helpful and pleasant. I really cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!, You really do get what you paid for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only credible comment i can make about this hotel is that the location is fantastic, situated in the heart of Amsterdam - Dam Square. My friend and I paid 119 Euros per night for a room at the Krasnapolsky & we were bitterly dissapointed. Firstly, upon arrival, it took roughly 40 minutes to check-in due to the check-in staff's lack of proficiency. After checking-in we made our way up to the room, not realising that our room was located at the far end of the hotel, a good 5-10 minute walk! Entering our room, we were greeted with the type of room you would expect in a two or three star hotel! Furnishings were old, the curtains had what appeared to be cigarette burns - in a non-smoking room!, the bathroom was very small, the door having no lock on it, & although the air-conditioner worked it made an awful noise! Not to mention the fact that our room was directly above noisy pubs&bars, keeping us awake well into the early hours of the morning! The Krasnapolsky really left the impression with me that you certainly get what you pay for, be very aware of the cheap rates that you find for this hotel on the internet, as you are rewarded in a harsh way for paying the cheaper rate!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the GRAND KRASNAPOLSKY for NEW YEARS and we could not have been more pleased.. it was clean, the staff was pleasant... we even had our room cleaned 2ce in one day.... they let us check in early.. and they helped us get the shuttle to the airport .. i can't say enough good things about this hotel.. absolutely recommend and would defiantly stay there again! :) If you are looking for a New York City experience in Europe this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Grand stay”
Reviews.Author: lesley
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and spacious lobby areas, with a real buzz to it. The bar was always lively, and very comfortable with excellent service. We ate in the restaurant it was one of the best meals we have ever had, exquisite ingredients well presented. The restaurant itself was beautiful and reminded me of the Ritz London. Staff brilliant, they had to go to the shop for our champagne, but gave us a discount for the delay. The room was only a standard, but it was very nicely furnished, new fittings, comfy bed, a really good size and a view across the city. Bathroom was a bit old fashioned, but the toilet and shower were seperate, suite wa snew, toiletries good quality. The best thing though was the winter garden where you have breakfast, it is stunning, the buffet breakfast was as good , if not better than any I have had in the US. If you want the Sunday brunch (12-3) you have to book well in advance. Also the position was great, close to red light district, which is actually very nice, all the shops bars and restaurants. Do go

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Hotel if u are in the right room!”
Reviews.Author: Raw_Robert
Reviews.Content: room nos 1020,2020,3020 and 4020 are generally for the disabled and hence are enormouse compared to the rest of the hotel and we have always had a great time there. We have been treated with respect and courtesy unlike some of the other 5 star hotels and the Breakfast is truly fantastic if u have room service! Have stayed there 5 times and am due back on the 26thDec for another 3 nights!

Reviews.Title: “great location - poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ping000
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is great, but that's all the positive comment this hotel gets. The room was very small, the furniture was very old, a rusted heating and a mini bathroom. It was very warm when we visited and it was impossible to turn on the airco because it made a terrible noise...so the room got so hot that we had a incredible headache in the morning. Never never again! I think this hotel used to be very nice, but now it is more than time for renovation!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the apartments. Ample space and the decor was nice. Bed was comfortable. The entrance to the apartments is at the beginning of the Red Light district. There is always activity giong on outside. The Greenhouse Coffieshop is just accross the street for those smokers. The room service food was excellant. If you can get one of these apartments (7day stay required) they're the best deal in Amsterdam 625euro for the week!!! book at --------.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but OK room....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - Across the street from the Palace and right in the middle of Dam Square and the Red Light District. Close to trams and a 10 walk to Centraal Station and canal tours. Lots of shops, resturants/eateries and bars/coffeshops nearby. A big mall and a grocery store right behind the Palace. About a 15 walk to the Anne Frank House, 20 minute walk from Leidesplein, Vondel Park, the Flower Market, Resturant Row and about a 30 minute walk to the Rijks and Van Gogh Musems. Average looking apartment - The lobby and the shops inside the hotel are nice but my apartment was out back and around the corner, facing the Red Light District where you'll usually pass some shady people selling drugs. Walking up the stairs are extremely steep and the room was average looking (no elevators). There's no AC in the room and the bathroom was pretty small. The washer/dryer was very confusing to use and the dryer took FOREVER to dry clothes. It took me about 6.5 hours to dry a pair of jeans and a couple of t shirts. The Japanese resturant in the lobby of the hotel is very expensive for dinner and the food was just ok. It's supposed to be the nicest hotel in Amsterdam but I've stayed at a Marriott Hotel in San Diego, California that was way nicer.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: formerbelle
Reviews.Content: centrally located. convenient. accomodations ok. would probably stay somewhere else next time. perhaps the Pulitzer,

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Krasnapolsky for one night on October 15, 2004. The main problem with this hotel is service overall and the front desk in particular. First, the lobby of the Krasnapolsky is extremely disorganized. There is no reason that they could not put up a sign and some ropes indicating that the line for the check-in counter starts "here". Instead, guests were coming at the clerks from all directions and people breaking into the 2 or 3 lines that had formed. It made the check-in process about twice as long as it should have been. Second, there were only three front desk clerks working when we checked in and there were many guests lined up. This is poor planning and again contributed to a very long and very frustrating check in. On to my room. It was clean, yet very small and cramped. I would have expected more for 200 Euro a night. Also, I had to walk a great distance to get to the elevator, and there were a minimum of signs. Again, very frustrating. The room safe malfunctioned and I could not get access to my valuables. Again, frustrating. On the positive side, the breakfast was excellent. Very good food and good service in the restaurant. At checkout, the same chaotic scene greeted me, and a stranger in front of me commented that the front desk area was possibly the most disorganized he had ever seen. I agree with him. The front desk in any hotel is vital to a customer's impression of the hotel - and the front desk at the Krasnapolsky is about the worst I have ever encountered - especially for a "luxury" hotel. I would not stay at the Krasnapolsky again. Ironically, I stayed at the NH ChÃ¢teau Marquette in Heemskerk for 5 nights prior to the Krasnapolsky, and although the hotel was not as luxurious as the Krasnapolsky, the staff were friendly and helpful and the food was again very good. It seems as though the service problems at the Krasnapolsky are not found at all NH hotels - perhaps the front desk staff at the Krasnapolsky need more basic customer service training, or the front desk management should be looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a try”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything here was great except two things, one bad, one good: Good news: The best lasagna I have ever experienced, at the lobby cafe. Bad news: Insects in room. But maybe it was unusual (during last summer's heat wave).

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PhilSuisse
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, but the hotel doesn't deserve five stars : no luxury in the room, big but very ugly bathroom, very slow check-in, no preparation of the room in the evening, ... I will choose another hotel for my next stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Aug and were happy with the selection of this hotel. It has been fully modernized and is much like a downtown North American hotel inside. The location is supberb and many attractions are within a short walk. Expedia had a very good rate. The staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although we booked this room on the net, we were given a spacious one. The hotel is strategically located in the heart of the city. Good price, good service and an excellent location! Didnt try their breakfast though, but the winter garden looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location”
Reviews.Author: ALPADDICT
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights in Amsterdam and stayed at the Grand Krasnapolsky. We had no problems and no complaints. front desk was helpful,check-in was quick, room was clean and comfortable. If you are going to Amsterdam to see the sights and can walk, this is a great central location...less than 10 minute walk from Central Station,many restaurants within walking distance,and always a lot going on right outside in Dam Square to people watch. If you want a lot of quiet though, it can be a noisy area at night

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: hannah23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there for 5 nights for the New Year... and loved every second of it. The room was really big and clean and the service was irreproachable. We got a really good deal for the room via a web site and all in all we were both enchanted by every aspect of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced faux luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Amsterdam and Germany, traveling with a family of five. We stayed at this hotel on our last night as we had a flight out of Amsterdam and it's convenient to the train station. We had 2 rooms in the Royal wing, which were OK, but definitely not worth the money we paid compared to other hotels on our trip in the same price range. Hotel Krasnapolsky seems to cut corners to give guests the appearance of luxury without actually having to pay for it. The rooms are attractive, with hardwood floors and modern furnishings. But they skimp on the big ticket items. Other hotels in this price range have very fine linens and down comforters. This one had heavier synthetic comforters and less expensive bedding. There are robes and slippers and abundant little goodies in the bathroom, but the flourescent lighting in the bathroom was dim and depressing. The decor was bargain-basement trying to look expensive -- faux granite on the bathroom floor and no evidence of design or artfulness anyplace in the hotel. I knew it was an old hotel and expected to find at least a hint of its former elegance. I didn't. I'm glad we didn't pay the 21 euros apiece for breakfast in the Winter Garden. (there's a very nice cafe next door with a huge breakfast for less than half that.) I suppose what you are paying for is the Hotel's Dam Square location, but considering how easy it is to get around in Amsterdam, and considering how noisy and dirty the Dam is, why not stay some place a little further away and just walk over? As to convenience to the train station, it's about a 3-4 block walk which is fine for someone who isn't traveling with kids but we ended up taking a taxi to the airport anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Watch our for those rooms....”
Reviews.Author: Bobster2006
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stop at this hotel so here's my thoughts. I have to say that if you do not get a room upgrade, your thoughts on this hotel will be very different. The 1st room we were put in would be expected of a 3 star hotel. The toilet was miniscule, the bathroom not far behind (so small, it had to have swinging saloon doors), the room itself quite small. It does seem that all 'best internet rates' will be placed in these rooms. We were offered an upgrade at 35 Euros a night which we refused (they stated that they had no other rooms available). After 15 minutes they managed to give us a different room (obviously kept for someone who has not paid the 'best internet rate'). This room was bigger, nicer bathroom & toilet, although the shower leaked. Apart from the wide variation in rooms, everything else checked out great - location, food, comfort. No swimming pool though - I would have expected this for a 5 star hotel. I would not go back though, I know that I can get better for 180 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great bed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 3 night break at this great hotel. We were upgraded to a room in the Royal Wing. A very spacious, airy, clean room. The bed was to die for. My boyfriend and I had to drag ourselves out of bed to explore this fab City. The staff were really polite and friendly. Location perfect for exploring. We had lunch twice and the food was yummy, try the Club sandwich. You've guessed we will certailny be returning to this hotel. VERY SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: Sparkle080
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky exceeded all my expectations. From the minute we checked in until we left 4 days later it was heaven. The buffet breakfast is in a league of it's own and the beautiful Winter Garden setting just adds to the ambiance of this the most important meal of the day. The quality of the sevice in the lobby bar, the bar and the restaurant can not be faulted.All staff made us feel most welcome. If you have time pay the inhouse Japenese restaurant a visit, you will not be disappointed,all food is cooked on a hotplate at your table.A culinary delight!! The room we stayed in was superb.I feel the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky made our trip to Amsterdam perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great hotel great service got a good deal on hotels.nl. this hotel right in the middle of dam square great location we had room looking over dam square. the beds are huge and so comfortable. easy walking distance to everywhere. would def recommend

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: emerald444
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certainly an institution in Amsterdam. It is very nice inside, but the staff is sometimes a little rude and posh and rooms look pretty old. It is a good choice though. The place where you have breakfast is gourgeous. Very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel...Barbizon Palace is better!”
Reviews.Author: codejd
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places you come if you want to get re-Americanized prior to coming back home. Here you find a large lobby with bar and piano player, a helpful concierge desk, hundreds of rooms rather than handfulls, 24-hour roomservice and if you can believe this; they have an ice machine!!! The rooms are small but clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom is small as well but very nicely done and very user friendly. We opted for a "quiet" room and thus did not have a view of Dam Square but I really didn't care at that point. Just some nice peaceful sleep was what we needed before coming home. Having said all that though the staff is not too friendly. Although the doorman and concierge were nice, the people behind the front desk were rude and not very helpful. I went online during our stay and noticed that they were offering the same room we were staying in for 40 Euro less per night. When I asked them to change my rate they said it was impossible. When I told them to cancel my remaining reservation and we would lodge elsewhere, they changed my rate. This is a nice hotel but the Golden Tulip Barbizon Palace is just as quiet, has larger rooms and is just a stone's throw from Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “A really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: tedkop
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, Staff is frendly and attentive. Its central to almost everything. The bed and pillows where fantastic. The High Noon Tea in the lobby is resonable and the food is great, as well as the view of Dam Square. Be careful making phone calls especially to cell phones its very pricey

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mtmartian32
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic! Helpful and courteous staff. The room was fabulous! The breakfast buffet was to die for! Fantastic location, right in the middle of dam square. Everything is in walking distance from this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. What a great hotel situated right in heart of everything. The staff were so incredibly nice and could not do enough to make you comfortable.The room was wonderful and very very clean. If you have a problem with this you are either way too fussy or the type who would not be pleased with anything ie a saddo.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: cqdaniels
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in Dam Square though a little too close to the red-light area if you want to avoid that sort of thing. The room was small but perfect - I've never seen a bed so big before! They even give you a choice of pillows. The staff were all attentive and polite. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel as we thought it was a bit pricey, but there are loads of place to eat nearby. Did try the room service and that was excellent.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
HotelInfo.Address: Dam 9, Amsterdam 1012 JS, The Netherlands (Formerly Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky)
